But the U.S. must bring all of its resources to bear to prevent uncontrolled spread of nuclearweapons capability. If there is leverage remaining to the U.S., it is in the technological leadership and preeminence of American commercial nuclear technology which still sets the world standard for safety and safeguards.

title: Dividends Announced
description: IRREGULAR

title: Frustration Marks the End of Night Ferry Trips
description: With some forced to leave home as much as two hours early in order to get to work on time, and others forced to give up as much as two hours pay in order to get home at all, Staten Island terry riders greeted the end of allnight ferry service last night with a mixture of anguish, anger and resicon tion.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: William S. Paley, chairman of CBS Inc., announced yesterday the establishment of cultural center for Arab and Jewish children in Jerusalem. The center, to be named the Paley Center in honor of Mr. Paley's mother, Goldie Drell Paley, will be operated under the aegis of he Israel Museum.

title: Mayor's Long DayPlus Is a Futile Albany Quest
description: ALBANY, July 1Do you think I can wear a site 15 shirt? Mayor Beame asked at 2:15 this morning as he headed for the thirdfloor guest room at the Governor's Mansion and began considering such cares of the morrow as borrowed clothing, wildcat walkouts by city workers and the strange ways of bargaining by state government leaders.

title: U. S. Jury Assesses I.B.M. $11.4Million In a Damage Suit
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., July 1 (AP)A sixmember Federal court jury today assessed I.B.M. $11.4million in compensatory damages in a suit brought by an East Providence jewelry concern.

title: Brazil, Racing for Growth, Tries to Rely Less on U.S.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 1Brazil, striving dynamically to achieve bigpower status before the end of the century, is both modeling her efforts after the United States and taking her distance from it.

title: Film Editor, 33, Is Shot to Death On E. 84th Street
description: A 33year old ABC television film editor was found shot to death on a sidewalk on the upper East Side early yesterday morning, shortly after he had left a neighborhood bar to walk to his home at 302 East 88th Street.

title: An Abzug Assault On Multinationals Women Exploited
description: MEXICO CITY, July 1Representative Bella Abzug told a session of the international Women's Year Tribune today that her own country had a third world of women, and prominent among them were the women apparel workers of New York City.

title: MRS. GANDHI GIVES PROGRAM TO EASE ECONOMIC PLIGHT
description: NEW DELHI, July 1Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, appealing for public support to end India's political crisis, announced tonight a broad program of economic reforms that she said would better the lot of the average citizen.

title: DELURY INSISTS CONTROL IS LOST
description: The president of the Sanitartionmen's union insisted yesterday that he had lost control of his members and could not get them to go back to work.

title: Japan Drops Loz Curbs
description: TOKYO, July 1 (AP)  Japan's forestry agency said today it had droped its twoyearold administrative curbs on log imports from the United States. Officials said the curbs were dropped because Japanese log imports were not expected to rise sharply in the near future.

title: LOUISE M. HARDING
description: Louise M. Harding, secretary to Bishop Francis J. Mugaverol of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, died yesterday in Holy Family Hospial, Brooklyn. She was in her 60's and lived at 360 Clinton Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: What Can You Do? People Ask
description: New Yorkers seemed to feel sorrow rather than anger when their garbage was not picked up yesterday, but above all they seemed to feel resignation. If there was one predominant mood, it was captured almost precisely by the wife of an apartment house superintendent in Astoria, Queens.

title: LATIN CATHOLICS QUITTING CHURCH
description: MIAMI, July 1  Hispanic Roman Catholics, who account for more than 60 per cent of the total in the Archdiocese of Miami, are leaving the church in large numbers.

title: ADMIRAL DEFENDS BANK INVESTMENT
description: POINT MUGU, Calif., July 1 (UPI)Rear Adm. John M. Thomas, commander of the Pacific Missile Test Center, said today that there was no impropriety in his investment with other Navy officers in a bank at Pensacola, Fla.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Horses listed in order at post positions Letter designates OTB listing FIRST$8,000, cl., 3 and 4Y0. 6f.

title: Arms Talks Reopen Today
description: GENEVA. July 1The United States and Soviet delegations have arrived for the resumption tomorrow after a twomonth recess of the negotiations on a 10year accord limiting their strategic offensive nuclear arms.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: As a result of an error in editing, the State Health Department's monthly list of nursing homes with operating deficiencies was published in The New York Times yesterday as a list of nursing homes that are closing. None of the homes named faces closure proceedings.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: ESCAPE TO WITCH MOUNTAIN, directed be John Hough; starring Eddie Albert and Ray Milland, at neighborhood theaters.

title: Yonkers Results
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% State tax.)

title: $90Million Fraud Suit Filed Here Against Perot
description: H. Ross Perot, the Texas computer millionaire, was sued for $90million here yesterday on fraud charges arising out of the 1973 merger of duPont Glore Forgan, Inc., and Walston & Co., two former brokerage houses.

title: Ferocity of Lebanon's Strife Has Deep Roots in Religious and Class Fears,
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 1 In the last two and a half months, Beirut has probably seen at least as much violence between Christians and Moslems as Belfast has seen in six, years of conflict between Roman Catholics and Protestants.

title: Indian Held as Material Witness In the Slaying of 2 F. B. I. Agents
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., July 1The Federal authorities were holding an unidentified Indian as a material witness today in the slaying of two Federal Bureau of Investigation agents in a gun battle on this Sioux reservation last Thursday.

title: STRIKE INVOLVED ROCKEFELLER IN 68
description: A proposal by Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller for a state takeover of the city Sanitation Department for the duration of a health emergency ended the nineday sanitation strike in February, 1968, which had piled nearly 100,000 tons of refuse along the city's streets.

title: Builders Investment Group Omits Interest Payment
description: The Builders Investment Group, areal estate trust, announced yesterday that it would not pay the interest due on its $32million of 7 per cent subordinated debentures at this time.

title: Ali, Frazier Make a $1Million Side Bet
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, July 1Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier shook hands today on a $1million side bet for their world heavyweight championship showdown in Manila that will be shown in the United States on closedcircuit TV on Sept. 30.

title: SYNOD BACKS RIGHTS FOR HOMOSEXUALS
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 1Delegates to the General Synod of the United Church of Christ voted 546 to 135 today to support civil rights legislation for homosexuals.

title: Organists Occupy Carnegie's Spotlight
description: There are several reasons one can think of as to why the Hammond Organ Company has chosen to sponsor a Jazz on the Hammond program for the last two Newport Jazz Festivals. Perhaps the company just loves jazz. Perhaps it wishes in a general way to spread its name around among jazz buffs. Or perhaps Hammond is fearful of the competition from newer types of electronic keyboard instruments.

title: Amin Offers Pardon
description: President Idi Amin of Uganda announced yesterday that he had decided to pardon Denis Cecil Hills, the British teacher he had sentenced to death. Page 3.

title: National League
description: Chicago 5, New York 4 (10 inn.).

title: Shipping/Mails
description: MIKHAIL Leit Bermuda June 30, due 8LERMONTOV Baltic. A.M. at W. 50th St.

title: What Can You Do? People Ask
description: New Yorkers seemed to feel sorrow rather than anger when their garbage was not picked up yesterday, but above all they seemed to feel resignation. If there was one predominant mood, it was captured almost precisely by the wife of an apartment house superintendent in Astoria, Queens.

title: About the Yankees
description: The Yankees are disappointed that Graig Nettles continues to lag behind in AllStar balloting despite the fine season he's having. He's fourth in thirdbase voting behind Buddy Bell (229), Sal Bando (206) and Dave Chalk (292 but no homers and 30 runs batted in). Nettles is hitting 285 and has 12 homers and 51 runs batted in.  Someone remarked in the Yankee dugout Monday night that the Ron Blomberg baseball camp opened in Paramus, N.J., that day. It opened today? Ron Blomberg asked. Then after a moment he added, I didn't know what today's date was. The Yankees have a lively weekend coming up at Shea for their series with Baltimore35 Miss Universe finalists will be introduced before Friday night's game and will pass out AllStar ballots, Saturday is Ball Day, and on Sunday Woody Herman and His New Thundering Herd will perform between games of the doubleheader.

title: LaidOff Policemen Block Brooklyn Bridge Traffic
description: An angry crowd of 500 newly dismissed police officers marched on City Hall in protest yesterday and then stormed onto the approaches to the Brooklyn Bridge, creating major traffic tieups in lower Manhattan during the evening rush hour.

title: U.S. Technicians Role Seen in New Sinai Pact
description: JERUSALEM, July 1 (AP)Israeli newspapers said today that American technicians might be asked to serve in any new Sinai buffer zone between Israeli and Egyptian armies.

title: Cubs Win in 10th, 54, As Mets Rally in Vain
description: A 45foot single by Jerry Morales of the Chicago Cubs beat the New York Mets, 54, in 10 innings at Shea Stadium last night.

title: Smit First in Cycle Leg
description: MERLINPLAGE, France, July 1 (UPI)Theo Smit of the Netherlands sprinted ahead of Rik Van Linden and Eddy Merckx of Belgium in the last 200 yards today to win the fifth stage of the Tour de France cycle race.

title: ELECTRIC POWER USE
description: Percentage changes in sale of electric power for three basic categories of use for the first five months of 1975 compared with the similar period a year ago.

title: Wore Power Consumedby Small Users
description: The use of electric power by individuals and commercial businesses is on the upswing again this year, despite record high power bills, widespread unemployment and the recession. But for big industrial users of electrical power, consumption continues to be down sharply.

title: U.S. Wrestlers Win
description: TOKYO, July 1 (AP)High school wrestling teams from Utah and Montana won their sixth and seventh straight matches without a defeat today in a goodwill series in Japan.

title: Yesterday's Results at Bowie
description: FIRST$3,200, cl., 3YO, 6f.

title: WHEAT CASE WON BY CONTINENTAL
description: The Continental Grain Company, the nation's largest commodity exporter, has won a landmark arbitration decision against a Turkish State agency that could have a profound impact on international commodity dealings.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Eastern Utilities Associates sold yesterday 310,000 common shares at $15.25 each through Kidder, Peabody & Co. Inc., group. Proceeds would be used to reduce bank debt, the utility said.

title: Brazil, Racing for Growth, Tries to Rely Less on U.S.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 1Brazil, striving dynamically to achieve bigpower status before the end of the century, is both modeling her efforts after the United States and taking her distance from it.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: As a result of an error in editing, the State Health Department's monthly list of nursing homes with operating deficiencies was published in The New York Times yesterday as a list of nursing homes that are closing. None of the homes named faces closure proceedings.

title: As the Conference Ends, What Now for Women?
description: MEXICO CITY, July 1Elizabeth Reid of Australia stated the militant feminist viewpoint here when she said, In the world outside, we are ignored, we are invisible, we are not important.

title: Physicians Urged to Widen Understanding of Placebos
description: The medical profession should devote further study to understanding the placebo effect, which is an important, but often neglected, aspect of the patientdoctor relationship, according to an article published last week in a leading medical journal.

title: Now Sailors W will Dress Like Officers As Bell Bottoms and Gob Hats Go Out
description: NORFOLK, Va., July 1After a century of sartorial servicein war, peace and romance  bellbottomed trousers and white gob hats were jettisoned today by a United States,. Navy more concerned with postVietnam recruiting statistics than salty sentiment.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Governor Byrne announced that he had signed legislation providing periodic evaluations of nontenured public school teachers. Mr. Byrne signed the bill late Monday night, but the signing was not noticed in the frantic atmosphere of a final legislative attempt to head off massive budget cuts before the new fiscal year began.

title: Cry, the Beloved City
description: Weep for New York. Driven to the brink of bankruptcy by irresponsible political leaders, scorned in Albany, Washington and Wall Street, a stricken city now has come under savage assault by those who owe it the most, and whose own futures are most intimately linked to the city's fate its uniformed civil servants.

title: MILK COOP BOARD BLAMED IN GIFTS
description: SAN ANTONIO Tex., July 1 (UPI)The former general manager of the nation's largest dairy cooperative testified today that its board of directors was aware that contributions were being made illegally from corporate funds before the 19721 election.

title: BLACKOUT IS EASED ON NURSING HOMES
description: The Social Security Administration yesterday lifted a blackout on cost reports filed by providers of Medicare. But it continued to withhold information for policy reasons, on why many overpayment claims dating to 1967 have remained unresolved, and why charges of fraud were not pursued.

title: Miss Kuykendall Scores 2 Victories
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., July 1 Kathy Kuykendall of Miami and Jeanne Evert of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., each scored two victories today and reached the semifinals of the $10,000 Ms. America circuit tennis tournament at Grossinger's Hotel.

title: 4 TOP CONCERNS RAISE GAS PRICES UP TO 3C A GALLON
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Four major oil companies raised refinery gasoline prices by as much as 3 cents a gallon today, the start of the high season for summer vacations and motoring.

title: VAN TO GIVE TESTS ON BLOOD PRESSURE
description: A mobile health van will be stationed at some uptown thoroughfares on Mondays throughout this month and August in connection with the sixth annual Harlem Regional High Blood Pressure Program.

title: Playing Tricks On the Dead
description: MADRID  Voltaire once observed with more truth than generosity that history is nothing but a pack of tricks we play on the dead. Therefore I suppose it is not astonishing to come across an article by a prominent United States general claiming that Marshal Tito won only paper victories during World War II and, but for the British and the Americans, could easily have been wiped out by Croatian military forces.

title: Prof. Hans Furler is Dead at 71; Led Common Market Parliament
description: OBERKIRSCH, West Germany, July 1 (AP)Hans Furler, a founder of the European Common Market and former president of the European Parliament, died Sunday. He was 71 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer, Denis Healey, warned labor and management that the Government would move toward statutory controls on incomes and prices unless they devised a voluntary plan limiting wage increases to 10 per cent. The surprise statement in the House of Commons was the strongest move yet to curb Britain's soaring inflation. The pound sterling, which had been sliding, rose slightly on international markets, while the Labor party's left wing said legal restraints on free bargaining would violate Government pledges. [Page 1, Columns 23.]

title: About the Mets
description: Felix Milian, who leads Mets in hits, doubles and runs scored, is one of the 10 National League players who have appeared in all his team's games. Others are Pete Rose and Johnny Beach of Reds, Ron Cey and Steve Garvey of Dodgers, Dave Cash and Greg Luzinski of Phils, Ken Reitz of Cardinals, Ralph Garr of Braves and Roger Metzger Astros.  Craig Swan of Tidewater farm team pitched a 14inning, 10 victory over Memphis Monday night, raising his wonlost record to 95. Officials say he has apparently recovered from arm troubles, including stress fracture of elbow detected last fall The annual banner parade and contest will he held Aug. 5 between games of twilightnight doubleheader against Montreal. One of those games is a rescheduling of a game that was rained out at Shea May 4

description: Article 3  No Title

title: How the Garden Lost AliFrazier III
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, July 1In politics, the phrase is the smokefilled room. In boxing, it's the back room. But a room is a room is a room. By any other name, it would smell of intrigue. In boxing, as in politics, that's where the deals are made. The boxers are really puppets in a marionette show choreographed by the promoters in the back room. Muhammad All will defend the world heavyweight championship against Joe Frazier at Manila in a marionette show that belongs in Madison Square Garden where AliFrazier I and AliFrazier II were staged so spectacularly. But mysteriously, just when it appeared that the Garden had AliFrazier RI, the Garden executives let the promoters from the Philippines pull the strings. And now Madison Square Garden will be just another closedcircuit TV location Sept. 30 instead of a worldwide stage. How the Garden lost AliFrazier III in the back room involves two airline reservations to to Chicago that were canceled and a followup phone call that never came.

description: Article 4  No Title

title: JUNE AUTO OUTPUT DECLINED BY 4.2%
description: DETROIT, July 1  The United States auto industry built 632,134 cars in June, the best month of 1975 but still 4.2 per cent below the yearearlier level.

title: Manders Retires
description: DALLAS, July 1, (AP)Dave Manders, a 10year veteran with the Dallas Cowboys of the National Football League, retired today. Team officials said Manders, who has been the regular center for punts and placement kicks for the last two years, would do the color commentary on Cowboy preseason games.

title: Business Records
description: JOHN M. PLUMMLR, 18 Iniervale Ave., North White Plains, N.Y. Liabilites $8,387, assets $35.

title: DR. HOEKENDIJK, 63, MISSIONS PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Johannes Christian Hoekendijk, who had been professor of missions at Union Theological Seminary since 1965, died last Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, while swimming in Long Island Sound. He was 63 years old.

title: A Way to Staten Island If You Miss the Boat
description: With nighttime Staten Island ferry service curtailed because of the budget cuts, Staten Island residents who miss the last boat at 11:30 P.M., from South Ferry to St. George can get home on public transportation by the following route.

title: Gold Sale Nears World Price As U.S. Sells 499,500 Ounces
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Thc Treasury sold today almost exactly the 500,000 ounces of gold it offered at auction at a price only slightly below lhat of the world market. The price of gold closed today in London at $166.50.

title: Bari is Asked on Vinyl Chloride in Food Packages
description: WASHINGTON, July 1The Federal Government was asked today to ban the use of food packages made from polyvinyl chloride on the ground that a cancercausing residue from the widely used plastic has been found in such products as vegetable oils, mouth washes meats and medicines.

title: VIOLENCE FLARES
description: Tons of garbage piled up on the city's streets yesterday as 10,000 sanitationmen, protesting the layoffs of 2,934 of their coworkers, began a walkout that Sanitation Commissioner Robert T. Groh called the best organized wildcat strike I've ever seen.

title: 5 Killed at Rendering Plant
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, July 1 (UPI) Dr. William Adrion, Franklin County coroner, said today that methane gas may have killed five men who died in a 20foot animal rendering pit at Inland Products, Inc. Soap, fertilizer and other products are made at the plant from animal carcasses. The victims were four workmen and a fireman who attempted to rescue them.

title: MRS. GANDHI GIVES PROGRAM TO EASE ECONOMIC PLIGHT
description: NEW DELHI, July 1Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, appealing for public support to end India's political crisis, announced tonight a broad program of economic reforms that she said would better the lot of the average citizen.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Subcommittee on Small Colonial Territories  10:30 A.M.

title: Carey's Assistance in Oil Deal Reported
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Federal Energy Administration ofare said to have obtained two documents that discuss reports of the involvement of (Governor Carey, when he was a member of the House of Representatives, in a controversial oil deal involving his brother. Edward M. Carey.

title: Harry Morris, Set Record For Navy Enlisted Service
description: SAN DIEGO, June 30 (AP)Harry Morris, who was on active duty in the Navy longer than any other enlisted man in history, died Sunday at 87.

title: Mobil Plans a Job Review Following Suit by Women
description: BEAUMONT, Tex., July 1 (AP)Mobil Oil Corporation said today that it would begin an immediate review of employe qualifications following Federal court order to stop any potentially discriminatory practices against women.

title: Gambino BrotherinLaw Cited Om Usury and Evasion of Taxes
description: Paul Castellano, a DrolflerInlaw of Carlo Gambino and a reputed captain in his crime) family, was indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of usury and incometax evasion.

title: Monday's Fights
description: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia Muhammad Ali, 225 pounds. Cherry Hill, N. J., outpointed Joe Bugner, 230. England. 15 rounds, to retain his world heavyweight title.

title: 9 Food Establishments Listed as Code Violators
description: The Health Department has listed nine more food establishments that, it said, failed their second Health Code inspection and warned that failure to pass a third inspection could result in closing orders.

title: Radio
description: 7:3010:30 A.M., WKCRFM. String Trio, Toch; Chamber Concerto, Cortes; Sonata in C minor, Schubert; Age of Anxiety, Bernstein; Piano Concerto No. 1 in D, SaintSaens; Piano Concerto, Copland.

title: Detroit Editor Resigns
description: DETROIT, July 1, (AP) Paul A. Poorman. 94 years old, has resigned as managing editor of The Detroit News after six years in the post. No decision has been made on a successor.

title: TV: Local Stations Breaking Into Networks Time
description: The local stations are suddenly being allowed to in vade network prime time. In the last week, ABC has given Roger Grimsby, anchorman of WABC's Eyewitness News, the half hour between 9:30 and 10 P.M. to report on Korea: How Long the Morning Calm? WCBS was allowed an hour at 8 P.M. for The Great American History Test. And tonight, from 10 to 11, WNBC gets to offer Children of Violence, an essayproduced and written by Toni Shachtmanon street.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Firecrackers and the Fourth of July go together naturally. But in 1973, the last year for which statistics are available, there were about 6,000 firecrackerrelated injuries for which the victims needed treatment in hospital emergency rooms.

title: Tim Buckley, Rock Star, Is Dead at 28 on Coast,
description: LOS ANGELES, July 1 (AP) Tim Buckley, the rock star, died, apparently of a heart attack, on Sunday at the age of 28.

title: Funding Public TV
description: With Presidential politics warming up for the quadrennial fling, with educational institutions hardpressed and cutting back on teachers and learning tools, the need is greater than ever for a strong and sound public broadcasting system in the United States that can enlighten and educate freely, fairly, entertainingly and analytically.

title: Mrs. Farkas Said to Blame Wyman for Deal for Post
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Ruth L. Farkas, the American Ambassador to Luxembourg, told the Watergate grand jury last spring that she won her diplomatic post in a direct and explicit exchange for a $300,000 contribution to the Nixon reelection campaign of 1972, according to a source close to the Farkas family in New vmle.

title: Monzon, Valdes (Middleweight Champions of the World) May Meet in October
description: Carlos Monzon, the World Boxing Association middleweight champion, says his manager is negotiating with the World Boxing Council champion, Rodrigo Valdes, for a bout that would put the title under one roof.

title: Why the Tax on Cranberry Juice?
description: A shopper in a supermarket, who bad just moved to New York from another state and was laying in week's supply of food, watched clerk ring up prices for such items as prune juice, tomato juice, pear nectar, and cranberry juice. The amount was totaled, but then the clerk rang up something else sales  tax.

title: DOMINICK MAURILLO, UROLOGIST, 77, DEAD
description: Dr. Dominick F. Maurillo, a retired urologist and former member of the State Board of Regents, died Monday at Bal Harbour, Fla. He was 77 years old and lived in Bal Harbour.

title: Dance. Ballet Theater in a Nureyev Raymonda
description: American Ballet Theater seems to be giving us nothing but galas during its 30th anniversary yearlast night at the New York State Theater, at the start of its annual six weeks season, it came up with another, and yet another is just around the corner, later in the month. In fact, last night's performance was called, quite properly, a gala premiere, for it introduced to New York, Rudolf Nureyev's sumptuous new production of Ravmonda.

title: James Havender, 83, Dies; Cited as Active Lifeguard
description: James Havender, a retired lawyer and one of the country's oldest active lifeguards, died Saturday at Cape Cod Hosipital, Hyannis, Mass. He was 183 years old and made his summer home in East Brewster, Mass.

title: Behind the Walls
description: The unanimous decision by the United States Supreme Court on the rights of confined mental patients can lead to greater awareness and better treatment for tens of thousands of unfortunate people who have been neglected by state and society. This possible turnaround in attitudes toward those who are forgotten behind high institutional walls could be more significant than the comparatively limited extension of their legal rights.

title: A Bitter Debate in State Senate Marks Defeat of Bill on Environmental Suits
description: ALBANY, July 1A bill to permit citizens to sue to protect the environment was defeated in the Senate today after a sponsor denounced one of the bill's opponents so bluntly and bitterly that his remarks brought whistles and murmurs of astonishment from the other Senators.

title: People in Sports
description: Chuck Foreman, the National Football League's touchdown leader (15) last season and also Minnesota's leading rusher (777 yards) and receiver (53 catches) has signed a threeyear contract extending his obligation to the Vikings through 1978. Before leading Minnesota into Super Bowl IX last January, which they lost to Pittsburgh, Foreman was quoted as saying he was thinking of retiring at the end of his original threeyear contract, which still had a year to run. However, upon signing his new pact yesterday the Vikings firstround choice and rookie of the year in 1973 said: I'm happy playing football, I'm happy with my contract. I'm happy with the Vikings.

title: Tuition at State Colleges Raised 50% As Impasse Continues on Budget Cuts
description: TRENTON, July 1  The Board of Higher Education today ordered a 50 per cent increase in tuition at the state's public colleges as the impasse continued here between the State Senate and Assembly over how to finance $384million in budget cuts ordered by Governor Byrne to balance the state budget.

title: Hawks Lack Cash To Sign Thompson
description: The questionable status of the Atlanta Hawks ownership could cost the team a chance to sign David Thompson, its No. 1 draft choice and the college player of the year last season.

title: TY TAXAID TALK FAILS IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, July 1The first facetoface talks among Governor Carey, Mayor Beame and the Republican leaders of the Legislature disintegrated late this afternoon without any resolution of the question of additional taxes for New York City and with no indication of how the partisan impasse would now he broken.

title: Defeats Split Bitter House Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, July 1The Democrats in the House of Representativeswho began this year with a huge majority and ambitions of guiding the nation's policies  are fractured today by rancor of an intensity seldom seen in the normally chummy atmosphere of Congress.

title: WISCONSIN AIDE DUE FOR INSPECTION POST
description: WASHINGTON, July 1 (AP) Donald E. Wilkinson, a Wisconsin state farm official, reportedly is in line to take over a key agency in the Agriculture Department charged with carrying out the Government's troubled grain inspection program.

title: CITY TAXAID TALK FAILS IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, July 1The first facetoface talks among Governor Carey, Mayor Beanie and the Republican leaders of the Legislature disintegrated late this afternoon without any resolution of the question of additional taxes for New York City and with no indication of how the partisan impasse would now he broken.

title: Englewood Fears a Cut in School Aid May End Reduction in Realty Taxes
description: ENGLEWOOD, July 1After a year of paring costs through fiscal and management reforms that led to a reduction in the real estate tax rate here, this minicosmopolis may have to wipe out the savings to the taxpayer and increase substantially the tax rate to offset threatened cuts in state educational aid.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Ford Tells Justice Department To Abide by Ruling on Wiretaps
description: WASHINGTON, July 1 President Ford has directed the Department of Justice to abide by a Federal court ruling that bars warrantless wiretaps of domestic organizations, even if foreign affairs or national security matters are involved, the White House said today.

title: Manufacturers Cut Inventories in May
description: WASHINGTON, July 1 Manufacturers achieved a nearrecord reduction in their inventories in May as a further prelude to a revival of production in the economy, the Commerce department reported today.

title: Advertising
description: Although the annual spending power of American blacks is put at around $60billion, marketing research on that segment of the population is poor.

title: I.R.S. ELABORATES ON BRIBES STUDY
description: WASHINGTON. July 1The Internal Revenue Service is working with foreign tax officials in its investigation of illegal payments made by American corporations through their foreign affiliates.

title: School Tax Rises Feared H State Aid is Trimmed
description: The legislative battle over school aid now being waged in Albany could end with a solution forcing hundreds of school districts in the state to choose between slashing programs or raising taxes above the level voters expected when they approved local budgets.

title: Mystery at Henley Leaky M.I.T. Boats
description: HENLEY  ON  THAMES England, July I (AP)Massachusetts Institute of Technology took its seventh boat onto the River Thames today and, like the six others the heavyweight eight had used in the last four days, it leaked.

title: MARLEY IN A DEAL WITH SINGER UNIT
description: The Singer Company, the large international sewing, textile and business machine manufacturer, said yesterday that it had signed a letter of intent with the Marley Company of Mission, Kan., to sell its water resources division to Marley for more than $10million in cash. As of April 30, the division had total assets of about $30million and Singer reported division sales in 1974 of some $52million. The division makes deep well turbine pumps, industrial vertical pumps, casings and screens.

title: CITY'S 10,000 SANITAT1ONMEN STRIKE; POLICE AND FIREMEN ALSO DISCUSS JOB ACTIONS TO PROTEST LAYOFFS
description: CITY'S 10,000 SANITAT1ONMEN STRIKE; POLICE AND FIREMEN ALSO DISCUSS JOB ACTIONS TO PROTEST LAYOFFS

title: Scott Joplin Opera, Treemonisha, Set for Broadway
description: Treemonisha, the only extant stage work of the ragtime composer Scott Joplin, will be brought to Broadway next fall.

title: Tennis Results
description: Quarterfinal RoundLoulsa Cilla, Milestone, Queens, defeated Jane Weed New York, 61, 64; Pat Stewart, Elmhurst, Queens, de. feated Gerry Modes, Scarsdale, 62, 6.4; Adrla Price, Roslyn fielehts, L.I., defeated Barbara Steger, Albany, 61, 61; Eleanor Wright, Suffern, defeated Vila Tamuza, Port Washington, L.I., 64, 64

title: 2 Victims in Car Crash Helped by Imperiale
description: TRENTON, July 1 (UPI)State Senator Anthony Imperiale, Independent of Essex, heading home from a long Senate session, stopped to administer exygen to two passengers after a car accident early this morning, the police said.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: In Independent Mozambique, the Struggle to Implant Marxist Policies Begins
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, June 28For the highly ideological new rulers of Mozambique, the advent of fall independence is only the beginning of a maior struggle to implant their marxist policies and create a new man on the African continent. The Mozambique Liberation Front  Frelimo from its acronym in the Portuguese languagehas ordered a purge and purification of its ranks. Its publicly outlined strategy indicates that the party will deliberately keep the country in a semipermanent state of political and psychological turmoil in an effort to avoid complacency and backsliding.

title: No. Amer. Soccer League
description: No Amer Soccer League

title: Pacing Filly Stays Unbeaten at Goshen
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., July 1Top Lady Almahurst, an unbeaten pacer, swept both heats today and captured the $15,995 Debutante Stakes for 2yearold fillies at Historic Track.

title: Home Accused of Balking On Refunds in Medicare
description: The owners of a Far Rockaway, Queens, nursing home were accused yesterday of having refused to repay the Government nearly $42,000 in Medicare overpayments received from Jan. 1, 1967, to June 30, 1969.

title: Swede's Run Sets Record
description: STOCKHOLM, July 1 (AP) Anders Garderud, Sweden's longdistance running star, set a world record in the 3,000meter steeplechase with a time of 8 minutes 9.69 seconds today at an international meet.

title: U. S. THREATENED TO GET INJUNCTION
description: City officials agreed last night on a compromise plan for keeping seven drawbridges open to marine traffic after the Coast Guard took the matter to a Federal judge and threatened to seek an injunction.

title: Brazil Leader Ousts Senator in Corruption Case
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 1President Ernesto Geisel used his special powers today to deprive a Governmentparty senator of his political rights for involvement in a case of corruntion.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Chicago Cubs, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M. (Television  Channel 9, P.M.) (Radio  WNEW, 8 P.M.)

title: New Books
description: A Wake for the Living: A Family Chronicle, reminiscences by Andrew Lytle (Crown Publishers, $8.95).

title: American Air and Pan Am To Transfer Some Routes
description: The White House yesterday approved American Airlines, Int., transferring its mainland to Hawaii routes to the South Seas, including Australia and New Zealand, to Pan American World Airways. At the same time, the White House agreed to Pan American's transferring its United States to Bermuda routes and its nonstop New York to San Domingo and New York to Barbados routes to American Airlines.

title: HERBERT G. ODZA
description: Herbert G. Odza, retired chairman of the Dunhill International List Company, died Sunday at his home in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 84 years old.

title: Japanese Reserves Increase
description: TOKYO, July 1 (Reuters)Japan's external reserves rose $47milion during June to $14million at the end of the month, the Finance Ministry said. Finance Ministry sources said ??? visible trade acount returned to surplus in June, after a deficit of $19milion in May.

title: AMEX PRICES SLIP AS TRADING EASES
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange, halted a nineday advance and fell yesterday in slackened trading. Prices also fell in the overthecounter market, where volume rose.

title: HELPWANTED INDEX HOLDS UNCHANGED
description: The Conference Board has reported that the, helpwanted advertising index leveled off in May. The index, at 71, is unchanged from the April level and is 1 point above the March reading, but 44 points below the level of May, 1974.

title: Company Reports
description: For periods ended May 31 unless otherwlse Indicated unless

title: Books of The Times
description: For what shall I begin praising Richard Holmes's huge life of the poet Percy Bysshe Shelley, which I took with me on a weeklong vacation in New England and found a distraction from sleeping, swimming, fishing, eating and other activities I'd planned to get my mind off books? For setting the Shelley record straight at last, for shooting down a bird that never wert? This is the book's importance. As Mr. Holmes makes clear, the seeds of the myth were sown in the English Romantic poet's life. Had Shelley not exiled himself from his social class and country, his most radical political statements might have been published. (As it was, with Shelley in until nis aeatn In 1622, nls puonsners would have had to bear the brunt alone of the English Government's repressive laws, and for various reasons declined to do so.)

title: Widening Effect Expected In Pennsylvania Walkout
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 1The first statewide strike of Pennsylvania employes began today.

title: Okun Law on the Jobless Seems to Prevail
description: At his news conference last week, President Ford hinted that Okun's Law could be broken. Most economists, however, doubt it. For Okun's Law, like the laws of nature, seems to prevail. The law  a statistical equation formulated in 1961 by Arthur M. Okun, a Yale University professor working then on the staff of the President's Council of Economic Advisers  describes the relationship between changes in the unemployment rate and changes in the level of overall economic activity.

title: Silver, Cocoa and Sugar Are Hit by Profit Taking
description: Silver, cocoa and sugar prices dropped in futures trading in London and in New York as the British pound, weak on Monday, rose.

title: All Called Losers in Jersey Tax Battle
description: TRENTONJuly 1The legislative tax battle in New Jersey between Governor Byrne and the huge Democratic majorities in both houses culminated early this morning in bitter recriminations, partisan divisiveness and impotence, and threat of criminal libel action. Unlike most legislative fights that have clear winners and losers, the tax battle seems to provide only losers this afternoon and everyone, it seemed, tended to behave that way.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Pentagon has notified Congress that it planned to sell to Spain improved Hawk antiaircraft missiles for $106.7million. The missile is made by the Raytheon Company.

title: 50% Increase Ordered in State College Tuition in Jersey
description: TRENTON, July 1  The Board of Higher Education today ordered a 50 per cent increase in tuition at the state's public colleges as the impasse continued here between the State Senate and Assembly over how to finance $384million in budget cuts ordered by Governor Byrne to balance the state budget.

title: Auxiliary Policemen Told Not to Go on Street Patrol
description: The president of the Auxiliary Police Benevolent Association urged his members not to go out on street patrol yesterday because of the reduction in the police force that took place yesterday.

title: CITY'S 10,000 SANITATIONMEN STRIKE; POLICE AND FIREMEN ALSO DISCUSS JOB ACTIONS TO PROTEST LAYOFFS
description: CITY'S 10,000 SANITATIONMEN STRIKE; POLICE AND FIREMEN ALSO DISCUSS JOB ACTIONS TO PROTEST LAYOFFS

title: Jazz Events
description: Noon to 2 P.M., Equitable Life Plaza, Avenue of the Americas and 51st Street Bobby Hackett, Vic Dickenson, John Bunch, Johnny Mince, Milt Hinton and Jackie Williams (free).

title: Thailand and China Establish Relations, Widening Peking Links With South Asia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July 1 Thailand and China established formal diplomatic relations today further cementing the ties between Peking and Southeast Asia that have developed since the recent Communist victories in Indochina.

title: Secrecy Described in 1970 Grain Deal
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 1 A local executive of Cook Industries, Inc., arranged for complete secrecy in unloading a cargo of corn that was rejected by Mexican buyers in 1970 because it had an unacceptable amount of broken kernels.

title: New Rights Agency Chief Urges Education as Aid for Minorities
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Thei newly appointed chairman of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission called tonight for greater emphasis oni education as a means to expand job potential of minorities and said that there was a need to reeducate educators.

title: Howard I. Chapelle Dies at 74; Marine Historian and a Writer
description: LEWES, Del., July 1 (AP)Howard J. Chapelle, a marine writer and historian, died yesterday at a hospital here. He was 74 years old.

title: ARGENTINE CRISIS OVER PAY EASES
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 1The political crisis in Argentina eased somewhat today as the Government and Peronist labor leaders agreed to continue nelgotiations over wage disputes.

title: Yesterday's Results at Delaware
description: FIRST$4,500, cl, 3YO and up, lm. and 70 yas.

title: Cosmos Get A Rematch On Protest
description: Phil Woosnam, commissioner of the North American Soccer League, upheld last night the New York Cosmos protest of a game they lost in Boston against the Minutemen on June 20, during which Pele was mobbed by spectators. The game will be replayed on Sunday, Aug. 3.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: David L. Malbin, an 88yearold retired State Supreme Court Justice now living in Florida, was acquitted in Federal Court in Florida of charges of abetting an alleged embezzlement scheme involving the International Production, Service and Sales Employes Union. In granting a defense motion for acquittal, Judge John F. Dooling Jr. said the Government had not really shown felonious intent on the part of either Mr. Malbin or the union officials. Mr. Malbin was said to have accepted nearly $400 in expenses to attend union convention in Miami Beach in 1968.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: FUN AND GAMES Oliver's (7539180) is a pub of rising popularity, operated by a young Briton named Michael Wharton and wedged into the business area at 141 East 57th Street (five doors east of Lexington Avenue). Something new has just been added up front by the small oval window piano music for the cocktail crowd and diners. Larry Biedes, at the keyboard, is something of a Dub original.

title: SCIENCE RESEARCH HURT BY INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Because of the effects of inflation, there will be an S per cent drop in real spending for basic scientific research in the United States this year as compared with spending in 1974, according to an estimate just published by the National Science Foundation.

title: GURNEY DEFENDS ACTIONS ON FUND
description: TAMPA, Fla, July 1Saying, that he has a very poor memory for details, former Senator Edward J. Gurney testified in his own defense today that he had no recollection of having hired Larry E. Williams, a fundraiser in 1971

title: Mets Records
2 LaidOff Policemen Accused of Beating a Man
description: Two city police officers, who had just been laid off and were leaving a farewell beer party Outside their station house, rieat up a 19yearold black youth on a Harlem street early yesterday morning, poured beer over him and yelled racial epithets into his face, a Police bepartment spokesman and witnesses said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A grand jury dismissed charges against Peter Yew, whose involvement in a minor traffic accident in Chinatown last April led to marches on City Hall by thousands of Chinese protesting police brutality and calling for an end to discrimination against residents of Chinatown. Mr. Yew was originally charged with felonious assault, which was later reduced to a misdemeanor. A grand jury was then impaneled to investigate the case. The grand jury is still deliberating charges that police officers had beaten up Mr. Yew in the police station. Dismissal of the charges against Mr. Yew had been one of the principal demands by Chinese protesters Hall.

title: JACK N. STENBUCK OF HEARST PAPERS
description: Jack M. Stenbuck, general circulation director of the Hearst Newspapers from 1955 until 1966, who was also writer, died yesterday in CedarsSinai Hospital in Los Angeles. He was 75 years old and lived in the Brentwood section of Los Angeles.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, July 1 (AP)The Automobile Importers America says allegations that import companies are dumping cars on the United States market are shotgun charges based on myths. In a letter filed with the Treasury Department in Washington, the A.I.A.which represents all imports except Volkswagen and MercedesBenzasked that a complaint from Representative John H. Dent, Democrat of Pennsylvania, be dismissed.

title: Schlesinger Says U.S Is Willing To Use Nuclear Weapons First
description: WASHINGTON, July 1Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger affirmed today that the United States had not renounced the possible first use of nuclear weapons if faced with defeat in a conventional war.

title: H. F. Johnson, Educator, Dies; Figure in 68 Ocean Hill Dispute
description: Dr. Herbert F. Johnson, an educator who unsuccessfully tried to bring peace to the stormy Ocean HillBrownsville school district in Brooklyn in 1968, died yesterday at Halifax Hospital, Daytona Beach, Fla. He was 67 years old and lived in nearby Deland.

title: Opera Buffs Jam Park for Butterfly
description: With just about perfect weather to encourage them, opera buffs began marking their spots in Central Park's Sheep Meadow yesterday morning in anticipation of last night's opening concert of Madama Butterfly. Puccini's opera, with Renata Scotto as the stalwart Butterfly, is the first in the series of eight free concerts the Metropolitan Opera is offering in city parks throughout the five horniiphs.

title: NW DIPS BY 1.57 IN PROFIT TAKING
description: Stocks started the second half of 1975 in a holding pattern.

title: Yonkers Entries
description: Horses listed in order of post position Letter designates OTB listing FIRST$6,000, pace, cond., mile.

title: Newport Jazz
description: In the front parlor or an East Side town house, the elegant furniture has been pushed aside for a piano, drums and an amplified bass.

title: Uganda Leader Says He Will Grant a Pardon to Briton
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, July 1 (AP) President Idi Amin of Uganda announced today that he had decided to pardon the Briton who had been sentenced to death by firing squad for calling the President a village tyrant.

title: Open Interest
description: (In contract Monday)

title: American League
description: Milwaukee 6, New York 3.

title: Physicians Urged to Widen Understanding of Placebos
description: The medical profession should devote further study to understanding the placebo effect; which is an important. but often neglected, aspect of the patientdoctor relationship, according to an article published last week in a leading medical journal.

title: Confident Miyama Band on Bill With Count Basie
description: The annual Big Band Ball presented by the Newport Jazz Festival at Roseland Ballroom is, in theory, anopportunity for jazz bands to go back to their original function as dance bands Ad for the audience to get out on the floor and dance to jazz. In practice, there is usually more standing around than dancing as the listeners crowd around the bandstand to get a closeup look at the musicians.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEWCOMERSTOWN, Ohio, July 1 (AP)A museum in honor of Cy Young, the pitcher with the most victories in baseball history, will open Friday with an array memorabilia on display, much of it from the Cy Young era of 18901911. There also will be bats used in big league games by such modern sluggers as Hank Aaron, Willie Mays, the late Roberto Clemente and Harmon Killebrew and caps from all major league clubs.

title: Sandlots Vanish, but Kids Still Play Baseball
description: When grass was used to slide on, millions of youngsters learned to play baseball on any patch of green they could find.

title: LaidOff Policemen Block Brooklyn Bridge Traffic
description: An angry crowd of 500 newly dismissed police officers, marched on City Hall in protest yesterday and then stormed onto the approaches to the Brooklyn Bridge, creating major traffic tieups in lower Manhattan during the evening rush hour.

title: FASHION TALK
description: If they want to truck them all over to my house, it would be all right, Glady Solomon sighed after seeing Adolfo's fall show yesterday.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Carey Aids State Unit On Sports
description: The proposal for the Offtrack Betting Corporation to take over the operations of Madison Square Garden has collapsed, but negotiations are under way in secret to revitalize the moribund New York State Sports Authority and have it manage not only the Garden but also Yankee and Shea Stadiums.

title: U. S. R. A. Gets First Equipment To Rebuild the Ailing Railroads
description: WASHINGTON, July 1 (AP) The United States Railway Association announced today that it had started receiving the equipment needed to rebuild financially ailing railroads in the Northeast and Middle West.

title: Major Says Troops Fired All Over at Kent State
description: CLEVELAND, June 30 (UPI) Maj. Harry D. Jones of the Ohio National Guard testified today that National Guard troops were firing all over the place when they shot and killed four students and wounded nine others during an antiwar demonstration at Kent State University on May 4. 1970.

title: Market Place
description: Stocks of leading group broadcasters  companies owning radio and television stationshave almost doubled in price from their lows at the end of 1974.

title: I.B.M. PARES PRICES OF DATA PRODUCTS
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday cuts of 10 to 15 per cent in purchase prices for certain data processing equipment, effective immediateiy. The company said there would be 151 per cent price cuts on the IBM; modSystem370 els 115 and 125 central processing units and for a number of terminal communications products.

title: Wise of Red Sox Loses NoHit Bid With Two Outs in 9th
description: Rick Wise of the Boston Red Sox, bidding to become only the second pitcher in modem major league history to hurl nohit games in both leagues, gave up consecutive homers in the ninth inning and settled for a twohit, 63 triumph over the Brewers in Milwaukee's County Stadium last night.

title: MRS GANDHI CALLS INDIA DEMOCRATIC EVEN UNDER CURBS
description: NEW DELHI, July 2Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today delivered a spirited defense of her Government's new authortarian position.

title: Land Banks Yield Is 7.20%Citicorp Plans Notes
description: Interest rates took another goodsized upward step yesterday as the credit markets became more convinced that the Federal Reserve had recently brought to an end its policy of credit ease that began in September, 1974. On June 17 the Federal Reserve apparently took a very tentative, small step toward restraint, and interest rates have climbed  perhaps excessively  ever since.

title: Cape Verde Voters Back Plan To Merge With GuineaBissau
description: PRAIA, Cape Verde Islands, July 2 (AP)Citizens of the Cape Verde Islands have voted overwhelmingly in favor of union with the newly independent West African nation of GuineaBissau, unofficial figures showed today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: CONCORDIA SEAHORSE (BoiseGrilitin), Las Palmas July 13 and Beirut 17; sails from Hoboken, N.J.

title: Civil Rights Lawyer Will Defend C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, July 2The Central Intelligence Agency, in a move that has surprised, mystified and angered various segments of Washington's legal community, has hired Arnold & Porter, one of the city's leading law firms, to serve as consulting counsel during Serrate and House hedrings on the agency.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Eleven persons have been dismissed from a federally subsidized job program in New Brunswick because of their participation in partisan politics. Edward Hardy, executive director of the country's Comprehensive Employment Administration, said the 11 had been discharged because his office had determined they were in violation of the Hatch Act, which prohibits Federal employes from participating in partisan political activities. He refused to identfy those who were discharged.

title: RACIAL TENSIONS STILL SEEN IN ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, July 2Army Secretary Howard M. Callaway said today that despite enormous progress in improving race relations in the military, there is still a lot of racial tension within the Army.

title: Community Leaders Protest Delafield Hospital Closing
description: A coalition of community leaders led by Representative Bella S. Abzug, obtained an order in State Supreme Court yesterday directing the city to show cause why the announced closing of Francis Delafield Hospital should not he nullified.

title: Demarest is Ruled Exempt From Court Zoning Decision
description: TRENTON, July 2 (AP)The Appellate Division of Superior Court ruled today that the recent State Supreme Court zoning decision did not apply to Demarest in Bergen County.

title: A Plan to Improve Status of Women Approved at Parley
description: MEXICO CITY, July 2The International Women's Year World Conference wound to an end here today after the adoption of a 10year plan of action designed to improve the status of the world's two billion women.

title: Magnet High Schools in City Are Pulling
description: The magnet high school, a new version of an old idea, may be setting a pattern for the future of secondary education ??? the city.

title: Books of The Times
description: Trendologyotherwise known as swimming with the aucourantis one of the minor functions of the book reviewer's office, so I will hereby register the observation that there has been a cluster of both fiction and nonfiction books this last year or so with comedians as heroes. The titles that spring to mind are Albert Goldman's Ladies and Gentlemen, Lenny Bruce!!, Brian Glanville's The Comic, Wallace Markfield's You Could Live if They Let You and Phil Berger's The Last Laugh, a study of a number of living comedians plying their manicdepressive trade. And now, add Irvin Faust's latest novel starring a comedian named Bart Goldwine.

title: MORE GROUPS RAISE PRICES OF GASOLINE
description: Several more oil companies announced yesterday higher wholesale prices for gasoline. The Sun Oil Company said it was increasing its price by 2 cents a gallon and was. conforming to Federal Energy Administration pricing regulations which permit refiners to increase prices to recover increased costs.

title: Embattled Mrs. Peron
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 2  A year after the death of Gen. Juan Domingo Peron, his broadly based movement bears little resemblance to anybody's concept of Peronism. The most visible evidence of this has been the demonstrations and strikes by scores of thousands of conservativt Peronist workers who nearly drove the general's Widow, President Isabel Martinez de News Perlin, from office Analysis in the last few days. That sort of labor unrest has rarely occurred even under nonPeronist governments in the last 30 years.

title: GURNEY TESTIFIES URGED INQUIRY
description: TAMPA, Fla., July 2Former Senator Edward J. Gurney testified today that in midJuly of 1973 he wrote a letter to Eliot L. Richardson, then the Attorney General, to ask for an investigation of a campaign fundraising operation conducted in Mr. Gurney's name.

title: MAYOR OF SEATTLE WINS RECALL VOTE
description: SEATTLE, July 2 Mayor Wes Uhlman's political future was somewhat brighter today after he put down a revolt within his city government and easily survived a recall vote yesterday, 77,009 to 44,741.

title: Bag Sites Listed
description: The following is a list of sites where garbage bags may be picked up beginning today.

title: Firecrackers on the Fourth: Peril or Fun?
description: In anticipation of tomorrow night's official Fourth of July festivities, children around the city have been setting off illegaland often dangerousfireworks in the last few days to the distress of strollers, dog walkers, mothers of recently puttobed babies, law enforcement officials and people who simply enjoy quiet.

title: Wilson Seeks Support for His AntiInflation Plans
description: LONDON, July 2  The Government of Prime Minister Harold Wilson moved today on several fronts to build public support, particularly among the trade unions, for its proposed measures to reduce Britain's high inflation rate.

title: Keating Resigns As Players Agent,
description: CLEVELAND, July 2 (AP) Ed Keating, a noted player agent, resigned from Mark McCormack's International Management. Inc. because he said his contract was one couldn't live with.

title: $300MILLION PLAN TO AID CITY DRAWN AT ALBANY PARLEY
description: A tentative plan that would allow the city to levy $300million more in taxes and that could ease its budget crisis and perhaps end its twoday wildcat sanitation strike was pronosed in Albany last night.

title: Brazil Air Force Issues Denial On Northrop Role of Generals
description: RIO DE JANEIRO. July 2The Brazilian Air Force Ministry said tonight that two Brazilian generals mentioned in a Northrop Corporation memorandum had nothing to do with the $72.3million purchase of 42 Northrop F5 fighter planes.

title: A Plan to Improve Status of Women Approved at Parley
description: MEXICO CITY, July 2The International Women's Year World Conference wound to an end here today after the adoption of a 10year plan of action designed to improve the status of the world's two billion women.

title: Companies Report Sales and Profits
description: For periods ended May 31 unless otherwise Indicated

title: Ford Seeking to Halt Expensive GiftGiving
description: WASHINGTON, July. 2 (AP)Betty Ford disclosed today that the President has been exchanging photographs in silver frames with visiting heads of state in an effort to eliminate the practice of expensive giftgiving on state visits.

title: ATHENS CLEARS 104 OF GUILT IN 67 COUP
description: ATHENS, July 2 (AP)The Greek Supreme Court today cleared 104 high officials of the former dictatorship of charges in connection with the military coup of April, 1967. It ruled that they had played no direct role in the armed forces seizure of Dower.

title: Open Interest
description: (In contract Tuesday)

title: Bonn's Independence From U.S. Is Gaining
description: BONN, July 2The American withdrawal from Indochina this spring shook and worried West Germany, the most powerful ally of the United States in Europe. But the Germans preoccupation was that America might turn away from them, not that West Germany should reappraise its transAtlantic ties.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Heavy rains in Minnesota and North Dakota apparently helped move soybean futures prices ahead on the Chicago Board of Trade. Also some traders talked about the prospect of higherthanaverage temperatures for this season later this week and next in the growing areas, which could lead to some dearth of moisture.

title: MRS. GANDHI CALLS INDIA DEMOCRATIC EVEN UNDER CURBS
description: NEW DELHI, July 2Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today delivered a spirited defense of her Government's new authoritarian position.

title: CAREY HIRES AIDE TO STUDY OIL CASE
description: ALBANY, July 2Governor Carey today hired Joseph A. Califano Jr., who served as an adviser to President Lyndon B. Johnson and is now a leading Washington lawyer, to undertake a full investigation of allegations that the Governor had used his influence to help arrange a big oil deal for his oilman brother.

title: Marseilles Police Report They Hold Big Drug Supplier
description: PARIS, July 2A man arrested a month and a half ago for carrying forged identity papers has been identified as a drug supplier and has been indicted in Marseilles, the police announced today.

title: MALL QUALIFIES ON MATCHING FUND
description: WASHINGTON, July 2Representative Morris K. Udall announced today that he had qualified for Federal matching funds for his campaign for the 1976 Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Mr. Healey's Ultimatum
description: The longawaited showdown in Britain's economic crisis is here. Chancellor of the Exchequer Denis Healey, speaking for the moderates in the Labor Government, has delivered what amounts to an ultimatum to the trade unions, and to the left wing of his own party, that future wage settlements must be held to a 10 per cent annual rate or the Government will impose a statutory wagecontrol (incomes) policy. The leftwingers in the Labor party rightly charge that Prime Minister Wilson would thereby be violating his campaign pledge not to impose wage controls; but the new Labor Government also pledged to halt inflationand reality now compels it to redeem that pledge.

title: U.S.Soviet Arms Talks On
description: GENEVA, July 2Negotiations between the United States and the Soviet Union on a 10year agreement to limit their offensive nuclear arsenals were resumed here today after a twomonth recess.

title: Audrey Gellen Maas Dies at 40; Producer, Adapter of TV Plays
description: Audrey Gellen Maas, the writer and producer, died yesterday at New York Hospital after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage. She lived at 444 East 57th Street and was 40 years old.

title: WYMAN DISPUTES CRANE OF ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, July 2Louis C. Wyman, the Republican claimant to New Hampshire's vacant Senate seat, said today that he, Could not believe that the woman he helped win an ambassadorial post had charged him with enticing her and her husband into illegally purchasing the job.

title: DOW JONES & CO. SET TO ADD IRWIN
description: Dow Jones & Co., Inc. announced yesterday an agreement in principle to merge Richard D. Irwin, Inc., college textbook publisher of Homewood, Ill., into Dow Jones. Now owning 21.2 per cent of Richard D. Irwin, Dow Jones will acquire the remaining shares by issuing about 1 million shares of common stock to effect an exchange of 1.03 shares of Dow Jones for each share of Irwin stock. The value of the exchange is about $30million.

title: GOVERNMENT FIGHTS A GRANT FOR PENNSY
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 2 (AP) The Government said today it would appeal a decision that provides a $136million Federal grant for the bankrupt Penn Central Railroad.

title: Screen:'Witch Mountain':Disney Fantasy Shares Bill With 'Cinderella'
description: "Escape to Witch Mountain" is a Walt Disney production for children who will watch absolutely anything that moves. The setting is the spectacular coast around Monterey, Calif., and the story is about two orphans, Tia and Tony, whose extrasensory perceptions make them valuable to rich, eccentric old Aristotle Bolt, who lives in a castle and wants them to dope the stock market and find oil.The children, played nicely enough by Kim Richards and Ike Eisenmann, spend a good portion of the movie escaping from the greedy adults, including Ray Milland and Donald Pleasence, but it's no contest since the children, at will, can make cars fly, pistols leap and dogs turn on their masters. It's not very scary, but neither is it very exciting.Eddie Albert plays a crusty, kindly old bachelor who befriends the children and doesn't turn a hair when, at the end, they fly off in their own space ship."Escape to Witch Mountain" opened yesterday at theaters around town on a double bill with a reissue of "Cinderella."

title: JESS WARD
description: Jess Ward, founder and president of Jess Ward & Co., Inc., woolen merchants, died Sunday in Jerusalem, Israel. He was 74 years old and lived at 15 West 81st Street.

title: Filly Paces a Record 1:58
description: GOSHEN, N.Y., July 2Silk Stockings raced today the fastest mile ever clocked by a trotter or pacer in the 137year history of Historic Track here. Her time was 1:58. Driven by Preston Burris Jr., Silk Stockings, who was barred from the wagering, scored a 12length victory in the $11,722 Sire Stakes for 3yearold pacing ffilies.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: City, Awaiting Bond Cash, Needs OneDay Loan
description: The $1billion that the Municipal Assistance Corporation will receive in exchange for its bonds will probably not come in until next Tuesdayone day after a large sum of cash is needed by the cityand so the.corporation is planning to arrange for a $170million, oneday loan from banks.

title: DR. EDMUND ZIMAN
description: Dr. Edmund Ziman, a psychoanalyst, died Monday at Montefiore Hospital and Medical Center in the Bronx. He was 68 years old and lived at 127 East 54th Street.

title: MEADOWLANDS UNIT WILL STUDY TRANSIT
description: LYNDHURST, July 2 (UPI)  The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission agreed today to work with the Tristate Planning Commission on a study of masstransit needs in the 19,750acre Meadowlands district.

title: People and Business
description: When it comes to tax collection, the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance believes in the aggressive, facetoface approach. Its officials were at a downtown branch of the Chemical Bank when three prizefighters arrived to collect their purses after bouts earlier in the week.

title: U.S. Says Stirling Homex Reported Phantom Sales
description: WASHINGTON, July 2The Securities and Exchange Commission today accused the bankrupt Stirling Homex Corporation, once one of the nation's leading modular homebuilders, of creating phantom sales, making illegal political contributions, using illegal bugging equipment and making payoffs to union officials.

title: Belmont Race Charts
description: Article 2  No Title

title: 13,000 Have Lost Jobs Under Crisis Budget
description: It is not yet known exactly how many employes have been laid off since the city's crisis budget went into effect two days ago, but check of the major agencies shows that at least 13,000 persons have lost their iobs.

title: A Strike Over Layoffs Causes Hudson Parkway Traffic Jam
description: A wildcat strike of highway workers, protesting 570 layoffs, led to a traffic tieup on the Henry Hudson Parkway yesterday, and a similar scene is anticipated for this morning's rush hour unless drivers take alternative routes.

title: Grand Jury Indicts Two Officers On Conduct in Chinatown Arrest
description: The case of Peter Yew which in part prompted two massive demonstrations at City Hall by Chinatown residents over claims of police brutality took another turn yesterday with a decision by a Manhattan grand jury to bring charges of official misconduct against two police officers.

title: Bridge:
description: A great deal of heat, confusion and irritation has been generated in the past by claims that prove to be faulty or doubtful. Some of this will be diminished when the new Laws of Duplicate Contract Bridge come into force at the end of this month (not this week, as recently indicated in this column).

title: Albany is Prompted By the City's. Crisis To Put of f Holiday
description: ALBANY, July 2Before Mayor Beame arrived tonight to resume talks on his budget, legislative leaderi had met this afternoon to discuss the agenda for the remainder of the session.

title: 18 Nations in Title Soccer
description: MEXICO CITY, July 2 (AP)  Eighteen countries said today they would send soccer teams to compete in the PanAmerican Games in Mexico City on Oct. 16 through 26, the organizers reported. The countries are: Bolivia, Brazil, Canada, Costa Rica, Cuba, Ecuador, the United States, the Dominican Republic, Trinidad, Tobago, Barbados, Chile, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Belice, Nicaragua and Venezuela.

title: FORDAVOIDEDVISIT BY SOLZHENITSYN
description: WASHINGTON, July 2  A White House official said today that President Ford had refused to meet with Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn on advice from the National Security Council.

title: Kissinger, Gromyko Meet on Mideast Next Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 2Secretary of State Kissinger will meet with the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko in Geneva next week to discuss a possible reconvening of the Middle East peace conference and other issues affecting the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Resplendent Butterfly
description: Since Manhattan was alloted only one of the Metropolitan Opera's outdoor concert performances this season, it is pleasant to be able to report that the event, which took place Tuesday night, was a great success.

title: Australian Leader Ousts His Deputy In a Loan Scandal
description: CANBERRA, Australia, July 2 (UPI)  Prime Minister Gough Whitlam dismissed his. Deputy Prime Minister, James F. Cairns, today because of his activities in, obtaining overseas loans for a realestate company employing his stepson.

title: A Plethora of Villains
description: ALBANY, July 2With New York City's garbagn piling up even faster than the press releases of the warring political leaders of Albany, the level of the debate in the extremely complicated siblation finally reached News the ultimate.point Analysis of simplicity. The suffering, confused public was being asked by different politicians and power blocs to believe that the culpability for the mix of city, suburban and upstate power politics rested with one person, whose identity, of course, shifted according to the accuser.

title: Cypriote Envoy Says Turks Try To Alter Island's Ethnic Ratio
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 Nicos G. Dimitrlou, the Cypriote Ambassador to the United States, charged at a news conference today that the Government of Turkey was attempting to alter the ethnic structure of Cyprus by settling thousands of mainland Turks in previously Greek areas.

title: In Memoriam
description: HEBARDRobert. Missed so much.

title: SETTLEMENT IS SET IN 8 MEMOREX SUITS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 2 (AP)A $3.6million settlement has been reached in eight suits filed against the Memorex Corporation by shareholders who said the computer equipment manufacturer had misled them with inaccurate financial statements.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Chicago Cubs, at Shea Stadium. Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens. 2 P.M.

title: CAVETT SEES ERRORS IN GIFT ACCUSATIONS
description: Dick Cavett says there were glaring errors in accusations filed against Min by the state's Attorney General Louis J. Letkowitz, in connection with a suit against the Museum of the American Indian.

title: State Backing Movement For Unified Broker Group
description: New York State lent Its powerful support yesterday to a movement aimed at creating a uniform system of registering securities brokers, dealers and salesmen throughout the country.

title: Match Race. Arcaro's Views
description: In an atmosphere of seriousness, Eddie Arcaro gave a critique on the technique of match races during a luncheon at Belmont Park Yesterday. In essence. Arcaro's advice for a twohorse race is, Get away first, and stay there all the way.

title: $275,000 AWARDED TO SNIPER'S VICTIMS
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 2 (AP) A Federal jury has awarded $275,000 to plaintiffs seeking more than $10million in damages from the sniper attack here in 1973 in which eight persons died and 17 were wounded.

title: A Time to Be Firm
description: Formalistic rejection by the police of a job action proposal that should never have been considered in the first place, plus a court order against the striking sanitation workers (who have thus far ignored it) offered but slight glimmers of hope yesterday to a beleaguered city.

title: Treasury Plans to Waive Duties on Swiss Cheese
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 (Reuters)  The Treasury Department said today it intended to waive extra import duties for Emmenthaler and Gruyere cheese from Switzerland even though it found the Swiss Government was giving improper financial aid to the producers of these cheeses.

title: Governor Brown Signs An $11.47Billion Budget
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 2 (UPI)Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. signed an $11.4billion California budget yesterday and promptly came under fire from state employe and highway patrolmen's organizations for reducing proposed salary increases.

title: New Skating Derby League Getting Back on the Track
description: OOMMACK, L.I., July 2The Roller Derby, which was flourishing at the box office just two years ago, has come on hard times, but its troubles go deeper than the recession as the cause.

title: Portalatin Acquittal Praised by Alampi As Farmer Victory
description: SWEDESBORO, N.J., July 2New Jersey's Secretary of Agriculture today praised as landmark event the acquittal of Marcus Portalatin of charges of enslaving migrant workers and assaulting farm visitors.

title: Beirut is Quelling Strife Fatal to Nearly 300 in Week
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 2Lebanese security forces in armored cars today moved into the embattled Christian and Moslem neighborhoods where nearly 300 persons have died in violent street fighting in the last week. There was no resistance.

title: Nagle Golf Victor
description: LONGNIDIRY, Scotlann, July 2(AP) Ken Nagle of Australia shot a twounderpar 69 today and won the $10,900 Professional Golfers Association seniors tournament with a courserecord 268, two strokes ahead of Britain's Ken Bousfield. Third over the 6,300yard course was Ian Panton of Britain at 272.

title: Nuisance Taxes Pressed As Alternative in Jersey
description: TRENTON, July 2Democratis leaders in the Assembly have abandoned their commitment to a state income tax, and were reported this evening to have enough votes to approve an alternative package of nuisance taxes that would cancel most of the $384million in state budget cuts ordered by Governor Byrne.

title: Mrs. Price in Net Final
description: OLD WESTBURY. L. I., July 2Adria Price of Roslyn Heights upset topseeded Louise Cilia of Whitestone, Queens, 60, 63, in the semifinals of the New York State women's 35andover tennis tournament at the Racquet Club today. Eleanor Wright of Suffern, N. Y., beat Pat Stewart of Elmhurst, Queens, 60, 64, in the other semifinal.

title: THOMAS J. M'GEE
description: Thomas J. McGee, law assistant for 42 years to six State Supreme Court justices, died here Tuesday of a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: July Fourth is Just Another Holiday
description: The day after Manager Walt Alston's Los Angeles Dodgers bombarded him in an early inning, a shellshocked Met pitcher found a note taped to his locker. Alston wants to know, the note read, for all to see, it you're going to pitch batting practice again today.

title: People in Sports
description: The scene is the same in New York, Philadelphia, Detroit, Chicago and Los Angeles. Some of pro basketball's highestpaid players are competing in summer leagues without pay and their talents are not diminished any for lack of cash considerations. Nate Archibald, paid $400,000 annually for playing with the Kansas City Kings of the National Basketball Association, scored on a driving layup Tuesday night to lead the Lord Calvert superstars LO a 113111 victory over the H.B.O. Cables in the opening game of the Robert Douglas League that began at Springfield Gardens High School in Queens. Archibald's teammates were Willie Sojourner of the Nets, Marvin Roberts of the Kentucky Colonels, Larry Kenon of the San Antonio Spurs, and Rick Sobers, the Phoenix Suns No.2 draft choice.

title: Panovs Benefit Will Provide Free Theater for Half a Million in Jersey
description: HOLMDEL, N. J., July 2 Valery and Galina Panov, the Russian emigre dancers, made their metropolitan area debut tonight in a gala benefit for the Garden State Arts Center's Cultural Fund.

title: PRESIDENT SIGNS BILL FOR HOUSING
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 President Ford, calling a strong housing industry crucial to our overall economic recovery, signed into law today a compromise housing measure intended to spur the construction and sale of 300,000 homes.

title: FREDERICK P. LAWRENCE
description: Frederick P. Lawrence, hoard chairman of Sayre Electric Affiliates in East Liverpool, Ohio, and president of the Sayre Development Company, a realestate concern in Princeton, N.J., died Tuesday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 177 Library Place, Princeton. He was 64 years old.

title: The Gambler, Latest Bolshoi, Is a Sure Thing
description: The newest production in the Bolshoi Opera's repertory, Prokofiev's The Gambler, is well worth seeing, if not always worth hearing. The staging, in spite of a naive and monotonous use of strobe lights in an otherwise gripping second act, vivividly evokes the reigning style of its time (it was completed in 1916). Tuesday night's performance, the second of four scheduled in this visit to the Metrdpolitan Opera House, added up to a night of brilliant theater, a striking example of how to deal with that latterday form of opera, the play in which the music deliberately refuses to sing.

title: At Delaware Park
description: Bellefix scored a sixlength viotory in the feature as she went the mile in 1:38 3/5 under Chris McCarron. The 3yearold owned by John A. Bell 3d paid $17.80, $7.40 and $4.20

title: DieselPowered Taxis Go Into Regular Service
description: The subdued rattle of a taxi's diesel engine has been a familiar and cheerful sound in Germany for many years, and yesterday it became a permanent part of the New York scene. Ten dieselpowered taxicabs went into regular aroundtheclock service as part of the taxi industry's latest effort to conserve fuel and cut air pollution.

title: Barber Leader On a 65
