title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal judge rejected a request by an 18yearold Orthodox Jew that he be given kosher food while serving two months ath youth correction center. The decision, by Judge Thomas C. Platt in Federal District Court in Brooklyn, contradicts a decision in an earlier case. The youth, Gary Shlian of 14150 73d Terrace, Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, had been sentenced after pleading guilty to having a forged draft card. The card was said to have been needed to buy the rifle used to fire four shots into the Soviet United Nations Mission in October, 1971.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Two armed bicyclers robbed a hamburger restaurant in Newark of $5,300, according to the police. The robbers found an employe counting receipts on a table when they walked into White Castle Hamburger shop on Elizabeth Avenue on Wednesday and cautioned her to remain silent. After drawing guns, they tied her with towels and a laundry bag, and forced her into a closet. Another employe was threatened, but not bound. The robbers took the cash and ran out. Witnesses reported seeing them pedaling away.

title: BEIRUT CLASHES CUT BY SECURITY FORCES
description: BEIRUT; July 3  Lebanon's capital was almost back to normal today as security forces moved into the last areas still under sniper fire.

title: PIG HEART VALYES PLACED IN HUMANS
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., July 3 A new technique for repairing heart valves has been successfully tested and adopted by here at Stanford University Hospital.

title: Monmouth County Fair Ovens at Freehold
description: The New York Times/Thomas Christlo

title: Citibank to Raise Prime to 7%, Rejoining Other Large Banks
description: The First National City Bank, responding to the widespread rise in shortterm interest rates throughout the money market since midJune, announced yesterday that it would raise its prime rate on corporate loans to 7 per cent on Monday.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Xerox Corporation has been awarded a $115million contract by the United States General Services Administration for copying machines.

title: 6 HELD IN QUEENS IN VIOLENT CRIMES
description: Six young men were arrested by Queens detectives yesterday following a series of crimes involving a homicide, two other shootings and several robberies over a period of three days.

title: A Death Raises Toll In Jane Crash to 113
description: The death toll in the June 24 crash of an Eastern Airlines, jet at Kennedy International Airport rose to 113 yesterday.

title: Laotians Threaten to Kill U.S. Diplomat at Library
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 3Pathet Lao soldiers chased an American diplomat from the United States Information Service Library here at gunpoint today.

title: Don't DestroyRestore!
description: In the decade since New York City first established its landmarks law and Landmarks Preservation Commission, after a long battle against real estate hostility and public indifference, much has changed.

title: Church of England Delays Entry of Women Priests
description: LONDON, July 3The Church of England decided in principle today to admit women to the priesthood, but to bar their actual entry until worldwide opinion was more favorable.

title: KATE E. HUNTLEY
description: Kate E. Huntley, who had been a social worker in this city for many years, died June 23 in a nursing home in La Jolla, Cal. She was 90 years old and had lived at.44 Gramercy Park for 35 years.

title: Newport Jazz
description: If all the featured performers at the Newport Jazz Festival could call on friends such as those whom Stan Getz brought with him for An Evening With Stan Getz and His Friends at Avery Fisher Hall late Wednesday evening, the festival's programing problems would be over.

title: MFEELEY ANGERED
description: The city's striking sanitationmen returned to work yesterday following an accord in Albany giving the city $330million in new taxing powersbut only after an unusual union agree. Intent to guarantee their wages with $1.6million in union funds.

description: In Billions

title: Without Narayan, Opposition in Bihar Melts Away
description: PATNA, India, July 3J. P. said that if he was arrested, there would be a mass uprising in India. The journalist paused then added sardonically: Where is this mass uprising?

title: M'FEELEY ANGERED
description: The city's striking sanitationmen returned to work yesterday following an accord in Albany giving the city $330million in new taxing powersbut only after an unusual union agreement to guarantee their wages with $1.6million in union funds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor With constantly mounting unemployment in New York City, it seems to me more important than ever for the Federal Government to provide an adequate public works program similar to the W.P.A. instituted during the Roosevelt Administration. Legislation was recently enacted that will give New York City $26.5 million for recreation and summer jobs for our young people, but this is far from sufficient.

title: Firecrackers, Not Fires, Explode in East Harlem
description: A night after their Upper East Side streets were turned into a vast incinerator of flaming garbage, the people of East Harlem returned to the routine joys of summer last night, celebrating the impending Fourth of July with a constant rattle of exploding firecrackers and sharing one another's company in hundreds of sidewalk gatherings.

title: Arafat Says He is Stepping Up Palestinian Drive Against Israel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 3 (UPI)Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian guerrilla leader, predicting an imminent new war in the Middle East, said in an interview today that his forces had stepped up attacks on Israel and would launch even more in the future.

title: Mitchell is Disbarred in State For His Watergate Conviction
description: John N. Mitchell, the former United States Attorney General who was convicted of perjury and conspiracy to obstruct justice in the Watergate scandal, was disbarred yesterday from practicing law in New York State.

title: Albany Tax Compromise
description: ALBANY, July 3The agreement worked out today by the state's competing political leaders, while presented as a problemsolving package for various parts of the state, basically gives mayor Beanie the power to tax New York city by $330million more and sets up the scenario for a possible state tax increase next January.

title: INQUIRY IS PLANNED BY EDWARD CAREY
description: Edward M. Carey, a brother of the Governor and the head of a major oil company, said yesterday that his concern was investigating the circumstances relating to recen't news reports that charged pressure by the Governor in an oil deal that allegedly benefitted his brother's company.

title: Capital's Subway Sees Gloom at End of Tunnel
description: WASHINGTON, July 3The subway entrance, in Washington's Chinatown, at Seventh and H Streets, N.W., will have a sign announcing; in a pair of flowing Chinese ideographs, Underground Ox Cart alongside a stylized M for Metro.

title: The Other Evert Still Trying
description: GROSS INGER, N.Y., July 3Chris Evert lost her semifinal match at Wimbledon yesterday, and the news made big headlines. Jeanne Evert also lost a semifinal match yesterday, but it was hardly noticed. This paradox seems to illustrate best the divergent paths taken by the tennisplaying sisters in the last year.

title: Jazz Festival May Improvise a Profit
description: With his Newport Jazz Festival 60 per cent completed, George Wein, the producer, said yesterday that he felt he had produced a quality music series so farMiles [Davis] finally did play the festivaland he believed that the festival would finish in the black.

title: 1876: In Philadelphia, Crowds and Cheering
description: WEST WARDSBORO, Vt.  The. young bride who wrote the following excerpted letter, Myra Smith Clark, was an early graduate of Vassar College, and would come to have eleven of us grandchildren. The recipient, John Bates Clark, then in Minneapolis, eventually for many years at Columbia University, figures, in the annals of economics and so would perhaps understand her having to pay 3 cents for the stamp.

description: 2 envelopes unflavored gelatin

title: A Little Bit of Sweden is Preparing For a Royal Visit to Jamestown, N.Y
description: JAMESTOWN, N.Y.First there were two young sisters, pawned off as indentured servants. Then there were waves of Johnsons and Carlsons whose descendants dominate the telephone books today. And next year there will be a king.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Symphony No. 1, Barber; Harpsichord Concerto, Porter; Dance from Music for the Theater, Copland.

title: Harry J. Conley Dies at 90; In Show Business 76 Years
description: Harry J. Conley, a vaudeville performer who had appeared at, the Palace on Broadway many times, died June 23 in Cleveland after two performances in a comback attempt. He was 90 years old and lived in Atlantic City.

title: DOLLAR STILL RISING GOLD AND POUND OFF
description: BRUSSELS, July 3 (UPI)The dollar sustained its weeklong upswing on European money markets today but gold and the British pound Hell.

title: Henley Results
description: (Events Involving U.S. parsmen) Thames Challenge Cup Henley R.C. defeated Dartmouth lightweights by 1/3 length; Garda Slochana B.C., Dublin, defeated Harvard lightweights by 1142 lengths; University of London defeated Eliot House, Harvard, by 2 lengths.

title: Pacific Shipping Rate War Flares, Mostly on Soviet Vessel BuildUp
description: LOS ANGELES, July 3A major rate war has erupted on Pacific shipping lanes, precipitated principally by a rapid buildup of Soviet merchant shipping capacity to this country and partly by the recession and technological changes in shipping.

title: Watergate Jury Ends Life After 18 Months
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (Reuters)  The third and final Watergate grand jury ended 18 months of service today.

title: STATE SCHOOL All WILL NOT BE CUT
description: ALBANY, July 3No school district would get less state money this year than it did last year under the tentative aid package that was worked out today in tandem with new taxing authority for New York City.

title: H.E.W. CHIEF SUED ON SEGREGATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 3Three civil rights organizations asked the Federal District Court here today to compel the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare to require Northern and Western States to end school segregation or face termination of their Federal school aid.

title: CARS SAID TO FAIL POLLUTION RULES
description: WASHINGTON, July 3  A confidential report by the Environmental Protection Agency has concluded that there has been a massive failure of automobiles to meet Federal antipollution standards.

title: Nancy Lefkowitz Married in Suburb
description: Nancy Ellen Lefkowitz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Lefkowitz of Spring Valley, N.Y., was married yesterday at the BethEl Synagogue in New Rochelle, N.Y., to David Charles Finkelstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan G. Finkelstein of Kings Point, L.I. Rabbi Jacob Philip Rudin of Great Neck, L.I., performed the ceremony.

title: Mets Top Cubs, 40, on Koosman 4Hitter
description: At muggy Shea. Stadium yesterday afternoon, Jerry Kobsman of the Mets went through four sweatshirts, four uniform tops, two caps and the Chicago Cubs in a 40 fourhitter, but he says be still doesn't like the hot weather.

title: SPACESUIT LEAKS IN FINAL PRACTICE
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., July 3 (UPI)The three American astronauts who will rendezvous with a Russian crew in space later this month put their spacecraft through a final practice run today, but discovered a leak in their spacesuit system.

title: Benno Rabinof, Violinist, Dies; Played in Concerts With Wife
description: BREVARD, N. C., July 3 (AP) Benno Rabinof, the concert violinist, who was to have performed here at the Brevard Music Center oil Sunday, died here yesterday of a heart attack in Transylvania Community Hospital. His age was 64.

title: Leone Sees Deficit In Nonincome Taxes
description: TRENTON, July 3  State Treasurer Richand C. Leone said today that the package, of increased sales taxes and, other nonincome levies under consideration by the Legislature would still leave the state with a budget deficit of as much as $133.2million.

title: A Week After Crisis Curbs, India is Calm
description: NEW DELHI, July 3One week after the emergency proclamation that critics of the Government say has fundamentally changed the nature of the Indian society, the country was generally calm today amid indications that Prime Minister Indira Gandhi was still firmly in control.

title: Race Week at Goshen, a Vestige of Americana
description: GOSHEN, N.Y., July 3Goshen, it seems, started getting ready for the Bicentennial before there was a Declaration of Independence. The first resident, Sarah Wells, married an Englishman in 1718 and when she died (at the age of 102), she had 12 children, 98 grandchildren, 212 greatgrandchildren and 13 greatgreatgrandchildren, nearly all of whom lived to take their heritage seriously.

title: Dietz, Allsopp Gain at Henley
description: HENLEY  ONTHAMES, England, July 3The Henley Royal Regatta opened today in weather that travel agents enticingly refer to as English summer, which sometimes means torrential downpours but for the last month has meant blue skies and not a drop of rain.

title: Business Records
description: OTHMAR SCHWEINBURG, 838 West End Ave., N.Y. Liabilities 511,980; assets none.

description: A year ago this month, Representative William L. Hungate, Democrat of Missouri, was in the national eye on television as a member of the House Judiciary Committee and the authoror catalyst, as he put itof the second article of impeachment against President Nixon.

title: INQUIRY SAID TO PREDATE ORDER
description: WASHINGTON, July 3Staff members of the Rockefeller commission quietly began investigating the Central Intelligence Agency's involvement in plots to assassinate foreign leaders nearly a month before President Ford officially gave them the assignment, according to authoritative sources.

title: President Visits Ohio and Outlines His Philosophy
description: CLEVELAND, July 3President Ford, combining statecraft with politics, crossed Ohio today outlining the philosophy of government on which he will seek a full term in the White House next year.

title: Sanitationmen Start on Big Cleanup
description: Frank Cammaratahe is getting married next September and buying a househeaved into the driver's seat. Nick Papas, who will be 33 years old on his Fourth of July birthday today and Charles Sarjeant were next to him.

title: MICHIGAN JUSTICE IS INDICTED BY U.S.
description: DETROIT, July 3John B. Swainson, a Michigan Supreme Court justice and a former Democratic Governor of the state, was indicted today by Federal grand jury on seven criminal counts stemming from an allegation that he accepted a $20,000 bribe in 1972 to help a burglar gain a review of his conviction.

title: CARS SAID TO FAIL POLLUTION RULES
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 A confidential report by the Environmental Protection Agency has concluded that there has been a massive failure of automobiles to meet Federal antipollution standards.

title: Chief Executive Retiring at 56 At Embattled Chrysler Corp,
description: DETROIT, July 3Lynn A. Townsend, chairman and chief executive officer of the embattled Chrysler Corporation, announced today his intention to retire Oct. 1.

title: George W. Stocking, Led A Roosevelt Policy Board
description: George Ward Stocking, who was chairman of the Petroleum Labor Policy Board in the first Adminittration of President Franklin D. Roosevelt, died June 7 in a retirement community in Portola Valley, Calif. He was 82 years old. Mr. Stocking had lived for many years in Austin, Tex., where he was a professor of economics at the University of Texas. From 1944 to 1947, he was codirector here with Dr. Myron W. Watkins of the Twentieth Century Fund's study of international cartels.

title: 1852: What, to the American Slave, Is Your 4th of July?
description: Fellowcitizens, pardon me, allow me to ask, why am I called upon to speak here today? What have I, or those I represent, to do with your national independencel Are the great principles of political freedom and of natural justice, embodied in that Declaration of Independence, extended to us? and am I, therefore, called upon to bring our humble offering to the national altar, and to confess the benefits and express devout gratitude for the blessings resulting from your independence to us?

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Thursday.

title: BROKERS UNHAPPY ABOUT NEW TAXES
description: Wall Street executives reacted sharply and with disappointment to the state's proposals yesterday for a 20 per cent surcharge on stock transfers and for a new tax on the sale of corporate bonds.

title: June Car Sales Highest in 11 Months
description: DETROIT, July 3 (AP)United States car makers in June hit their highest sales level in 11 months, but fuelstingy imports continued their assault on the domestic makers by taking another record share of the new car market. Domestic sales, while signaling further recovery in the slumping auto industry, topped the normally stronger pace in May by 7 per cent but still trailed depressed yearago levels by 11 per cent. The daily rate was the lowest for a June in 13 years.

title: Notes on People
description: A year ago this month, Representative William L. Hungate, Democrat of Missouri, was in the national eye on television as a member of the House Judiciary Committee and the authoror catalyst, as he put itof the second article of impeachment against President Nixon.

title: People in Sports
description: Tennis's famous love match has been suspended with no resumption in immediate sight. Chris Evert said yesterday at Wimbledon that her onandoff romance with Jimmy Connors was over.

title: Giscard a Guest of Fireman
description: PARIS. July 3 (AP)President and Mrs. Valery Giscard d'Estaing had dinner at the home of a Parisian fireman, Claude Furet, last night, the President's office announced today.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Continental Oil Company yesterday joined other oil concerns in raising prices of gasoline by 3 cents a gallon, effective immediately.

title: Leading Scores in Milwaukee Golf
description: (Play suspended Wore 27 Could complete round.)

title: Terrorists Kill Iranian Employe of U.S. Embassy
description: TEHERAN, ran, July 3 (AP) A car swerved in front of a United States Embassy automobile in downtown Teheran this afternoon, two men got out and one, reportedly wearing a police uniform, opened fire, killing a young Iranian employe of the embassy, the police said.

title: PrisonGrievance Bill Passes in Albany
description: ALBANY, July 3The State Senate gave final legislative approval today to a prison reform measure that would establish grievance committees in state correctional facilities for inmates and emoloves.

title: Mellowness Marks Style Of Mangione
description: The romantic side of contemporary jazz was brought to the Newport Jazz Festival on Wednesday evening at Avery Fisher Hall by the Chuck Mangione Quartet Mr. Mangione, dividing his attention between electric piano and flugelhorn, led his group through a program that glowed with mellow moods and sounds even when the tempos became bright and lively.

title: Killings in Latin Quarter Expose Web of Terrorism
description: PARIS, July 3The special police captain thought he was pushing a light switch at 9 Rue Toullier, a warren of old apartments in the Latin Quarter near the Sorbonne. But it was a doorbell, and it was the wrong door.

title: An Old Ham Under the Hot Sun
description: The newspaper said it bad been going on for thirty years, but there is a faded snapshot of the oldest son in his twoyearold sailor suit, gravely escorting his father the last thirty steps of the parade. There are no other dates available, so the career must be nearer 25 years.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Braving traffic jams and the threat of severe thunderstorms New Yorkers streamed of of town yesterday for the long Fourth of July holiday weekend, leaving the Big Apple and its uncollected garbage to steam in the muggy weather.

description: New York 4, Chicago 0. San Diego 2, Cincinnati 1 (n.). Pittsburgh 5, Montreal 1. Los Angeles 7, San Fran. 1 (n.). Philadelphia 7, St. Louis 4 (n.).

title: Happiness in Detroit: Return to Work For Many After Long Industry Layoffs
description: DETROIT, July 3Bradford Mallory, a worker at Chrysler's Hamtramck, Mich., plant, has been laid off for eight months and has only 12 weeks left of unemployment insurance. But he is no longer worried.

title: MAN HELD IN SLAYING OF 10YEAROLD GIRL
description: BARRINGTON, July 3 (AP)A 25yearold stock clerk was held without bail on a homicide charge today in the strangulation of a 10yearold girl who lived in the same apartment complex in which he lives here.

title: Several Store Windows Broken In Harlem Protest Over Death
description: Several store windows were broken and traffic was disrupted for several hours along 125th Street yesterday afternoon as more than 300 angry demonstrators protested the death early Tuesday morning of Otis Lee, whose body was found in a gutter on Eighth Avenue near 135th Street.

title: Somalia's President Stresses U.S. Link
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, July 3President Mohammed Siad Barre declared today that he had offered the United States naval refueling and supply facilities in Somalia provided the Americans come to us as friends.

title: Big Demand Helps Push Soybean Oil Up the Daily Limit
description: Speculator demand for soybean oil futures, coupled with strong cash demand for soybean oil, pushed prices up the limit on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. As a result, prices of soybean futures also showed sharp rises.

title: REFUGEES LEAVE SUBIC BAY CENTER
description: MANILA, July 3Flights to Guam from Subic's Cubi Point runway have resumed, with 450 refugees a day, being carried, a public affairs officer, Comdr. Ery Sharp, has announced.

description: WASHINGTON. July 3The subway entrance in Washington's Chinatown, at Seventh and H Streets, N.W.. will have a sign announcing, in a pair of flowing Chinese ideographs, Underground Ox Cart alongside a stylized M for Metro.

title: People and Business
description: After just six months in one of the highest executive jobs held by a woman in American business, Mary Joan Glynn resigned yesterday as president of the Simplicity Pattern Company, Inc.

title: Forego Favorite in 86th Brooklyn Handicap Today
description: In the excitement et the heralded, $350,000 match race on Sunday between the undefeated filly, Ruffian, and the formidable colt, Foolish Pleasure, the renewal of the Brooklyn Handicap has been pretty well overshadowed. To horseracing enthusiasts, however, the 86th running of the Brooklyn at Belmont Park today is awaited with interest.

title: 2 Men Convicted of Swindling Aged Patients in Nursing Home
description: The operator of a Bronx nursing home and a former Fordham Hospital social worker were convicted late Wednesday night of having swindled two aged patients out of their life savings.

title: Bay Ridge Has Long Been a New Norway to Many Immigrants
description: Carl Soyland doesn't lock his car doors. Sometimes he even leaves his engine running when he drops into the office of his Norwegianlanguage newspaper, Nordisk Tidende, on a quiet street in Brooklyn.

title: VEGAS IS JAMMED DESPITE FLOODING
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., July 4 (AP)Undaunted by floodwaters that killed two persons and turned the famed Strip into a mass of mud, gamblers gambled as usual today as thousands of tourists jammed this desert resort at the start of a traditionally big weekend.

title: How Rapid a Recovery?
description: The more extreme pessimists about the American economy appear to have been proved wrong. The recessionthe worst of the postwar periodalmost certainly has now reached its trough, and a recovery is in the making. But how rapid that recovery will beand how quick a recovery Federal policymakers should seek promoteremains the crucial issue.

title: Accord Reached in Strike Of Pennsylvania Workers
description: HARRISBURG, July 4 (AP)The union representing most striking state employees reached tentative agreement with the Commonwealth early today on a new twoyear wage pact that apparently ended their fourday walkout.

title: Racial Bars Ease in a Part of Suburbia
description: CHICAGO, July 4 The names include Versailles on the Lake near Chicago, Erin Acres and Thurber Club near Columbus, Ohio, Mystic Garden near Boston, Unicorn Club near Kansas City, Independence Green near Detroit and Maison Deauville near Cincinnati.

title: Racial Bars Ease in a Part of Suburbia
description: They are immodestly described by their managers as the ultimate in luxury living or the.'in place for ??? young adults. They offer an annealing array of attractions, from seclusion, trees, streams and ravines to tennis, squash and handball courts, saunas, party and game rooms and planned social activities.

title: Dave Anderson
description: WIMBLEDON, England, July 4As if possessed in her final Wimbledon singles match by the inner strength of all her causes, Billie Jean King needed only 39 minutes today in winning her sixth championship. Some women need more time than that to get dressed. Quickly again, Billie Jean the competitor had changed into Billie Jean the Woman in a green sweater over a green flowered blouse and green slacks. She sat down with a can of Tab at classroomtype desk and a tape recorder was politely slid owara ner. stick it right up here, Billie Jean suggested. Go after it. Go after it. Chisel that in the marble of Wimbledon a champions instead of her name. Going after it has been her life. And today she was rewarded, 60, 6.1, over Evonne Goolagong Cawley, her easiest important victory. From either side of the net, the court was downhill. The net seldom was too high. The chalklines seldom were too close. After all the controversy that has swirled around perhaps the most persistent women's libber of all, her dominance today was a reminder that she deserves to be remembered among the genuinely great players in tennis history. The oldtimers treasure Suzanne Lenglen and Helen Wills Moody and Maureen Connolly Brinker, but the nowtimers treasure Billie Jean King, as she will be treasured forever. Not just for winning, but for winning her way. And for living her way.

title: Landlords Ask FuelCost Rent Rises
description: Landlords of 4,000 buildings, half of them in the Bronx, have filed with the city the papers necessary to collect fuelcost rent increases of up to $9 an apartment a month in rentcontrolled units, a spokesman for the Rent Control Office reported. The 4,000 buildings are estimated to contain more than 50,000 of the 900,000 controlled apartments here.

title: 2,000 POLICEMEN AND 750 FIREMEN ARE REHIRED HERE
description: Two thousand police officers and 750 firemendismissed only four day agowere back on their jobs, 18 of 26 closed firehouses were reopened and returning sanitationmen picked up thousands of tons of piledup garbage yesterday as the city's crisis atmosphere of the last week seemed to abate for the holiday weekend.

title: No Matter How You Score It, the Home Team Won
description: CRANFORD, N. J., July 4A quiet community of shady streets and 27,500 residents, this Union County township 21 miles from Manhattan celebrated an oldfashioned familystyle Fourth of July with gusto and good humor.

title: Firemen Go Back With Mixed Feelings
description: As holidays go, it was fairly quiet yesterday for Engine Company 44 on East 75th Street, with Sparky, the Dalmatian mascot, sunning himself on the sidewalk and half a dozen fire calls by late afternoon  mostly burning rubbish.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
description: Following is a weekly listing of the unaudited net asset value applicable in the capital shares of dualpurpose investment companies at close of business Friday. Also shown are closing listed market prices of best overthecounter dollartodollar asked Prices for the capital shares of each company with the percentage difference (discount on premium) between the net asset value and the asked prices of the capital shares.

title: Brazil and France in Accord On Building Nuclear Reactor
description: PARIS, July 4 (UPI)Brazil today signed a $2.5million agreement with France for the construction of an experimental nuclear reactor, one week after reaching a major nuclearcooperation agreement with West Germany.

title: Bicentennial Plans Meeting Setbacks
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 4At Independence Hall, Mayor Frank L. Rizzo signed with a flourish Wednesday, a petition urging President Ford to return the Declaration of Independence to this city for its Bicentennial celebration.

title: 13 Die, Scores Hurt in Jerusalem Blast
description: JERUSALEM, July 4A huge explosion ripped through Jerusalem's main square at the height of the preSabbath shopping rush hour today, killing 13 Israelis and wounding 72 in the city's bloodiest terrorist incident since the founding of the state.

title: ListeningIn System Aids In Avoiding Air Collisions
description: WASHINGTON, July 4The aviation engineer who since last year has been demonstrating his aircraft collision avoidance System atop the 59story Pan American Building in New York has been granted what he regards as the most important patent on the system. George B. Litchford of Northport, L. I., will receive Patent 3,895,382 on July 15 for apparatus that enables a plane so.equipped to determine the position of a threatening aircraft without sending it radio signals and getting an answer.

title: 3 ExDolphins Make Memphis Debuts
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 4Larry Csonka, Jim Kiick, and Paul Warfield, who jumped from the Miami Dolphins of the National Football League, made their debuts last night with the Memphis Southmen of the World Football League. In a controlled scrimmage against the Birmingham Vulcans, the crowd estimates ranged from 30,000 to 48,000 in the 68,821seat Legion Field. Admission was $3 for adults. and $1 for youngsters under 12. The three played the first quarter and Kiick scored Memphis's first touchdown on a 1yard run. He gained 31 yards in 10 carries, while Csonka managed 12 yards in 5 carries. Warfield didn't catch a pass. Memphis won, 2318.

title: For NorwegianAmericans, the Fourth of July Has a Special Significance
description: STAVANGER, Norway, July 4There were no kings on hand when the 54foot sloop Restauration sailed from this tiny. beautiful harbor precisely 150 years ago today bearing the first boatload of Norwegian immigrants to the United States.

title: European Parley Approves Key Draft
description: GENEVA, July 4The European security conference tonight approved draft agreements on improving human contacts and the flow of information across frontiers.

title: LAOS GIVES BACK THE U.S. LIBRARY
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 4Laos returned to the United States today the Information Service Library that was occupied by Pathet Lao troops and student demonstrators nearly a week ago.

title: Electric Boat Strike Goes On
description: A strike by the 11union Metal Trades Council against the Electric Boat Division of the General Dynamics Corporation at Groton, Conn., continued for a fourth day as a dozen pickets walked outside the gates. No incidents were reported as the plant was closed for the holiday weekend, but Anthony DeGregory, president of the 11,000member council, said the picketing would continue aroundtheclock.

title: The Bard's View of Camp
description: When I was at home I was in a better place.

title: A Biochemist Links Crib Death To Low Level of Sugar in Blood
description: MADISON, Wis., July 5A University of Wisconsin biochemist has suggested a link between the sudden infant death syndrome, or crib death, and the failure of one of the enzymes the body uses between meals to convert amino acids into sugar.

title: FOES OF PLAN HALT FALCONS RELEASE
description: DEERFIELD, Mass., July 4 (AP)A Cornell University experiment that would have placed falcons in this western Massachusetts area has been shifted to a secret New Jersey location because of protests from songbird enthusiasts.

title: TEXAS CONCERNS ASSAILED ON GAS
description: NEWARK, July 4A New Jersey State Public Utility Commissioner accused certain Texas businesses today of withholding that state's vast production of natural gas in anticipation of the deregulation of gas prices and windfall profits on the interstate market.

title: Bridge:
description: Concentration is an integral part of the game, and the player who allows his mind to wander must expect to be punished for his inattention or absentmindedness.

description: If the St. Louis Cardinals have a book on one of Montreal's righthanded pitchers, Steve Renko, they had better revise it quickly.
