He began working out with the team Friday. . . . To make room for Piniella, Bob Oliver, a 32yearold utility infielder purchased from Baltimore in the offseason, was placed on the inactive list. That means the Yankees have 10 days to determine the disposition of his contract. ... Ed Herrmann, a reserve catcher, has been elected the tea??'s player representative. Larry Gura, a pitcher, is the alternate. . .. At the midpoint of the season last year, the Yankees' record was 38 victories and 43 defeats and they were in last place, 7 games behind the leagueleading Cleveland Indians.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Texas at New York (8 P.M.) Hands (54) vs. Medich (610).

title: Peron Cabinet Resigns
description: The entire Cabinet of President Isabel Martinez de Peron resigned in Argentina hours before the beginning of a planned general strike. Unions and others had demanded removal of ministers. Details, Page 5.

title: Nixon Depicts His Presidency as Open
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI) Richard M. Nixon saw his Presidency not as a oneman show, but as one in which he counted on freewheeling, candid and often blunt or critical advice from others, according to an affidavit filed last week in Federal Court.

title: In Bombay, the Crackdown Is Extended Even to Rats
description: BOMBAY, India, July 6Following Prime Minister Indira Gandhis command, the Bombay government and the local Congress party are cracking down on gangsters, smugglers, hoarders  even rats.

title: VOLCANO ERUPTS ON HAWAII ISLAND
description: HONOLULU, July 6Hawaii's Mauna Loa volcano, second highest peak in the Hawaiian Islands, erupted last night for the first time since 1950.

title: Bolt of Lightning Hits JackpotBarglar Alarms
description: A bolt of lightning struck a transformer in Oradell, N. J., during yesterday's storm, causing the alarm board at the local Police Department to light up with dozens of false burglar alarms.

title: PetroPolitics Suspected As an AntiCarey Weapon
description: ALBANY, July 6One of the few expensive experiences that Hugh L. Carey and Nelson A. Rockefeller have in common is petropolitics. Each found the publicity funds in family oil fortunes to get a convincing message across in gubernatorial elections.

title: Article 5  No Title
Suspect Seized in Holdup Of a Drugstore in Queens.
description: An unidentified man walked. into a Sunnyside, Queens, drugstore yesterday afternoon;. asked a pharmacist for change of a quarter then drew a gun, and scooped up $100 to $200 from the cash register and bottles of drugs from the shelves and fled with a 17yearold hostage, the police reported.

title: Ample Supplies of Textile Fibers Are Expected
description: Supplies of textile fibers in the coming months are expected to be more than ample to meet the demand for apparel and home furnishings between now and Christmas.

title: LAWMARKERS' RAISE SOUGHT IN LONDON
description: LONDON, July, 6  Prime Minister Harold Wilson is tacing a delicate and uncomfortable question. How can the Government ask coal miners, railwaymen and civil servants to limit their wage increases and then order sizable raises for members of the House of Commons?

title: Memorial Services
description: CAREYH. Frank. Dearly missedgraleful for unforgettable memories. Ida

title: Harvard, Dietz Lose at Henley
description: HENLEY  ON  THAMES, England, July 6The most successful Henley Royal Regatta in years concluded today under clear blue skies, bringing joy to the hearts of the stewards who annually keep this event one step away from insolvency. But there was not much joy among the American oarsmen.

title: Prolonged Decline In Rate of Prime May Have Halted
description: There's a 5050 chance that the prolonged decline in the prime lending ratea process that helped to provide the fuel for sharply higher prices in both the stock market and bond market  finally has ground to a halt. A declining prime rate, starting down from the record high of 12 per cent last September, had the blessing of the Federal Reserve, which set the stage by nudging moneymarket rates lower.

title: Pittsburgh Strike Action Off
description: PITTSBURGH, July 6 (UPI)A hearing on a Pittsburgh Press Company request for a permanent injunction against striking teamsters, originally scheduled for tomorrow has been postponed until Tuesday.

title: Grain Official Named in Complaints Suspended
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 6Melvin L. Hibbets, a vice president of a division of Cook Industries, Inc., has been suspended pending completion of an investigation by the cornpany of its New Orleans operations. Mr. Hibbets is vice president for operations of the company's grain division.

title: Root of City Fiscal Crisis Is Traced and Explained
description: For a long time, the city's fiscal situation was depicted by experts as heading toward a crisis. In the last few weeks, New Yorkers got unsavory indications of that crisis as the thousands of layoffs proclaimed by Mayor Beame touched off a garbage strike, work slowdowns and dire predictions of civil chaos.

title: Advertising
description: Around N. W. Ayer the years 1966 and 1967 are thought of as the dark days. The agency had just lost the Plymouth account  the biggest loss ever suffered by an advertising agencyand was in danger of losing American Telephone and Telegraph, a major client for many years.

title: Turkey, Long Loyal to U. S. Amid Westernization, Feels Betrayed by Arms Cutoff
description: ANKARA, TurkeyAn old saying is quoted frequently these day's: A Turk will burn up his blanket to kill a flea. In other words, if a Turk's pride is offended he can react with great fury, even if he winds up hurting himself.

title: Just Like Breaking A Stick
description: Unless a funeral can be considered a festival, there's nothing really to celebrate when one of the two horses in a match race breaks a leg.

title: FREDERICK WAPPLER
description: Frederick C. Wappler, vice president and secretary of American Cystoscope Makers, Inc., died of a sudden illness yesterday at his home in Wilton, Conn. He was 45 years old.

title: FORD BACKS NAVY AND SEEKS FUNDS FOR ATOM CRUISER
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Against the advice of both the Defense Department and his Budget Office, President Ford has asked Congress to allow the Navy to construct a nuclear powered cruiser that would cost $1.2billion, making her one of the most expensive ships ever built by the Navy.

title: Truxton Pratt Jr., 49, Dies; Bankers Trust Executive
description: Truxton B. Pratt Jr., first vice president in charge of the municipal securities department of Bankers Trust Company, died Saturday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived in Greenwich, Conn., and Waitsville. Vt.

title: U.S. Tourists in Europe Are Dwindling as Prices Rise
description: LONDON, July 6  The dwindling number of American vacationers in Britain and most other parts of Western Europe are finding higher prices than ever before.

title: A U.S. Priest in Honduras Is Missing After Arrest
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, July 6 (AP)Church authorities said today that two Roman Catholic priests, one from the United States and a Colombian, arrested during a recent wave or peasant unrest in eastern Honduras, were missing. Another American priest arrested with them is under house arrest here.

title: Trick for Rigging Grain Load Described
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 6 Witnessew have detailed to Federal investigators here a simple trick with automatic weighing devices that has allegedly allowed several large grain companies to gain millions of dollars in illegal profits on their export shipments.

title: Spectators, Fog Hinder Yacht Race
description: MARBLEHEAD, Mass., July 6The combination of fog and a big spectator fleet of about 400 boats milling about createdsome extra elements today at the start of the biennial Marblehead to Halifax ocean race.

title: Living in New York: High Note for Rudel
description: In 1938, Hitler's armies and local Nazis goosestepped through the Streets of Vienna and soon more refugees, the lucky ones, were finding their way to the sidewalks of New York.

title: About New York
description: When Pat Livingston asks dog owners to prevent their pets from fouling the lawns and pathways of Carl Schurz Park and keep than leashed, as the law requires, they are apt to look at her as if she were mad.

title: ECONOMIC DRIVE PRESSED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, July 6The Indian Government today stepped up its campaign of economic measures, which its critics say its designed to deflect attention from the political crisis.

title: FLEXIBLE HOURS FOUND BENEFICIAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 new study of flexible working hours, said to be the most extensive ever undertaken, discloses that employers have found many benefits and few problems with the system and that none of those studied has returned to rigid work hours.

title: Assembly Chiefs Open Hearings Today To Determine Tax Package's Final Form
description: The state Assembly's leadership will open a series of public hearings in Trenton today that should determine the final form of a tax package designed to close a $384million budget gap before the deficit results in the loss of thousands of government jobs and millions of dollars in municipal aid.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The United States Department of Housing and Urban Development has approved subsidies for 13,091 units of low income housing in the city at an annual cost of $68.8million, the department's regional administrator, S. William Green, announced yesterday. The department said that a total of $75.2million was available this year for subsidized housing here.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JLRSEY (201) MARKET 33900: WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300: NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Gunboat Attack Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, July 7Reports from the area of the Rashidiyah refugee camp, which was attacked by Israeli forces this morning, said that the camp, which is on the coast, had been bombarded by Israeli gunboats after flares illuminated the target.

title: Article 1  No Title
TEACHERS BITTER OVER CUT IN FUNDS
description: LOS ANGELES, July 6Economic disgruntlement shaped the mood here today as almost 9,000 teachers from throughout the country gathered at the annual convention of the National Education Association, the largest and most important teachers' organization in the United States.

title: American Cyclist Wins
description: MANSFIELD, Ohio, July 6 (AP)Marty Smith of San Diego swept both legs of the Prix motocross here today, 125cc United States Grand with perfect score, a first for an American in world championship competition. Riding a Honda, Smith led both 45minute races from start to finish to score 30 world championship points and move him into ninth place in the series.

title: What Happens if the Boss Asks You In
description: The worst moment in a Mafioso's life is when he is summoned to a meeting by the boss of his family, according to Peter Diapoulas, who was a member of the Gallo gang for 15 years.

title: Ruffian Destroyed After Injury in Race
description: Ruffian, fighting to the end, was destroyed this morning, eight hours after the extraordinary filly broke a leg during her match race with. Foolish Pleasure.

title: Article 6  No Title
Recycled Water Is Used to Breed Fish
description: TRENTON, July 6 (UPI)Heated water, discharged from a Public Service Electric & Gas generating station, is serving a dual purpose  producing electricity and growing giant tasty freshwater shrimp and rainbow trout.

title: American League
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Montreal Star to Publish
description: MONTREAL, July 6 (UPI)The Montreal Star will publish Wednesday for the first time since employes went on strike more than five weeks ago, the newspaper's president said today. Employes voted yesterday to return to work with a new contract giving them a 18,8per cent pay increase over a 15month term.

title: CITY FIREMEN BAR DELAY IN PAY RISE
description: The head of the fire fighters' union yesterday rejected a proposal that his men accept twoyear city bonds at 6 per cent interest in lieu of a wage increase due them under their contract in this fiscal year.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: July 7, 1975

title: Trick for Rigging Grain Load Described
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 6 Witnesses have detailed to Federal investigators here a simple trick, with automatic weighing devices that has allegedly allowed several large grain companies to gain millions of dollars in illegal profits on their export shipments.

title: Multinationals: Friends or Foes?
description: TEANECK, N. J.It was fashionable in the 1960's to blame the national institutions for the ills of society; the fashion of the 1970's is to blame multinational corporations.

title: FORD BACKS NAVY AND SEEKS FUNDS FOR ATOM CRUISER
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Against the advice of both the Defense Department and his, Budget Office, President Ford has asked Congress to allow the Navy to construct a nuclear powered cruiser that would cost $1.2billion, making her ships of the most expensive ships ever built by the Navy.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: One of our food passions in life is an intricately and bulkily made creation called pozole de Jalisco, a soup or stew, depending on your point of view. Traditionally it is made with a whole or half a pig's head and dried hominy known as maiz para pozole, which requires a good deal of soaking and rinsing in several waters.

title: Europe's Costs Up, U.S. Tourists Down
description: LONDON, July 6  The dwindling number of American vacationers in Britain and most other parts of Western Europe are finding higher prices than ever before.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JULY 7, 1975

title: Personal Finance
description: In these days of recession, many employes are worried about permanent layoffs or forced retirement. Quite a few middleaged people are beginning to feel nudges toward retirement, and many will find themselves receiving lump sums from corporate pension plans.

title: Rich Kids Have Problems, Too
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.It seems ironic that an elderly woman who has lived the last years of her life on welfare should have said what she did. We were standing in the small kitchen of her project apartment when she suddenly looked up toward the ceiling.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: 300 FLEE BLAZE IN HOTEL AT SHORE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, July 6A threealarm fine of suspicious origin in a convention annex of a beachfront hotel today forced the evacuation of 300 guests as a precautionary measure and caused damages of about $250,000.

title: Living in New York: High Note for Rudel
description: In 1938, Hitler's armies and local Nazis goosestepped through the streets of Vienna and soon more refugees; the lucky ones, were findings heir way to the sidewalks of New York.

title: STATES HOLD LINE ON 1975 SPENDING
description: The vast majority the nation's state legislatures got through their sessions this year by not doing three thingsnot raising taxes, not implementing new programs and not laying off state workers, according to a survey of 46 state capitals.

title: Mozambique to Fight Feudalism
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, MozambiqueThe new rulers of Mozambique have promised to wage ideological war not only on conservative and capitalist ideas but also on the superstitions, inertia and negative aspects of traditional African tribal life.

title: HENRY DEWAR DIES; INVESTMENT BANKER
description: Henry Hamilton Dewar, retired investment banker and civic leader in San Antonio, Tex., died there Wednesday at the age of 73.

title: Top Priority Suggested For Missing Road Links
description: Completing missing linksmther than building major new highwaysshould be the updated philosophy for the nineteen seventies in the New YorkNew Jersey  Connecticut metropolitan area, the Transpoifation Commissioners of New York and New Jersey said yesterday.

title: Levitt Assails Evaluation Of State School Aid Here
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt charged yesterday that because of ineffective local evaluation methods, there was no way to judge how much of $200million in special state aid for poor school children here had achieved its objectives.

title: Freedman Takes Junior Net Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, LI., July 6Mark Freedman of Larchmont, N.Y., won the Eastern Lawn Tennis Association junior championship today by beating Eric Fromm of Glen Head in the final, 62, 63. Mary Carillo of Douglaston, Queens, became the girl's 18 winner when Sheila McInerney of Rome, N.Y., had to retire with leg cramps in the third set.

title: Private Audit for City University Cites Serious Deficiencies in SEEK Program
description: A private audit commissioned by the City University cites serious administrative and fiscal deficiencies in the management of the S.E.E.K. program for the educationally and economically disadvantaged, despite assurances that the program was being monitored more carefully.

title: Marvin Anchin Weds Patricia Diane Seelig
description: Patricia Diane Seelig, a student at Columbia University's School of General Studies, was married yesterday at noon to Marvin Anchin, a teacher in the Lynbrook, L.I., public schools. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Michael J. Seelig in Valley Stream, L.I., by Rabbi Harold Saperstein of Lynbrook.

title: Ferguson Band And Watrous's Stir Excitement
description: The big bands led by Maynard Ferguson and Bill Watrous  he calls his the Manhattan Wildlife Refugeare somewhat similar. Both are organized by an instrumental virtuoso  Mr. Ferguson plays trumpet, is a highnote specialist, fond of wandering the stratosphere, while Mr. Watrous is a master technician of the trombone. On occasion, as he trills, bleats and freaks his way through a difficult passage, he is telling us more than we want to know about the instrument.

title: Unveilings
description: STOLNITZIrvine. Unveiling in memory of Irving Stolnitz, 13 July, 1 P.M. sharp. Cedar Park Cemetery, Emerson, New Jersay. Workmen's Ci?? Block 19, Section M, Row 4. Rain or shine.

title: Lauda Wins 4th Prix Of Year
description: LE CASTELLET, France, July 6 (AP)Niki Lauda of Austria scored his fourth victory for Ferrari this year at the French Grand Prix today but the starttofinish triumph was harder than it looked.

title: SENATE INQUIRY SET ON GASOLINE RISES
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)A special Senate inquiry to determine if oil companies purposely cut refinery production to increase gasoline prices was announced today by Democratic Senators Henry M, Jackson of Washington and Adlai E. Stevenson 3d of Illinois.

title: Just Like Breaking A Stick
description: Unless a funeral can be considered a festival, there's nothing really to celebrate when one of the two horses in a match race breaks a leg.

title: Average U.S. Household Drops Below 3 Persons for First Tithe
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)For the first time in American history the average household consists of fewer than three persons, and the Census Bureau says this is part of a basic change in how Americans live and how they relate to each other.

title: RHODESIAN BLACKS EASE DIFFERENCES
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, July 6Rhodesia's black leaders gave every impression today of having resolved their bitter factional differences and of having agreed on an uncompromising stand in dealing with the white minority Government of Rhodesia.

title: Israel Raids Bases In South Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Monday, July 7Israeli army headquarters here announced early today that its forces had attacked several Arab guerrilla bases in South Lebanon in reprisal for a series of guerrilla raids against Israel in recent months.

title: Campbell Wins Again
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., July 6 (UPI)  Bill Campbell, a former United States Amateur champion, shot a oneunderpar 69 today and easily won the West Virginia amateur golf tournament for the fourth year in a row and the 15th time since the late 1940's. Campbell, 53 years old, finished the 72hole event with a 282, two over par.

title: ISRAEL POSTPONES DECISION ON SINAI Al LEAST A WEEK
description: JERUSALEM, July 6Israel postponed today for at least a week a decision on the disputed elements of a new agreement with Egypt on disengagement in Sinai.

title: ISRAEL POSTPONES DECISION ON SINAI AT LEAST A WEEK
description: JERUSALEM, July 6Israel postponed today for at least a week a decision on the disputed elements of a new agreement with Egypt on disengagement in Sinai.

title: 2 Children Die in Shut Car
description: WICHITA, Kan. July 6 (UPI) Two of three children shut in a car with the temperature outside nearing 100 degrees suffered heat convulsions today and died from brain damage, the police said. The children's mother, Connie Crockett, 22 years old, had left them while she visited a friend in the county jail, the police said. A 5yearold and a 22monthold child died. Doctors saved a 3 year old. Charges may be filed against Mrs. Crockett

title: CABINET RESIGNS IN BUENOS AIRES
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 6President Isabel Martinez de Pern's entire Cabinet resigned tonight only hours before a general strike called by Argentine labor leaders was scheduled to begin.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Easy Date Victor
description: RUIDOSO DOWNS, N. M., July 6 (AP)Easy Dale, the richest quarterhorse in history, raced to a onelength victory in the 440yard Rainbow Quarterhorse Derby today. The $119,177 winner's share of the $396,980 purse sent the filly's career earnings to $717,035.

title: YOLCANO ERUPTS ON HAWAII ISLAND
description: HONOLULU, July 6Hawaii's Mauna Loa volcano, second highest peak in the Hawaiian Islands, erupted last night for the first time since 1950.

title: CALLAGHAN SEEING MOBUTU TOMORROW
description: LONDON, July 6The British Foreign Secretary, James Callaghan, will visit Kinshasa Tuesday for talks with President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire on the future of Denis Cecil Hills, a Briton jailed in Uganda.

title: A Man Commits Suicide In Car Standing on Thruway
description: A 40yearold man from Jamaica, Queens, shot himself in the head and died yesterday while sitting in his car on a highway in Yonkers, where he had driven his former girlfriend at gunpoint, state police reported.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LIGHT IN THE PIAZZA New Yorkers who can't Make it over to Italy this month can come reasonably close here, at least in the eating department, if they head downtown today from 11:30 A.M. to 3 P.M. and try the new sidewalk cafe set up in the shade of the Municipal Building adjacent to Police Plaza and St. Andrews Plaza. Every July weekday, there will be moderately priced, picturesque delicacies from three wellknown places, Ferrara's, Umberto's Clam House and Fretta Sausages  with two more months of ethnic specialties on the way.

title: Dallying With Dynamite
description: Prison and jail explosions don't blow up without warning, like summer storms. They result from conditions which build over time and are clearly discernible in advanceto those interested enough to take a close look. The City's Board of Corrections has taken a close look at the New York City House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island and has found conditions which constitute just about as clear a warning of impending disaster as can be imagined.

title: Key Mafia Figure Tells of Wars And GalloColombo Peace Talks
description: A key figure in the recent Mafia gang wars has offered a rare view into the inner workings of Mafia families in New York, including new details about the shooting of Joseph A. Colombo Sr., the murder of Joseph Gallo, the spate of killings that followed the Gallo murder, and the current negotiations between the Colombo family and its Gallo faction.

title: Reds Are 8 Games in Front And the Confidence Grows
description: With an eightgame bulge over the Los Angeles Dodgers and the odds 15 that the Reds will win the National League Western Division title, Sparky Anderson, the silverhaired Cincinnati manager, has had a change of heart. He has become a believer in his team.

title: Phils Top Mets for 3d in Row
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 6The Phillies gave away wrist bands today. Then the Mets gave away the ball game as they failed to come up with big plays and lost, 86, for their third defeat in a row at the hands of the Philadelphia Slugging Company.

title: Israel Raids Bases In South Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Monday, July 7Israeli Army headquarters here announced early today that its forces had attacked several Arab guerrilla bases in southern Lebanon in, reprisal for a series of guerrilla raids against Israel in recent months.

title: SPACE SCIENTISTS DEPLORE END CUT
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., July 6Space scientists are dismayed and demoralized because the House of Representatives has voted to eliminate funds from the space budget for a program designed to send two spacecraft to Venus in 1976.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Is Commuters' Private Club Car at End of Line?
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn.One by one the men file in through the private doorway, walk across the bluegreen carpet and ease down into the padded armchairs that line the woodpaneled walls.

title: Woody Herman, Stan Kenton Still a Viable Pairing
description: The combination of the bands of Woody Herman and Stan Kenton, which could have been a headline attraction any time during the last 30 years, is still a very viable pairing. The two bands filled Carnegie Hall on Saturday evening, sharing a program in which each band showed that its basic approach has not really changed in three decades.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch in Thursday's editions of The New York Times concerning press censorship in India incorrectly stated that many respected Communists, and writers such as Dilip Mukerjee, political analyst for The Times of India, have stopped writing altogether. It should have said: Many respected columnists and writers.

title: Tomahawks Beat Arrows by 1813
description: LANDOVER, Md., July 6Tim Barrie, a rookie goalie, stopped 46 shots and Dave Wilfong tallied four times, leading the Long Island Tomahawks to an 1813 victory over the Maryland Arrows in the National Lacrosse League tonight.

title: Cliche Transformed
description: A decorating clichthe round table covered to the floor with a printed fabrichas been wittily translated by Marzio Cecchi, a Florentine designer, into a fabric table. It need never be laundered, just wiped clean with a sponge.

title: Auto Dealer, a Failure in 1966, Finds the Road Back
description: The first time Robert Henry Hemhauser was in the newcar business he went broke. In 1959, when he was 29 years old, he hoped to make a million and staked everything on a Rambler dealership in Livingston, N. J. When the business failed in 1966, it gave him a terrible feeling  especially since most of his initial capital of $35,000 had come friends and relatives.

title: G.O.P. Mayors Fail to Block Appeal for U.S. Aid
description: BOSTON, July 6Republican mayors made unsuccessful attempts today to head off criticism of the Ford Administration's policies by the largely Democratic mayors of the nation's big cities.

title: Downpour Halts Subways, Stranding Holiday Riders
description: Thousands of travelers returning from holiday trips were stranded in Manhattan bus and subway stations late yesterday after heavy rainfall caused extensive flooding and power outages that halted most subway service for more than three hours in Manhattan and Queens.

title: CORRECTION
description: A dispatch in Thursday's editions of The New York Times concerning press censorship in India incorrectly stated that many respected Communists, and writers such as Dilip Mukerjee, political analyst for The Times of India, have stopped writing altogether. It should have said: Many respected columnists and writers.

title: The Albany Deal
description: The Albany agreement on a new municipal tax package, inappropriately linked to a state school aid program, reflects little credit on the principal negotiators. The $330million tax package that is expected to be approved by the Legislature today does not solve New York's immediate budget problems and it raises serious questions about the city's fiscal future.

title: Newport Jazz
description: The first solo concert that Sarah Vaughan had ever given was one of the highlights of last year's Newport Jazz Festival. Late Saturday evening she came back to try it again this year and, if anything, she was even better.

title: Kent State Justice
description: The truth about the tragedy on the Kent State campus five years ago is finally beginning to emerge for the first time, after a series of coverups condoned by exGovernor James A. Rhodes of Ohio and continued by former United States Attorneys General John N. Mitchell and Richard G. Kleindienst.

title: TEACHERS BITTER OVER CUT IN FUNDS
description: LOS ANGELES, July 6Economic disgruntlement shaped the mood here today as almost 9,000 teachers from throughout the country gathered at the annual convention of the National Education Association, the largest and most powerful teachers' organization in the United States.

title: ARIANE IS SUNG BY GRACE BUMBRY
description: PARIS, July 6The American soprano Grace Bumbry won a roaring reception last night at the crowded premiere of the Paris Opera's new production of Ariane and Bluebeard by Paul Dukas.

title: Regulatory Reform
description: There is fairly general agreement in Washington that the regulatory agencies require urgent attention. Economists in the White House and lawyers in the Justice Department have long thought that current modes of regulation in the transportation industries especially have decreased competition and kept prices unnaturally high. Furthermore, many of the regulatory agencies are burdened with purely political appointees as commissioners, who bring neither expertise nor sense of public interest to their high positions. Often, the regulators are too close to the industries they are supposed to regulate; in any event, agency resources are usually minuscule when measured against those of the industries they oversee.

title: Lebanese Blast, Fatal to 42, Discloses Leftist Links With Palestine Guerrillas
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. July 6An explosion at a training camp for Moslem militiamen, in which more than 40 persons were killed, has disclosed military links between Palestinian guerrillas here and Lebanese leftists.

title: Root of City Fiscal Crisis Is Traced and Explained
description: For a long time, the city's fiscal situation was depicted by experts as heading toward a crisis. In the last few weeks, New Yorkers got unsavory indications of that crisis as the thousands of layoffs proclaimed by Mayor. Beame touched off a garbage strike, work slowdowns and dire predictions of civil chaos.

title: Christmar Horses Win At Show
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., July 6Raggedly Ann, a member of a 12horse delegation from Christmar Farms in Santa Barbara, Calif., won the small junior working hunter championship today at the Lake Placid Horse Show.

title: NATO STRAINS GROW AT SECURITY PARLEY
description: GENEVA, July 6  Strains within the North Atlantic Alliance contingent at the 35nation conference on European security are appearing more clearly in the closing stages of negotiations.

title: Language and Skills Handicap One Refugee
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., July 6Life has never been easy for Nguyen Van Nghi. And it is not likely to be much better now that he has fled Vietnam to start over again in the United States. Not that he really thought it would.

title: Susan Ford Turns 18
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI) Susan Ford turned 18 years old today, but the party was over. Her birthday party, held yesterday for convenience, brought some 75 young men and women to the White House. She flies to Topeka, Kan., tomorrow to begin six Weeks work on The Capital Journal as a photographer.

title: Body of Brooklyn Girl, 10, Found in Coney Island Creek
description: The body of 10yearold Rene Eberhart, missing from her Brooklyn home since Thursday, was discovered on Saturday night, floating in the Coney Island Creek near West 27th Street.

title: Blakey and Byrd Groups Appear
description: The drummer Art Blakey has been leading the same kind of ensemble since 1955 the classic bop lineup of trumpet, saxophone and rhythm section. It suits his purpose and serves him very well indeed, if the ecstatic audience response was anything to go by on Saturday, when Mr. Blakey brought the current version of his Jazz Messengers to Avery Fisher Hall.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The police in Chatham Township reported no success yesterday in their search for who fired a .30caliber rifle, killing a 62yearold architect who was repairing the roof of his home. They said the owner of the rifle probably was not aware that the bullet had killed anyone.

title: Tragedy at the Races
description: In the 60 barns at Belmont Park, the country's largest hotel for horses, about 2,200 thoroughbreds are quartered when dawn creeps over Long Island. For most of them and their entourages of grooms, trainers and veterinarians, it is just another working day. But for the bay colt in Barn 26 and the brown filly in Barn 34, just a hundred yards down the hill, it is a day like no other: the day of The Great Match Race and, unknown to all of them, a day of tragedy at the track. They are up early, 13 hours before post time, because they're both 5 o'clockers, one of the stablehands says. Most of the other stars of their professional world are scattered across the landscape. Forego, who carried 132 pounds to a record on Friday, is down the path in another stable and so is Singh. The two California travelers, Avatar and Diabolo, are still dozing on the West Coast after their arduous campaigns in the East. Master Derby, who got $50,000 for staying away, is out in Chicagostaying away.

title: SENATOR REPORTS ON SOMALIA VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Senator Dewey F. Bartlett said today that his onsite inspection in Somalia, where he was accompanied by a team of American military experts, absolutely confirms Pentagon allegations that the Russians are installing a missile facility there.

title: Nation's RoadBuilding Funds Are Being Increased by 70%
description: WASHINGTON, July 6As a result mainly of Presidential and Congressional actions aimed at fighting the recession, funds for the nation's big Federally aided highway building program are being increased by 70 per cent over the amount planned as recently as last December.

title: KIDNAPPERS DEMAND RANSOM FOR OFFICER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 6 (Reuters)The United States Embassy has received a letter and two cassette tapes concerning a missing United States Army colonel, Ernest R. Morgan, an embassy spokesman said tonight.

title: PAR LEFT ADDING TO LISBON STRIFE
description: LISBON. July 6Groups to the left of the Communist party that are competing with it for influence are playing a major role in disturbing Portugal's revolution.

title: Yanks Win, 61; End 7Game Slump
description: The Yankees ended their sevengame losing streak with an efficient 61 victory over the Baltimore Orioles at Shea Stadium yesterday, and then a thunderstorm and downpour ended their effort at a repeat performance.

title: In Orthodontics, the Emphasis Today Is on Prevention
description: While the kinds of appliances used in orthodontics have not changed substantially for decades, the philosophy of when the treatment of a faulty bite should begin is undergoing a radical reformation.

title: Now the Good News
description: LONDONThe following story, reprinted in its entirety, appeared recently on page one of The Cambridge (England) Evening News:

title: Books of The Times
description: In the early nineteenfifties, people in the small Japanese city of Miasmata on the western coast of Kyushu began noticing that the cats were acting queerly. They would stagger drunkenly, salivating as though they were rabid; then they would be seized by convulsions or else raze madly around in circles. Then they would die.

title: PENTAGON IS SILENT ON FALSIFYING CASE
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (Reuters)The Defense Department refused to comment today on a New York Times report that the commander of a Navy submarine was ordered to file a falsified report after a collision at sea with a Soviet submarine on an intelligence patrol inside Soviet waters.

title: SPOFFORD GETTING OWN OMBUDSMAN
description: Maurice Nixon, a 47yearold black police officer who preferred helping youngsters to making arrests, has been named an official ombudsman to look after the rights of children held in the city's oftentroubles Spofford Juvenile Center.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JULY 7, 1975

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LOS ANGELES, July 6 (UPI)The 79foot ketch Ondine out of New York took over the boatforboat lead in the transPacific yacht race today with 400 miles logged from the start of the 2,225mile event from Los Angeles to Honolulu. Second was Mark Johnson's 73foot ketch Windward Passage from Portland, Ore., with 389 miles reported from the start. Ondine, skippered by Sumner Long, was 80 miles south of Windward Passage, but 54 miles farther west.

title: Overa: CavaIli's L'Ormindo of 1600's at Caramoor
description: KATONAH, N.Y., July 5The Caramoor Festival's production of Francesco Cavalli's opera L'Ormindo began here tonight shortly after 8:30, and until around 10:45 it struck this listener as a mildly pleasant, stylistically inept bore. But then the mood changed suddenly from boisterousness to neartragedy, and the evening ended as a most moving experience. (The performance will be repeated at 8:30 P.M. Friday.)

title: NAVY DENIES CHARGE IT TRAINS ASSASSINS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (Reuters)A United States Navy spokesman categorically denied today a London newspaper report of a program in which the Navy allegedly prepared convicted murderers to carry out assassinations.

title: Pay 'N Pak Wins Hydroplane Event
description: MADISON. Ind., July 6 (UPI)Pay 'N Pak, chalking up two course records en route, won the $30,000 Indiana Governor's Cup race for unlimited hydroplanes today on the Ohio River.

title: Study of Consumer Views Indicates a Slow Recovery
description: Widespread expectations of a slow economic recovery have been bolstered by a report that American consumers are not likely to spend very heavily during the early months of the forthcoming expansion.

title: Dr. Lillie M. Jackson Dies; Maryland N.A.A.C.P. Chief
description: BALTIMORE, July 5 (AP)Dr. Lillie M. Jackson, president emeritus of both the Baltimore and Maryland units of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, died yesterday at her home here. She was 86 years old.

title: Verrazzano College Faces a Dim Future With Fall Term Out
description: Verrazzano College, the financially ailing Italianoriented college in Saratoga Springs, will not open again next fall, and may be forced to close for good.

title: Ballet Theater Having a Great Season
description: The first week is over, and we are in for five more, anti if the first week was the measure of anything but impossibly blind luck, what we are in for is American Ballet Theater's finest season in its 35yearold history. Ballet Theater is at the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center for its customary summer stint and is dancing as if it thought it was the finest ballet company in the world. Which, taking everything into consideration, it may at this moment well be. It has the repertory, it has the dancers and has that mixture of confidence, arrogance and rightness that seems to betoken the morale of the truly great dance company.

title: Downpour Halts Subways, Stranding Holiday Riders
description: Thousands of travelers returning from holiday trips were stranded in Manhattan bus and subway stations late yesterday after heavy rainfall caused extensive flooding and power outages that halted most subway service for more than three hours in Manhattan and Queens.

title: Portuguese Syndicalism
description: The Portuguese Communist partyone of the most Stalinist and loyally proSoviet groups in the worldenjoys influence far disproportionate to the small share of the popular vote it won in the recent election. It is much better organized than other rival groups and has the material, financial and political power of the Soviet Union behind it.

title: TV: On Two Portraits of North American Indians
description: While a debate buzzes in certain quarters on whether national public TV programing should be aimed at general or targeted audiences, (minorities, women, etc.), the Public Broadcasting Service response seems to endorse general for the most part but sometimes targeted. Tonight, for instance, all three hours of prime time are being devoted to portraits of the North American Indian. Broken Treaty at Battle Mountain begins at 8, The Shadow Catcher at 9:30.

title: Comoro Islands Unilaterally Sever Ties With France
description: MORONI, Comoro Islands, July 6 (Reuters)The Parliament of this Indian Ocean archipelago declared independence of French rule today, apparently preempting a move that would have allowed one of the four islands to remain French.

title: Bomb Detectors Summoned As President Ford Golfs
description: BETHESDA, Md., July 6 (AP) The Secret Service called in United States Capitol police with a dog trained for bomb detection today to inspect the locker room at Burning Tree Country Club because a suspicious individual was spotted there while President Ford was golfing.

title: Banking Industry Is a Leader in Employment Stability
description: If Horace Greeley were alive, his advice today probably would be not Go West, young man, but Go into banking, young man.

title: Penn Is Shooting a New Western in Montana
description: VIRGINIA CITY, Mont.The little big people have returned to southwestern Montana, but this time they're looking for maimed white folks, not healthy Indians.

title: Pesticides Again Threaten Life of Louisiana Pelicans
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 6Farm pesticides are once again threatening to destroy Louisiana's state bird, the brown pelican.

title: Bujones Talks of His Stardom With the Ballet Theater
description: Baryshnikov now has the publicity, but I have the talent says Fernando Bujones.

title: Blast Hits a Jet in Pakistan After Passengers Debark
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, July 6 (Reuters) A bomb left under a seat caused an explosion that damaged a Pakistan International Airlines jet a half hour after it landed here last night on a domestic flight from Karachi, airline sources said today.

title: Keith Richard Charged
description: FORDYCE, Ark., July 6 (AP) The British rock guitarist, Keith Richard of the Rolling Stones, was free on $162 bond today after being charged with reckless driving and illegal possession of a knife, police officials said.

title: MANDEL INQUIRY STIRS MARYLAND
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md. July 6Investigatory politics of the type that led to the downfall of Vice President Agnew in 1973 is having a brisk revival here in a public relations battle between the United States attorney's office and Gov. Marvin Mandel.

title: Original Tuxedo Band Plays Ferry
description: The jazz that went up the Hudson River on a Staten Island ferry yesterday, the last day of the Newport Jazz Festival, was partly New Orleans, as it should be since the tradition of jazz on a riverboat stems from New Orleans. But it was also French, and in this respect, a new tradition may be in the making.

title: Bolt of Lightning Hits Jackpot: Burglar Alarms
description: A bolt of lightning struck a transformer in Oradell, N. J., during yesterday's storm, causing the alarm board at the local Police Department to light up with dozens of false burglar alarms.

title: CITY FIREMEN BAR DELAY IN PAY RISE
description: The head, of the tire fighters union yesterday rejected a proposal that his men accept twoyear city bonds at 6 per cent interest in lieu of a wage increase due them under their contract in this fiscal year.

title: Pollster Tells Mayors That Public Doesn't Trust Them
description: BOSTON, July 7The bigcity mayors meeting here feel themselves a hapless lot. The mayors, predominantly Demotic, say that the Republican administration in Washington does not care about the cities, complain that their budgets are menaced by municipal unions, and at lunch today they were ??old by Lou Harris, the pollster, that the public does not trust them.

title: New Computer, Model 12, is Announced by I.B.M.
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday a new model of its System/3 line of comouters. the Model 12.

title: POSTAL WORKERS THREATEN STRIKE
description: A high official of the National Association of Letter Carriers warned yesterday that the city would be hit by a mail deliverers' strike July 21 unless the letter carriers had a new contract continuing the no layoff provision won in 1971.

title: Ruffian Is Buried Near the Finish Line in Belmont Park Infield
description: While grooms and other members of her stable family watched mutely, Ruffian was buried last night at sundown in the infield at Belmont Park.

title: Bridge:
description: Perhaps the most satisfactory form of team contest is the double knockout, in which two losses spell elimination. This was for many years the format of the Vanderbilt Cup and the Spingold Trophy events, the most important national contests. The system was abandoned reluctantly because of the scheduling difficulty imposed by large numbers of teams.

title: Bicentennial Half Dollar To Have 550 Million Run
description: Distribution was halted yesterday on the halfdollar Americans have come to know, and in its place, the United States Mint released a new Bicentennial 50cent piece, scheduled to be produced until Jan. 1, 1977. The run projected by the Mint would put 550 million of the new pieces in circulation.

title: VIOLATIONS LISTED AT 12 FOOD OUTLETS
description: The Health Department has sited 12 food businesses for failing to correct violations on second inspection. They have been warned that they face closing orders if the violations persist upon a third and final inspection.

title: Western Europe's Militant Minorities Find Common Cause in Secret Meeting
description: SAINTJEANDELUZ, France In a strange combination of causes and terrors, activist European minority groups held a secret meeting in Trieste last year, according to members of the Basque militant organization.

title: Open Interest
GURNEY SAYS FUNDS WERE NOT REPORTED
description: TAMPA, Fla., July 7 (UPI)Former Senator Edward J. Gurney testified at his briberyconspiracy trial today that no attempt was made initially to report money collected by his fundraiser, Larry Williams, in 1971 and 1972.

title: Brazil Plans U.S. Deal
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 7 (Reuters)  Brazil, which has signed multi milliondollar nuclear energy agreements with West Germany and France, plans to sign contracts with the United States for high temperature reacators, according to a Government official.

title: ALLAN G. HALL
description: Allan G, Hall of Glen Cove, L. I., retired manager of distribution for the Brooklyn Union Gas Company, died Sunday in Ridgewood, N. J. He was 66 years old.

title: GUARDSMAN FREED IN KENT STATE CASE
description: CLEVELAND, July 7 (UPI)Charges against a former Ohio National Guardsman, who admitted firing two warning shots into the air at Kent State University more than five years ago, were dismissed today on a motion from attorneys for the plaintiffs.

title: Merchants Score Byrne On IncomeTax Setbacks
description: NEWARKNew Jersey businessmen have indicated in a series of recent interviews that, like other residents of the state, they are irritated and confused by the current performance of Governor Byrne and by his inability to get the Democratic majority in the State Senate to approve an income tax.

title: 6 Indicted as Nadjari Seeks to Solve Theft of the French Connection Drugs
description: Five close associates of Vincent Papa Sr., a major narcotics trafficker, and one of Mr. Papa's lawyers were accused yesterday of blocking attempts by a special grand jury to solve the theft of more than $70million worth of narcotics in the French Connection case from the Police Department Property Clerk's Office.

title: News Summary and Index.
description: Argentine workers went ahead with a twoday general strike, despite the Government's lastminute effort to prevent it by announcing the resignation of the entire Cabinet Sunday night. The resignationsparticularly that of the Social Welfare Minister, Jos Lpez Regahad been one of the demands of labor unions, which are also asking the Government to permit the carrying out of wage agreements that would provide increases ranging from 80 per cent to 130 per cent. A Government statement said the eight Cabinet ministers would remain in office until President Isabel Martnez de Pern could select replacements, [Page 1 Columns 12.]

title: Federal Paper Profit Off; Other Data
3 Yankee Homers Sink Rangers, 52
description: Unlike previous encounters this season between the Yankees and Texas Rangers, when World War M seemed imminent, the teams acted last night as if they were holding a joint summer picnic in the Sheep Meadow at Central Park.

title: DOUGLAS'S FUTURE ON COURT ASSAYED
description: WASHINGTON. July 7The physical capacity of Associate Justice William O. Douglas to return to the Supreme Court next October remains in serious doubt amid unchallenged reports that his colleagues have curbed his attempts to vote as an absentee Justice.

title: C.A.B. Acts to Ease Curbs On Airlines' Competition
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board formally proposed yesterday an experiment that would permit existing or new airlines to enter into or withdraw from competition on selected routes without the board's permission. The airlines would also have considerable freedom to raise or lower fares.

title: INCREASE SHOWN BY U. S. DOLLAR
description: BRUSSELS, July 7 (UPI)The dollar closed higher on European money markets today, sustaining last week's overall advance. The price of gold declined.

title: TAIPEI DENIES WORK ON ATOMIC WEAPONS
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 7Chinese Nationalist officials today denied a report by Time magazine indicating that Taiwan was developing nuclear weapons.

title: Yankee Records
OIL MONEY GOES TO EUROCURRENCY
description: BASEL, Switzerland, July 7 (Reuters)Deposits by Middle Eastern countries continued to be the most important single source of new funds to the Eurocurrency market in the first quarter of 1975, the Bank for International Settlements reported today.

title: C.A.B. Acts to Ease Curbs On Airlines' Competition
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board formally proposed yesterday an experiment that would permit existing or new airlines to enter into or withdraw from competition on selected routes without the board's permission. The airlines would also have considerable freedom to raise or lower fares.

title: C.I.A. Allegedly Flew Unwitting Officials
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Intelligence sources said today that members of Congress, two Vice Presidents and other politicians had flown chartered flights on a Washingtonbased airline, unaware that the line was owned and operated by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: New Hampshire Senator
description: This year 1975 is already more than half gone, but the State of New Hampshire still has only half of the representation in the United States Senate to which it is constitutionally entitled. The impasse which has prevented the seating of a second Senator from that state had its origin in the extreme closeness of the actual vote in New Hampshire but has been absurdly prolonged by the political maneuvering that has marked Senate consideration of the issue both in committee and in the Senate as a whole.

title: Curtis Assails Democrats On New Hampshire Senator
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI) A Republican Senator accused Democrats today of openly violating the Constitution in the bitterlY partisan dispute over the election for Senator from New Hampshire last November.

title: James Brown Appears In Slick Show at Garden
description: The rather nervous master of ceremonies for James Brown's show Sunday night at Madison Square Garden kept referring to Mr. Brown as this young man. Whatever else he may be, Mr. Brown does not suggest the image of lissome youth. He is solid and stolid onstage, his generous middle girded by an, unusually highwaisted, broadbelted pair of pants. And his whole performance has an almost middleaged quality to it, these days.

title: Dr. Anthony Cipollaro, 74, Dies; SkinDisease Therapy Expert
description: Dr. Anthony C. Cipollaro, a prominent dermatologist and teacher, died Saturday of a heart attack in New York Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: Nicklaus's Warmup 65 Awes British Open Field
description: CARNOUSTIE, Scotland, July 7 (UPI)Jack Nicklaus reeled off his fourth successive under par practice round today and was proclaimed the overwhelming favorite by his colleagues to win the 104th British Open golf tournament, which starts Wednesday.

title: More People Sent to Farms
description: HONG KONG, July 7 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Saigon radio said today that 3,500 more residents of Da Nang had been sent to the countryside to work on farms.

title: REDS IN CONTROL, LAOTIANS BELIEVE
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 6The Pathet Lao takeover of this country, and with it the completion of the Communist victory in Indochina, is now accepted as an accomplished fact by most Laotians and foreign observers.

title: The Left Hand vs. The Right
description: Every time a sane man begins to wonder whether the left hand knows what the right hand is doing in this country, he has to conclude either that (a) he is not so sane after all, or (b) the left hand has no idea what the right hand is doing, and vice versa.

title: SUGAR FUTURES SHOW BIG GAINS
description: World sugar and cocoa futures showed sizable gains yesterday.

title: Bill to Let City Halt Pay Raises Weighed
description: ALBANY, July 7  Mayor Beame and key Democrats in the Legislature are quietly discussing a proposed bill that would give the Mayor the power to declare a state of emergency in New York City and to suspend the wageincrease provisions of existing contracts with municipalemploye unions.

title: A RecordBreaking Filly Throughout Her Career
description: Ruffian set or equaled eight stakes records in eight attempts and won seven of her first 10 races by at least six lengths.

title: Bank Disclosure Ruling Reported to Be Reversed
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 James E. Smith, Controller of the Currency, has apparently reversed an initial opinion and ruled that a law establishing the right of shareholders of a nationally charted bank to see the names of fellow shareholders means what it says.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Hunter, 7 Others on AllStars' Staff

title: Koch Cards 68, Leads Ike Golf
description: CLIFTON, N. J., July 7Dave Koch or Bellport, L.I., an elementary school principal who plays with a 5 handicap, carved out a 34, 34 68, four under par, today and took a onestroke lead in the 23d Ike golf tournament on the 6,955yard Upper Montclair Country Club course.

title: Vatican Furthering Ecumenical Efforts At the Local Level
description: ROME, July 7The Vatican issued a document today that encourages ecumenical initiatives by the Roman Catholic Church at the local level but admonishes that such initiatives must remain in harmony with the bonds of Catholic communion.

title: CAREY, IN HOUSE, DREW OIL SALARY
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Hugh L. Carey was on the payroll of his brother's oil company during each of the 14 years he served as a Representative in Congress.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Gunfire Said to Have Downed F .B .I. Helicopter on Reservation
description: OGLALA, S. D., July 7 (UPI) Gunfire shot down an F.B.I. helicopter being used in the search for the killers of two agents on the Pine Ridge Oglala Sioux Reservation, Federal sources said today.

title: Suit to Halt Bonds Sale By State Agency Is Dropped
description: A suit filed last Thursday in State Supreme Court challenging the constitutionality of the Municipal Assistance Corporation and the city's capital budget was withdrawn yesterday by the plaintiff without explanation.

title: CLIFTON E. LAWRENCE
description: SUSSEX, N. J., July 7 CAP)Clifton E. Lawrence, a Republican candidate for the Assembly in the 15th District, died at his home here today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: Byrne ls Rebuffed in Effort To Oust De Rose From Unit
description: NEWARK, July 7A State Superior Court judge rebuffed today Governor Byrne's efforts to remove Ralph C. DeRose as the New Jersey member of the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor.

title: Jerusalem Skyline: Morels Not Necessarily Better
description: JERUSALEMMayor long ago Mayor Teddy Kollek enthusiastically showed visitors the new structures on the way up in this ancient city. Now he seems to point with as much pride to the projects he has helped to prevent. And, he talks of the city's need to learn from its mistakes.

title: COST OF CLEANUP PUT AT $713.500
description: The city spent $713,500 in timeandahalf pay for sanitationmen who worked on the Fourth of July to clean up after their twoday strike earlier last week, but the cost was more than offset by about $1.2million in wages forfeited by most of the 10,000 uniformed garbage collectors during the stoppage to protest layoffs.

title: Hockey Assault Trial On
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 7 (AP) The presiding judge in the assault trial of Dave Forbes of the Boston Bruins rejected today a defense request for dismissal of the charge.

title: Advertising
description: Vast changes are taking place in the area of promoting ethical pharmaceuticals and other healthcare products to the professional market, as far as William A. Praetorius, the new president of Healthmark Communications, is concerned.

title: U.S., Agencies Get 111Page Guideline on Privacy
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Office of Management and Budget made public today the 111page set of interpretive guidelines to direct all Federal departments and agencies in carrying out the Privacy Act of 1974.

title: WILLIAM W. HOFFMAN
description: William W. Hoffman, a member of the New York Stock Exchange for 25 years and a former member of the American Stock Exchange, died Sunday at his home in Fort Lee, N.J. His age was 72.

title: People in Sports
description: Basically a nice guy and the best tennis player in the world were the words Arthur Ashe used yesterday in Pittsburgh to describe Jimmy Connors, the man he defeated on Saturday in the men's singles final at Wimbledon. He denied the contest was a grudge match because Connors is suing Ashe for $5million for libel and a charge of restraint of trade.

title: A.M.A. Aide Let Upjohn Use Letter to Sell Drug
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The chief executive officer of the American Medical Association wrote a letter early this year to state and county officials of the association minimizing questions that had been raised in the association's own magazine about the safety of a widely used diabetes drug.

title: Radio
Miss Bueno Gains 76, 63 Victory
description: ATLANTIC CITY, July 7 (AP)Jane Stratton of Salt Lake City upset Ceci Martinez of San Francisco, 64, 16, 64, at the start of the second tournament on the new Ms. America women's tennis circuit today.

title: Why They Can't Save Every Injured Horse
description: Even at bushleague tracks, they seldom shoot race horses with real bullets anymore.

title: Toll is Unusually Light in Israeli Attack on Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 7Damage and casualties were surprisingly light for a largescale operation when Israel attacked Palestinian camps and villages in southern Lebanon by land, sea and air early today.

title: Somalia Looks to U.S. Aid After Visit by Delegation From House.
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, July 7A second American Congressional delegation has now visited Berbera, the site of a Sovietbuilt missilehandling facility, and Somali officials hope the result of the two visits will be a resumption of United States aid.

title: After All These Years, an American Night in Monte Carlo
description: MONTE CARLO, July 5Lieut. L.C. Stabler of Dothan, Ala., his tanned, relaxed school album smile contrasting with his firmly starched whites, leaned toward Christina Dolan and asked, And who is that groovy, absolutely dishy girl over there?

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Reversing a threejudge panel, the Temporary Emergency Court of Appeals held 4 to 3 today that the Government's twotier system of regulating crudeoil prices is lawful.

title: Alcan and Howmet Delay Price Rises
description: The Alcan Aluminum Corporation and the Howmet Corporation indicated yesterday their intentions of complying with the Government's request that aluminum producers delay for 30 days instituting price increases that were scheduled to go into effect yesterday. This seemingly brought the entire industry into compliance.

title: A.M.A. Aide Let Upjohn Use Letter to Sell Drug
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The chief executive officer of the American Medical Association wrote a letter early this year to state and county officials of the association minimizing questions that had been raised in the association's own magazine about the safety of a widely used diabetes drug.

title: ROBERT D. MILLER
description: Robert D. Miller, a partner and creative director of the Warwick, Welsh & Miller advertising agency, died Friday in Maimonides Medical Center of pneumonia. He was 47 years old and lived at 975 Park Avenue.

title: PRESIDENT URGES CURB ON U.S. ROLE ON HIGHWAY FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 President Ford outlined today a new Federal highway program intended to give states and localities greater flexibility in setting transportation priorities.

title: Public Service Jobs Are Reported Filled Outside Guidelines
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)A new internal report by the Labor Department's chief investigator says that 16.5 per cent of Federal publicservice jobs checked were improperly filled.

title: Concorde Beats Schedule On LondonBahrain Flight
description: BAHRAIN, July 7 (Reuters)The BritishFrench supersonic Concorde made its first passengercarrying flight today from London to Bahrain.

title: No Tax Breaks Needed
description: A major new issue in Federal tax policy is whether additional tax incentives are needed to spur investment in productive equipment by American industry. The Ford Administration, with the strong backing of business groups, the securities industry and many conservatives, has launched a campaign for new tax breaks to encourage saving and investment, arguing that they are essential if the United States is to overcome a looming capital shortage and achieve faster growth in productivity, total output and employment.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: In Pursuit of Rainbow Trout on the Delaware
description: LORDVILLE, N.Y.It was shortly after noon when we set forth on the Delaware River near this small community and headed downstream for a short distance to a pool where we knew large rainbow trout lurked.

title: Scientists Finally Learning What Attracts Mosquitoes
description: For most of the next three months, millions of Americans will be battling an ancient quarterinchlong pest that forces some persons to don heavy clothing in sweltering heat, others to coat themselves with pungent sprays and oils and still others to seek screenedin shelter.

title: KARL E. HASSEL, 79, ZENITH COFOUNDER
description: EVANSTON, Ill., July 7 (UPI)Karl E. Hassel, a radio pioneer and cofounder of the Zenith Radio Corporation, died today of a heart attack at. Evanston Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: Two O.A.S. Aides Prod the U.S. To Resolve Panama Canal Issue
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The incoming and outgoing heads of the Organization of American States called on the United States today to resolve the problem of the Panama Canal as soon as possible.

title: Alaska Interstate Set to Make Offer For Apco Oil Stock
description: The Alaska Interstate Company of Houston, which is engaged in transmission and distribution of natural gas in Alaska, said yesterday that it intends to offer to purchase 1.5 million shares of common stock of the Apco Oil Corporation, also of Houston, at $17.50 a share.

title: Breeze of Summer Moves Into the Palace
description: Leslie Lee's drama The First Breeze of Summer is among the very best crafted American plays of the season, and this year it gave the Negro Ensemble Company one of its biggest successes yet at its home, the intimate and agreeable St. Marks Playhouse. Now the play, with virtually the same cast, has transferred from one of Manhattan's smallest theaters to one of Manhattan's largest, the Palace, and it was legitimate to fear that some kind of sea change might have overtaken it on the voyage.

title: Italian Living Index Rises
description: ROME, July 7 (Reuters)The Italian cost of living index rose 0.8 per cent from April to 169,4 (base of 100 in 1974) in May, the national statistics institute said today. This represents a 19.7 per cent rise from May, 1974.

title: Music: Marlboro, at 25, Basks in Light of Serkin
description: MARLBORO, Vt., July 7 Rudolf Sorkin, beaming as fondly as everybody's favorit?? uncle at the 25th family reunion, looked ovr the scene at the Marlboro Music Festival and found it good. The festival, which he helped found in 1950, had just closed its first weekend of concerts with his ardent performance of Mozart's Concerto in B flat (K.595), and the renowned Marlboro spirit was on the 72yearold pianist's mind.

title: JOHN R. M'LEAN DIES; AIRCRAFT EXECUTIVE
description: John R. McLean, a retired aircraft executive and sportsman, died of cancer yesterday in Good Samaritan Hospital in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 59 years old.

title: Lighter Trucks Would Also Cost More
description: DETROIT, July 7 (AP)The General Motors Corporation has indicated it may raise prices on its 1976model cars and light trucks by up to 6 per cent, or an average of about $300 a car.

title: Notes on People
description: A White House spokesman yesterday altered the original explanation as to why President Ford did not meet last week with Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn, the exiled Russian author, and acknowledged that the chief reason was that President Ford believed such a meeting might have displeased the Soviet Union and clouded dtente.

title: Books of The Times
description: E. L. Doctorow's Ragtime is a highly original experiment in historical fiction. But the first thing to be said about it is that it works. It works so well that one devours it in a single sitting as if it were the most conventional of entertainments. And the reviewer is tempted to dispense with heavy breathing and analysis and settle down to mindless celebration of the pure fun of the thing. Of the passages in which one Harry Houdini, grown dissatisfied with being a trickster, an illusionist, a mere magician, sails to Europe, learns to fly a Voisin biplane and performs a few turns before the Archduke Franz Ferdinand, who gazed . . . with stupid heavylidded eyes and didn't seem to know who Houdini was. He congratulated him on the invention of the airplane. Or of the scene in which a J.P. Morgan and a Henry Ford get together in a mansion on New York's West 36th Street, exchange their respective thoughts on reincarnation and found the most secret and exclusive club in America, The Pyramid, of which they were the only members.

title: MINE UNION HEARS APPEAL BY WILSON
description: SCARBOROUGH, England, July 7Prime Minister Harold Wilson today delivered his strongest plea so far for a 10 per cent limit on new wage increases to the group that, on past performance, threatens him mostthe National Union of Mineworkers.

title: 43% in Poll Feel Kennedy Would Inspire Confidence
description: The Harris Poll reported yesterday that a 43to38 per cent plurality of Americans felt that Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, would inspire confidence in the White House, according to The Associated Press.

title: No Valid Claims Found By Berkey in Polaroid Suit
description: Berkey Photo, Inc., announced yesterday that it had received, and reviewed a copy of the complaint in the suit filed last week by the Polaroid Corporation charging that Berkey's Wizard XF 1000 infringed on a number of Polaroid's patents.

title: Webb Wins for Mets, 31
EQUITY FINANCING
description: Taco Bell, Torrance, Calif., has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission up to 495,000 shares of common stock held by Glen W. Bell Jr., the company's chairman and principal stockholder. The proposed offering will be handled by an underwriting group headed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., and Bateman, Eichler, Hill, Richards, Inc.

title: Ordaining of Women Opposed
description: ROME, Jnly 7 (AP)The Roman Catholic and Russian Orthodox Churches have reaffirmed their opposition to the ordination of women priests, a joint communique said today after a meeting of church leaders.

title: Tomahawks Win Battle for First
description: MONTREAL, July 7Jan Magee broke an 1111 deadlock at 5 minutes 41 seconds of the final period and the Long Island Tomahawks went on to register a 1612 victory over the Montreal Quebecois tonight at The Forum. The triumph of the Tomahawks in sole possession of first place in the National Lacrosse League.

title: But Corporate Bond Sector Sustains Moderate Falls
description: A sudden demand for Treasury bills apparently surfaced early yesterday afternoon at the Treasury Department's weekly auction and bolstered prices in a sagging Government securities market that had been undermined by the recent firming of shortterm rates.

title: Tennis Results
description: VALLEY CIRCUIT MEN'S At Inwood C.C.

title: Pregnant Women to Be Allowed To Stay in the Military Forces
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Married and unmarried women in the military forces who become pregnant will be permitted to stay in service under a new Pentagon policy.

title: JOHN F. BARRY
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., July 7 (AP)John F. Barry, a longtime Boston Globe sports writer, died today at Jordan Hospital. He was 66 years old.

title: Amnesty Reopening Urged
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI)  Senators Gaylord Nelson, Democrat of Wisconsin, and Jacob K. Davits, Republican of New York, called on President Ford today to reopen his amnesty program for Vietnam draft resisters and military deserters. In a letter to Mr. Ford, the two Senators said that several hundred men who wanted to participate in the program missed the March 31 cutoff date. The two also introduced legislation that would reopen the earlier clemency program with a number of modifications.

title: Jacob Bjerknes, Meteorologist And Forecasting Pioneer, Dies
description: LOS ANGELES, July 7 (UPI)Dr. Jacob Bjerknes, a meteorologist and a pioneer in scientific weather forecasting, died today at the U.C.L.A. Medical Center. He was 77 years old and lived in Santa Monica.

title: U.S. BIDS ARE SOUGHT ON ISRAELI APLANT
description: TEL AVIV, July 7 (UPI)The Israel Electric Corporation asked three American companies to submit bids for building the country's first nuclear power station.

title: U.S. and Poland Are Tied In Track Meet at Prague
description: PRAGUE, Czechoslovakia, July 7 (AP)A strong showing in men's running events carried the United States track and field team to a tie today in combined points with favored Poland. Today's program was the first of a twoday meet in Prague with Poland and Czechoslovakia.

title: Energy Report
description: In an effort to gain a comprehensive and uptodate survey of the nation's energy needs and problems, Congress last year required the new Energy Research and Development Administration to prepare a series of reports annually. ERDA has just submitted its first report, Creating Energy Choices for the Future.

title: Crash Kills Four in Family
description: CHICAGO, July 7 (UPI)A collision on the Dan Ryan Expressway killed four members of a Chicago family, including two children, and critically injured a Rockford, Ill., truck driver today. The dead were identified as Travis Pate, 28 years old; his wife, Delores, 29; and their sons, Travis, 8 and Thurman, 2.

title: PRESIDENT URGES CURB ON U.S. ROLE ON HIGHWAY FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 President Ford outlined today a new Federal highway program intended to give states and localities greater flexibility in setting transportation priorities.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The parking fee at Jones Beach will increase at midnight tonight from $1 to $2. State officials said yesterday the 100 per cent rise was levied by the State Department of Parks and Recreation in Albany, as ordered last. May by the Carey administration. The additional revenue is to be used to finance state bonds for park development and improvements, the officials said.

title: Taiwanese Golf Victor
description: SAPPORO, Japan, July 6 (AP)  Hsieh YungYo of Taiwan shot a twounderpar 70 today for an 11underpar total of 277 to win the $68,965 Sapporo open golf tournament by two strokes.

title: Pressure Is Exerted by Outlook for Rise in the Prime Rate
description: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange fell yesterday along a broad front in slow trading.

title: 2 Minor Problems Overcome For Joint Orbital Flight
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., July 7 (UPI)Two minor problems were overcome today by engineers preparing for America's half of next week's joint orbital flight with a Russian spaceship.

title: DR. TODOS M. ODARENKO
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 Dr. Todos M. Odarenko, an engineer and physicist, died here today at Georgetown University Hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: A JULY 28 SUMMIT BARRED BY FINLAND
description: GENEVA, July 7 (Reuters) Finland announced today that she was no longer able to stage a final summit session of the European security conference in Helsinki on July 28 because not enough time remained to make the preparations, conference sources said.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money Rates for Monday.

title: Israeli Envoy Returns to U.S. for New Talks
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Ambassador Simcha Dinitz of Israel returned to Washington this afternoon and promptly met with Secretary of State Kissinger to report on Israel's decision to postpone action on a new agreement with Egypt until she receives further clarification of both Egyptian and American views.

title: LAW ALLOWS CITY TO TAX THE STATE
description: New York City and other localities have had the right since April 1 to levy service chargesin effect, taxeson New York State property within their boundaries, officials disclosed here yesterday.

title: Greer Expresses Sorrow
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., July 7 (AP)Im very sorry Ruffian broke down and had to be destroyed, John L. Greer, owner of Foolish Pleasure, said today. You always hate to see these things happen, but thats the chance you take in racing.

title: Usefulness of Match Race Is Questioned
description: The atmosphere at Belmont Park yesterday was truly a somber one, with the news of the tragic death of Ruffian almost universally discussed.

title: REDS CALL ALERT IN LISBON CRISIS
description: LISBON, July 7The Communist party said today that it alerted its militants last Friday amid reports of a move by part of the armed forces against Premier Vasco Goncalves.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: July 8, 1975

title: Poem by Black Annoys London Police
description: LONDON, July 7An angry poem by a young black woman has stirred a sharp controversy between London's police and race relations officials.

title: Market Place
description: The market for minicom puters is still booming, although not so spectacularly as in the recent past, according to a study just completed by the publisher of modern Data magazine.

title: Beirut Is in Contact With the Kidnappers
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 7Premier Rashid Kararni announced today that the Government had made contact with a leftist group calling itself the Revolutionary Socialist Action Organization that is holding an American Army colonel hostage. It has threatened to kill him by Wednesday night if certain demands are not met.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Congress Plans New Push to Control Toxic Chemical Productst
description: WASHINGTONOakley Dingess, a 38yearold former high school athlete who until two years ago seldom had a day's illness, now shambles unsteadily around his modest ranchstyle home in a suburb of Columbus, Ohio.

title: Marcos Says He Wants Control Over U.S. Bases in Philippines
description: MANILA, July 7President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that the Philippines wanted to assume control of all American bases in the country while allowing the United States to use them to maintain an effective presence over the air and sea lanes of the western Pacific.

title: Newspaper Trend: Stress Local News, Cut National and Foreign Coverage
description: A trend is developing on many newspapers around the country: Hit heavy on local news and people and service articles; deemphasize national and foreign news.

title: Jerusalem Skyline: More Is Not Necessarily Better
description: JERUSALEMNot long ago Mayor Teddy Kollek enthusiastically showed visitors the new structures on the way up in this ancient city. Now he seems to point with as much pride to the projects he has helped to prevent. And he talks of the city's needto learn from its mistakes.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ON THE TOWN Whatever happened to Street Scene and The Time of Your Life? It's hard to say. On the local scene, at least, neither prizewinning play has appeared on the boards In years, although Kurt Weill's operatic version of Elmer Rice's street drama has recently become popular even as the 1929 original has edged toward oblivion. William Saroyan's comedy of saloon derelicts in San Francisco has virtually disappeared. For that matter, television doesn't even bother may more with the Holywood versions of both plays.

title: UnionRuled City
description: The city is staggering out of its budget crunch with one thing clear: New York is working for its unionized civil service workers, not vice versa. The real power in the city is held by the municipal unions.
