description: NEW DELHI, July 15 (AP) Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, replying to a protest from Dr. Benjamin Spock, said today that her arrests of opposition leaders and suspension of civil liberties were needed to halt a dangerout drift in India.

title: It Does Almost Everything Except Wash the Dishes
description: The Starmix multipurpose kitchen machine that beats, kneads, slices, shreds, grates, grinds and blends has been imported from Germany and sold west of the Mississippi for a number of years, but it only recently became available in New York through The Pottery Barn, Inc., 231 Tenth Avenue and 117 East 59th Street. Clear the kitchen counter and at least one cupboard because, with all the attachments, it takes a lot of space and costs over $300.

title: 5,347,890,386,903,274,711,310 Sold
description: The old woman crossed herself, pushed aside her tattered coat and knelt down by the table to pray. Her lips moved, her head nodded up and down. Nobody paid much attention, even though she wars nowhere near a church.

title: Wilson, Steingut, Hurd, Marchi Called in NursingHome Inquiy
description: Morris B. Abram, chairman of the Moreland Commission on nursing homes, announced yesterday that a classic case of political interference that reached into the office of the Governor and the legislative leadership would be explored at three televised hearings next week.

title: Beacon Vibrates to Soul Beat Of Ecstasy, Passion and Pain
description: Ecstasy, Passion and Pain, a soulmusic group, appeared on Monday at the Beacon Theater, Broadway and 74th Street, and the last portion of the group's name was the feeling that came most readily to mind. It was not exactly the fault of the group, but soul singing and rhythm and blues vibrations, perhaps more than most, require some audience participation. Whether it is shouts of right on or get down, there has to be something communicating in front of and behind the stage lights.

title: Coriander Leaf and an Irresistible Soup An Herb Brightens Dishes of Many Nations
description: Chicken Chat

title: BOARD TO ENFORCE JOB LAWS IS URGED
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The United States Civil Rights Commission said today that the Federal effort to end job discrimination Was fundamentally inadequate and recommended that a new agency, a national employment rights board, be formed to enforce job protection laws.

title: Philadelphia Transit Grants
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) The Department of Transportation has approved grants of more than $50million for mass transit improvements in Philadelphia, the office of Sen. Hugh Scott, Republican of Pennsylvania, announced today. The grants include $25,040,000 for construction of a highspeedline connecting Philadephia International Airport with downtown and $25million for a downtown transit tunnel.

title: Lebanese Jeweler indicted On Charges of Espionage
description: Sarkis O. Paskalian, a 36yearold Lebanese citizen living here as a permanent resident alien, was indicted by a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn yesterday on four counts of conspiracy and espionage for the Soviet Union.

title: Cairo Warns It May Refuse U.N. PeaceForce Renewal
description: CAIRO, July 15Egypt said today that she would refuse to renew the mandate of the United Nations peacekeeping force in Sinai unless the Security Council took action to assure speedy Israeli withdrawal from occupied Arab territories. The mandate expires July 24.

title: District Attorneys Divided On Bill Easing Drug Law
description: The District Attorneys of Manhattan and the Bronx, who were key backers of legislation easing the state's drug laws, are now considering whether to ask Governor Carey to veto a bill that is an important part of the legislative package.

title: SENATORS CRITICAL OF SALE TO JORDAN
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The Administration's proposal to sell Jordan a $350million airdefense system ran into a critical but not overwhelmgly hostile reaction today from the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: DESERT LIFTOFF
description: MOSCOW, July 15With a mighty jet of white flame, a Soyuz spacecraft blasted off from its desert launching pad in Soviet Central Asia today, carrying two Soviet astronauts toward a rendezvous in space with three American astronauts.

title: Losers: Wait'll World Series
description: MILWAUKEE, July 15Why would the American League win the last three World Series against the best in the National League but still lose the last four AllStar games and 12 of the last 13?

title: NET UP SHARPLY AT BANKAMERICA
Palestinians Term Slain Lebanese in Carlos Affair a Comrade
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 15A radical Marxist Palestinian organization declared today that a Lebanese killed in Paris in the Carlos affair earlier this month was not a police informer but a comrade who event knowingly to his death.

title: North Vietnam Says People of the South Want Reunification
description: HONG KONG, July 15In what appeared to be a major statement on the case for reunification of North and South Vietnam, the official North Vietnamese press agency said today that almost all the people in the South wanted to join the North and that historic ties between the two halves of the country outweighed any differences.

title: Tanner, Martin Gain At Chicago
description: CHICAGO, July 15 (AP)Topseeded Roscoe Tanner and unseeded Billy Martin set the stage for their Thursday showdown as both advanced through the opening round of the $50,000 Chicago international tennis tournament tonight.

title: Campbell Says Forbes Was Contrite
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 15After appparing as a witness for the prosecution in the David Forbes trial today, Clarence Campbell, the National Hockey League president, said:

title: DR. HARRY GREENE
description: Dr. Harry Greene, a urologist, died Monday at the Jewish Hospital and Rehabilitation Center of New Jersey in Jersey City. He was 67 years old and lived in Bayonne, N.J.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Mrs. Edward H. Gerry, the owner of Forego, the 1974 thoroughbred horse of the year, said late yesterday she would decline an invitation to a match race between Forego and Foolish Pleasure. But Mrs. Gerry said she would like to see the two horses meet.

title: CNA Case Held Settled
description: All disputes and litigation between Healthco, Inc., and its major shareholder, the CNA Financial Corporation, have been resolved, it was announced yesterday by Marvin Myer Cyker, president and chief execcutive officer of Healthco. The agreement, he said, includes $12million in longterm subordinated financing to be made available by CNA Financial.

title: BOLIVIA HOLDS 33, INCLUDING 3 NUNS
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 15 (AP)Thirtythree people, including three Roman Catholic nuns, have been arrested for allegedly trying to organize a general strike against the military regime of Gen. Hugo Balmer Surez, it was announced today.

title: A 76 Leads Qualifying For Women
description: NORTHFIELD, N. J., July 15 (AP)Marilyn Smith, a secondyear pro from New Zealand, shot a fouroverpar 76 today and led 46 qualifiers for the 30th Women's United States Open golf championship, which starts here Thursday at the Atlantic City Country Club.

title: SENATE VOTES BILL TO KEEP OIL CURES
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The Senate adopted today, by a vote of 62 to 29, stopgap legislation that would allow price controls on crude oil to continue until next March, and here were indications that President Ford would permit this or a similar measure to become law.

title: Second Juror Is Seated in Trial of Joan Little
description: RALEIGH, N. C., July 15A second juror was seated today in the firstdegree murder trial of Joan Little, the young black woman who says that she killed a white jailer because he was trying to force her into sexual acts.

title: Suddenly, Shark Fisherman Is Center of Attraction
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., July 14I noticed it last weekend when we brought our fish back to hang up at the pier, Tommy Sealy Said. Everybody kind of looked at us like we were the devil's disciples or something.

title: J.D.L. Burns Rocket Model Here in Protesting Detente
description: Members of the Jewish Defense League burned an 8foot high cardboard rocket model outside the Soviet Mission to the United Nations today, saying that it and the dtente symbolized by the ApolloSoyuz space mission were shams.

title: National Security LSD
description: Often the crimes committed in the name of national security are carried out against grand and fuzzy backgrounds that obscure essentially simple lessons. But the LSD experiment on Frank R. Olson was different.

title: Pele's Signing Crystallizes Unrest Among U.S.Born Soccer Pros
description: The North American Soccer League has a ruling that each of the 15 established teams must have five Americanborn players and each of the five expansion clubs must have three Americans. But when Portland meets the New York Cosmos tonight no American player will be in the Timbers' starting lineup.

title: Agents Who Listen In
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The Central Intelligence Agency has denied vigorously that it ever planted any spies in the executive mansion, and the White House insists there certainly are none there now. But true or not, the allegations of C.I.A. penetration of the President's home and office serve to illustrate a curious fact of life in bureaucratic Washington: the Government routinely spies on itself because knowledge is power. The brutal truth, said a government veteran now serving in the White House, is that knowing something first can give you tremendous leverage.

title: Miss Hagey Wins In Grass Tennis
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 15 (AP)Seeded women players won their opening matches at the national amateur grasscourt tennis championships today.

title: The Prague Winter
description: ROXBURY, Conn.A curious people, the Czechs. Apparently always were. It took the mute, fogswirling atmosphere of Prague to inspire the rabbi who invented the Golem, a manmade man. In Shakespeare the King of Bohemia is always weird and his country seems to be where reason's light ends in a purple mist. Franz Kafka, reading his stories aloud, is said to have choked with laughterstories which the rest of world reads with uneasy fear. Prague in the Middle Ages sends forth brooding alchemists, casters of spells arid incantations. A city bf unearthly beauty, but with its head screwed funny.

title: UNION TO TAKE JOB FROM MINORITIES
description: Pressing longstanding charges by construction unions that public agencies condone illegal hiring practices, the 1,000member roofers union here prepared to force a confrontation on the issue by informing its own working minority members today that they were being replaced by unemployed whites.

title: Women's Golf Postponed
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., July 15The final round of the 21st Women's Cross County Golf Association betterball championship was postponed indefinitely today at Piping Rock Club because of an unplayable course.

title: A Note From Outer Space
description: HOUSTON, July 15 (UPI) Less than an hour after the launching of the Soyuz spaceship today a handwritten note from the crew was flashed on Houston Control's television monitors at the Johnson Space Center: We the Soyuz crewmen are sending our greetings and best wishes to the employes of the Houston Mission Control Center for a successful joint flight, the first international space flight.

title: Schedule of Space Events
description: The Apollo and Soyuz astronauts have no major activities scheduled today, and television networks are expected to limit their coverage to status reports.

title: 4 GYPSUM MAKERS PENALIZED BY U.S.
description: PITTSBURGH, July 15 (AP)Four gypsum manufacturers and three executives including the chairman and chief executive office of one of the concerns, were convicted by a jury in Federal court today of price fixing.

title: Canadian Policy on Border TV Brings a Protest by 14 Senators
description: Fourteen Senators have written to Secretary of State Kissinger protesting policies adopted by Canada toward the border television stations of the United States and urging the State Department to take a more active role in protecting the legitimate interests of those stations.

title: The Ballet: Makarova
description: Natalia Makarova is at that point in her career where she seems to be improving performance by performance. Her physique is remarkable: all bone, muscle, line and beautya grey??ound shape, with a long supple back, slim hips, long tapering legs. The neck emerges high and proud from shoulders slightly, but nicely, wider than might have been expected, and the small, delidate head is beautifully poised. It is a body for dancing, honed and refined, pulled and tortured by the rack of class, conditioned muscle by muscle by years of training, and now acting on the instant, sharp reflex of the music. It is an exquisite instrument.

title: Cosmetic Deal Readies Namath for Jets
description: Joe Nemeth will talk contract, today with the Jets, but he is secure in knowing that if he never throws another football he is guaranteed a quarter of a million dollars a year until he's at least 40 years old.

title: Five Countries Sign Accord That Gives Laos $11.6Million
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 15 (AP)The Laotian Government and representatives of five other countries signed a currency support agreement today providing $11.6million to bolster the shaky Laotian currency.

title: Books of The Times
description: Who was the reallife model for Dracula? What inspired Bram Stoker to write about him in the first place? Just who was Bram Stoker? Such questions haven't kept you tossing and turning at night like a maiden about to receive a visit from the infamous Count? Wall, how about these puzzles: Why does Dracula have hair on his palms? What is the significance in Western civilization of the garlic they stuff in Lucy Westenra's mouth after they've driven a threefoot spike through her heart and chopped off her head? And what is the meaning, depthpsychologywise, of Mr. Stoker's 1897 gothic fantasy? What is it like to actually read the bloody thing?

title: WINE TALK
description: CALISTOGA, Calif.Here on a wooded knoll rising from the floor of the lush Napa Valley is one of the four or five most beautiful wineries in the world.

title: $300Million Pan Am Aid Being Reappraised by Iran
description: The Government of Iran is making a cautious reappraisal of the proposed $300million deal by which it would help restore financial health to Pan American World Airways.

title: One of Giants' Kickers Walks Out of Camp
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., July 15Ricky Townsend, who barefooted his way to fame as a collegiate placekicker, tiptoed out of the New York Giants' training camp today.

title: Westchester Golf Put Off to July 21
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 15The Westchester County Golf Association's 53d open tournament was postponed today at the Stanwich Club because of unplayable conditions. The tournament will be played next Monday and Tuesday over the same course.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WHAT'S THE SCORE? With the increasing interest in new and old movie music, and the continuing cavalcade of soundtrack disks at record shops, aficionados have a chance to catch a behindthescenes film on the preparation of scores; with comments by the composers. The picture is Hollywood's Musical Moods, a onehour documentary in the summer festival of the New School presented at the Fifth Avenue Cinema (12th Street) tonight at 8 o'clock. Tickets are $1.50. The program also includes Sparrows (1925), with Mary Pickford.

title: FOUNDATION HELPS JOURNALISM STUDY
description: The trustees of the ScrippsHoward Foundation authorized scholarships and cash grants of more than $200,000 yesterday to undergraduates and graduate students in the field of journalism and to universities and colleges.

title: Two for the Lisbon Seesaw
description: LISBONIf the Armed Forces Movement of professional officers now running Portugal ever hands over its present governing power it will presumably be to one of two men, Alvaro Cunhal, boss of the tough, efficient Communist organization, or Mario Soares, the Socialist chief whose party won the April elections. The A.F.M. right now leans heavily toward Mr. Cunhal but Mr. Soares leads the strongest opposition force.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A state appeals court ordered a new hearing on a complaint by a group of Atlantic City taxpayers that a refuse concern had made a huge profit on a municipal garbage contract. The Appellate Division of the Superior Court Trenton sent the case back to the Atlantic County Law Division to reconsider the issues in the complaint. The Taxpayers Emergency Association for Relief in Atlantic City, and a nonresident taxpayer, Katherine Cramer, filed the suit against the city and the Jeddo Corporation, saying it was awarded a $148,000 contract in June, 1970, for garbage collection for two years, but assigned the work to two subcontractors for a total payment of $50,400. The suit sought to have the money returned to Atlantic City.

title: Church Will Call for Disclosure Of C.I.A. Report in Early August
description: WASHINGTON, July 15Senator Frank Church, chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, said today that he would recommend that the committee make public in early August its report on Central Intelligence Agency alleged involvement in assassinations, to avoid piecemeal disclosure of the contents in the press.

title: About Education
description: At the start of the seventies the issue of sexism in textbooks and instructional materials in schools became an important cause for feminists and for many educators.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York Telephone Company is preparing to charge for directory assistance calls beginning Sept. 1. Bills of all subscribers who do not use directory assistance will be cut 30 cents a month. Six free directory assistance calls will be allowed and charges will be levied for all other requests for such calls.

title: About the Jets...
description: Although the veterans weren't required to report to camp at Hempstead, Li, until Saturday night, Al Woodall showed up. The No. 2 quarterback was not looking to get in more time than Joe Namath, though. I think he just wanted to play some paddleball, said a club official of Woodall.... Three free agents were signed: Chris Kete, a Boston College center; Bucky Bookhart, defensive back from Anderson College, and David Boyd, a cornerbacksafety who played in the World Football League last season. Of 81 players invited to camp, 74 reported.

title: JERSEY'S FARMERS HIT HARD BY RAINS
description: The storms that have been pummeling New Jersey were among the worst ever experienced by farmers in the state, the Secretary of Agriculture, Philip A. Alampi, said yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON. July 15 (AP)The Ford Administration is considering legislation that would allow railroads to purchase trucking companies and could remove railroad transportation regulations on some routes for some commodities.

title: CAPE LAUNCHING
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., July 15Three American astronauts rode an Apollo spaceship into orbit today to begin their part in the historic rendezvous in space between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Gypsum Group Fined
description: Four of the largest gypsum producers and three executives were convicted of price fixing by a Federal court jury in Pittsburgh. The three executives were fined and given suspended prison sentences. Page 51.

title: Portugal Is Preparing to Dispatch Troops to StrifeTorn Angola
description: LISBON, July 15Portugal's military rulers prepared today to send troop reinforcements to the West African territory of Angola where fighting between two black nationalist movements in the last week has left hundreds of dead and wounded.

title: A Hamlet Recalls 1971 Tropical Storm
description: EAST MILLSTONE, N. J., July 15For a while, the squall that buffeted this Somerset County hamlet with a driving rain during the night reminded people around here of tropical storm Doria, which cut a swath through town four years ago.

title: C.I.A. Papers Said to Show Domestic Spying Traces to the 1950's
description: WASHINGTON, July 13The monitoring and infiltration of domestic political organizations by the Central Intelligkence Agency was both broader and of far longer duration than reported by the Rockefeller commission, according to newly released C.I.A. documents.

title: 18 Frenchmen Arrive Home After Guinea Frees Them
description: PARIS, July 15 (AP)Eighteen Frenchmen freed from jail by President Sekou Toure of Guinea arrived in Paris today. They appeared emaciated and refused to speak about their imprisonment to protect four other Frenchmen still held in the West African country.

title: Loans Sought in Strike in Pennsylvania
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 15Gov. Milton J. Shapp began trying today to arrange bank loans for thousands of jobless Pennsylvanians whose unemployment compensation has been delayed by a strike of the state's Social Service Workers.

title: U.S. Gives Planning Grants
description: TRENTON, July 15 (AP)The Department of Community Affairs today announced it had received $1.4million of Federal grants to aid improvements of its programs for state and local planning.

title: The Opera
description: Kiril Molchanov's The Dawns Are Quiet Here, which had its second and final performance here by the Bolshoi Opera on Monday night, is one of those works of patriotic poster art that evidently fulfill some deep need in Soviet society but are difficult for many outsiders to take seriously. The score, a skillful enough pastiche, evokes memories of Mussorgsky, VillaLobos, Tchaikovsky, Prokofiev and Muir Mathieson. There also is a folkopera tone to much of the work that might well disarm one.

title: Bronx Boy Says He Set 40 to 50 Fires for $3 Up
description: For the last three years, 15yearold Hector Rivera hase been a paid arsonist, hurning tenements in the South Bronx for as little as $3.

title: National League's 3Run 9th Earns a 63 AllStar Triumph
SENATE VOTES BILL TO KEEP OIL CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The Senate adopted today, by a voted of 62 to 29, stopgap legislation that would allow price controls on crude oil to continue until next March, and there were indications that President Ford would permit this or a similar measure to become law.

title: U.S. Feminists Say Mexico Parley Achieved Unity
description: Ten American feminists who attended the recent International Women's Year Tribune in Mexico City said here yesterday that they thought the Tribune had been a success, and that the disruptions that had occurred there were beyond their control.

title: Cubiculo Anthology Pursues the Spirit Of a Dance Season
description: The Cubiculo's annual anthology programs, though not entirely representative of its past dance season, at least give some feeling of its texture. In general one sees a predilection among both the younger and the more established choreographers, for the quick vignette or lyrical study rather than the more elaborate psychological explorations. The first program was performed Monday evening and the second will be offered on Friday and Saturday.

title: U.S. Watchful as Turks Harvest Poppies
description: ANKARA, TurkeyThe poppy harvest is beginning in Turkey, and American officials are cautiously optimistic about the chances of controlling the illicit sale of opium gum, the raw material for heroin.

title: Tomahawks Beat Quebecois, 1512
description: MONTREAL, July 15Doug Hayes, No. 1 draft choice of the Long Island Tomahawks, scored three goals and was credited with two assists as he led the defending champions of the National Lacrosse League to a 1512 victory over the Montreal Quebecois tonight at The Forum.

title: An Empty Shell
description: The fate of the United Nations General Assembly, if not the United Nations itself, has grown acutely problematic. If the grandiose appellation parliament of man was unduly lyrical from the start, it was neverand still is notunrealistic to conceive of the Assembly as the world forum for serious and significant discussion, and even for international accommodation. The question is whether enough of its members genuinely want to work toward that goal.

title: JOZSEF LENGYEL, NOVELIST, 79, DIES
description: BUDAPEST, July 15 (Reuters) Josef Lengyel, one of the first novelists from a Communist country to write about Stalin's labor camps, died here yesterday, the M.T.I. news agency reported today. He was 79 years old.

title: City Would Get Big Share of U.S. Aid
description: WASHINGTON, July 15New York City would receive $137.8million, more than any city in the country, if Congress passes the special emergency revenuesharing bill that comes before the Senate Government Operations Committee tomorrow.

title: City Borrowing to Pay Policemen $31Million Retroactive Raisei
description: The city will use the borrowing powers of its 197576 capital budget to pay retroactive raises of about $31million to its 23,000 police officers.

title: Gypsum Group Fined
description: Four of the largest gypsum producers and three executives were convicted of price fixing by a Federal court jury in Pittsburgh. The three executives were fined and given suspended prison settfences. Page 51.

title: Marriage Week to Open Mostly Mozart
description: The Mostly Mozart Festival will open Monday at Avery Fisher Hall with what its director calls a marriage week and the promise that the festival will continue next year even though it will have to move to Alice Tully Hall.

title: Swimmers More Timid
description: The Great Shark Scare on the nation's ocean beaches this summer is turning out to he just a little finneyphobia. Jaws, the film version of the Peter Benchley novel about a killer shark and his victims on a Fourth of July weekend, has taunted the psyches of millions of Americans in the last month.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: Behind Glitter of Bolshoi: Empty Seats at the Opera
description: The visit of the Bolshoi Opera for the last three weeks has been an event in this city's operatic life. But only a few of the performances have been sold out, and many have had large numbers of empty seats.

title: People and Business
description: Frederick B. Dent. the President's Special Representative for Trade Negotiations, urged a 90nation trade liberalization conference yesterday to seek some ambitious interim agreements that would aid its progress toward a larger general agreement.

title: Ford Hails 2 Launchings As a Mark of Cooperation
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) President Ford hailed the launchings today for the United StatesSoviet space missionas a wonderful expression of cooperation.

title: EnergyPolicy Battle
description: The battle between President Ford and Congressional Democrats over energy policy is on, and while it is impossible to be sure how it will come out, oil prices are likely to rise substantially. President Ford is strongly for deconof oil, but he has indicated a willingness to compromise with Congress over phasing decontrol of old oilnow $5.25 a barrelin over a period of two and a half years and putting a cap of $13.50 on a barrel of new domestic oil.

title: Regan Sees Banner Year Revenues Up 50%
description: Merrill Lynch & Co., Inc., parent company for Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the No. 1 brokerage house, reported yesterday that secondquarter profits soared more than tenfold to nearly $30million.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JULY 16, 1975

title: Passports Legally Issued
description: WASHINGTON, July 15United States officials reported today that two American pass ports found in a raid on a suspected terrorist hideout in Paris on June 27 had been legally issued to native New Yorkers.

title: PRAVDA ATTACKS EGYPTIAN PRESS
description: MOSCOW, July 15In a major defense of Soviet policy and prestige in the Middle East, Pravda attacked today what it caller antiSoviet propaganda being published in Egypt.

title: Joseph Durso
description: MILWAUKEE, July 15Outside the stadium, they were scalping tickets at $40 apiece for a baseball game you could stay home to watch for nothing on the tube. And that little act of confidence in the appetite of the American public underscored the point: The most urgent issue at the 46th AllStar Game tonight was not whether the American League would survive the tide of the National, but whether both leagues would survive the tide of economics. In a word, the issue was money.

title: Output Up 0.4% in June, Reversing 8Month Drop
description: WASHINGTON, July 15Industrial production, one of the most important statistical indicators of the economy, turned upward in June after eight months of mostly steep decline, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: AUTO SALES PACE PICKS UP IN JULY
description: DETROIT, July 15 (AP)Sales of United Statesbuilt cars in early July were the highest for the first 10 days of a month since last October, reports from the nation's four major auto manufacturers showed today.

title: Minority Scholarship Organization To Halve Aid for Medical Students
description: After seven years of what it termed almost phenomenal growth, an organization that has provided scholarship money to minoritygroup medical students for 29 years says its available aid money has been reduced by nearly half for next year, denying aid to 300 students and slashing it for hundreds of others.

title: Son of Sponsor Not Allowed in Race
description: POINT PLEASANT, N. J., July 15  They won't let Rocky race his boat tomorrow in the Benihana Grand Prix off the Jersey shore between Asbury Park and Barnegat Inlet because he, or his company, put up the money that made this event a reality. Suppose he won his own prize money. It just wouldn't be right, according to the 42 competitors.

title: Nixon Is Not Invited To Launching of Apollo
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., July 15 (AP)The man whose signature set in motion the final plans for the ApolloSoyuz mission did not attend today's launching of the American spaceship. Former President Richard M. Nixon was not invited.

title: A Word on the Fresh
description: One of the most fascinating aspects of the palatal revolution that has occurred in the United States during the last couple of decades has been an extraordinary increase in the use of herbs, spices and other natural seasonings.

title: Rights Groups Assail U.S. Move To Reduce Investigations of Bias
description: WASHINGTON, July 15Joseph L. Rauh Jr., counsel for a civil rights coalition, charged today that the decision by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to reduce sharply its Investigations of individual discrimination complaints was an attempt to put, pressure on the courts to ease their civil rights enforcement rulings.

title: DOLLAR KEEPS MOST OF ITS RECENT GAINS
description: BRUSSELS, July 15 (UPI)The dollar was mixed In trading on European money markets today but kept most of its recent gains.

title: CHARLES WEIDMAN DEAN OF DANCE, 73
description: Charles Weidman, a dean of modern dance who danced, choreographed and taught dancing for more than 50 years, was found dead in bed at his studiohome, at 102 West 29th Street, yesterday by his principal dancer and assistant secretary, Barry Barychko. Mr. Weidman would have been 74 years old next week.

title: Oil Appeal Being Planned By Occidental Petroleum
description: LOS ANGELES, July 15 (Reuters)  The Occidental Petroleum Corporati said today it would appeal a ruling in the Federal District Court for Western Louisiana that entered summary judgments in favor of the Buttes Gas and Oil Company.

title: Article 1  No Title
Lawyer for Bankrupt Concern Is Told to Pay $24,105 Debt
description: TRENTON, July 15 (UPI)The State Supreme Court had ruled that a lawyer for a bankrupt building concern must pay a $24,105 debt to a Matawan engineering contractor.

title: Some Phone Users Mast Pay on Sept. 1 For Directory Help
description: Customers of the New York Telephone. Company will start paying for directory assistance calls on Sept. 1 for the first time since telephone service was inaugurated here in 1878.

title: FLORIDA LAUNCH
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., July 15Three American astronauts rode an Apollo spaceship into orbit today to begin their part in the historic rendezvous in space between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Chinatown Police Leaflets Allege Activist Campaign
description: Officers of the Fifth Precinct in Chinatown have distributed leaflets in the neighborhood warning of a possible breakdown in police protection because of an alleged campaign against them by political actists.

title: Exxon Canada Gifts $234,000 Each Year
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 Imperial Oil, Ltd., the Canadian affiliate of the Exxon Corporation, disclosed today that it had contributed an average of $234,000 a year to Canadian political parties for the last five years.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: * Includes $3.800.000 in discontinued operations in 1974. **After $775,000 tax credit in 1975 and $2,090,000 in 1974.

title: Oil Decontrol Plan Vague to Analysts
description: The oil industry, as expected, received President Ford's announcemtnt of his intention to phase out price controls on domestic crude oil with almost universal favor.

title: Broz, Long Jumper, Dies
description: PRAGUE, July 15 (UPI)Jaroslav Broz, the holder of the Czechoslovak record of 26 feet 1 inch in the long jump, died today at the age of 25, the Czech press agency Ceteka reported. It did not give the cause of death. Broz won the medal at the European indoor championships in Grenoble in 1972.

title: Beame NuisanceTax Plan Meets Council Opposition
description: A spokesman for Mayor Beame said yesterday that the $37.6million to be derived from a package of nuisance taxes would be broadly distributed among city agencies to restore jobs.

title: Report Calls Central Park Safer But It Also Urges Certain Care
description: Citing two recent daytime attacks in Central Park, the city's Parks Administrator and the commanding officer of the Central Park police precinct have issued an unusual advisory urging park users to exercise certain care to assure their safety.

title: Airline Raise Is Voted
description: LOS ANGELES, July 15 (AP) Western Airlines flight attendants voted to accept a contract offer yesterday giving them a 41 per cent increase in wages and fringe benefits. The new pact will raise the base pay of new flight attendants from $474 a month to $500 a month. The pay of attendants with 11 years' experience will rise from $764 a month to $925.

title: Advertising
description: Most college kids are spending more than $75 a month for the fun things in lifethat is, the things that are not included under tuition, room and board. Almost 12 per centnot, it is hoped, including yoursare spending $250 a month or more.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Atlanta Braves, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M. (Television  Channel 9, P.M.) (Radio  WNEW, 8 P.M.)

title: Communist Portugal?
description: Portugal's military leaders and their Communist allies have taken a sharp turn toward authoritarian popular democracy of the East European type and away from their pledges of democratic socialism, representative government and a parliamentary regime. The dissolution of the Government following the resignation of Mario Soares' Socialists and of the centerleft Popular Democratsparties supported by about twothirds of the voters in Aprildramatizes the widening gap between the Portuguese people and the Moscowbacked militarycivilian minority that has seized most of the levers of power.

title: Aura of Detente Glows In Light of Joint Mission
description: MOSCOW, July 16The zephyrs of dtente are outblowing the hot winds of invective in the official atmosphere of the Soviet capital, probably for the duration of The SoyuzApollo space mission.

title: STATE P.S.C. MEMBER RESIGNS FROM POST
description: Alan J. Roth announced his resignation from the State Public Service Commission yesterday. He said he would join the Washington law firm of Spiegel &. McDiarmid, which represents electric and gas utilities in their dealings with other investorowned utilities.

title: OUSTER OF CHIEF OF U.S.A. IS HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 16Preparing to sever another tie with the Nixon Administration, the Ford White House appears ready to oust Arthur F. Sampson as head of the General Services Administration, according to informed sources.

title: Cordero Is Banned 15 Days on Coast
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 16 (AP)Angel Cordero Jr., the secondleading money winner in the country last year, was suspended for 15 days today for reckless riding at Hollywood Park.

title: After 14 Months, Lisbon's Revolution Is Losing Peaceful Image
description: LISBON, July 16With the thumb up and the index finger forward, the man's hand became a pistol.

title: Seattle Mounts an Ambitious Ring
description: SEATTLE, July 16Mr. and Mrs. Jan Kwist came from South Carolina in a camper truck, with a tuxedo for him and a long dress for her. William Cord, a Californian, timed his openheart surgery a few weeks ago so he would be here. And 12yearold Paul Rafanelli of nearby Bellingham in Washington said he wanted one thing for his birthday this summera seat in the orchestra section.

title: Eastland Agrees to Move On the Voting Rights Act
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (UN) James O. Eastland, Democrat of Mississippi, who is chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee agreed today to act on Housepassed legislation to extend the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

title: Giants' Prospect Wants His Back Pay
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., July 16When Skip Parmenter's wife checked into the hospital for minor, surgery tast December, he assumed the operation was covered under his insurance policy with the Philadelphia Bell of the World Football Leacue.

title: EUROPE IS MOVING ON LOAN TO EGYPT
description: BRUSSELS, July 16The countries of the European Common Market, led by West Germany, are moving toward support of a United States proposal to lend Egypt a billion dollars to help cover her balanceofpayments deficit, European diplomats in Brussels said today.

title: LEBANESE PREMIER BACKED BY DEPUTIES
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 16 (Reuters)Premier Rashid Karami's twoweekold cabinet won a vote of confidence from Parliament last night after presenting its policy and affirming Lebanon's support for the Palestinian cause.

title: Mission Brings Forth Large Soviet Headlines
description: MOSCOW, July 16 (Reuters)The Governmentcontrolled press filled newspapers today with what by Soviet standards were screaming headlines about the ApolloSoyuz mission.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: plaintiffs, said that he had circumstantial evidence to support the allegations and that he believed there was additional evidence in the C.I.A. files.

title: FED'S FUND MOVE STIRS UNEASINESS
description: A feeling of uneasiness was expressed yesterday by several traders of Government securities. The uncertainty was reported when the Federal Reserve infected additional funds into the banking system. The Fed acted after Federal fundsthe excess reserves banks lend each other overnighthad moved up from an opening of 6 per cent to 6 per cent. After reaching a high for the day of 7 per cent, the rate fell back briefly to 6 per cent.

title: Gas Supplies Rise As Output Declines
description: Gasoline supplies in the nation rose last week despite a slight downturn in production.

title: Pulp Unions Strike In British Columbia
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, July 16 (UPI)Members of two pulp unions went on strike today against 22 mills throughout the province, shutting down a major part of British Columbia's leading industry.

title: Carey Says Budget Gap Could End Up Cut in Half
description: ALBANY, July 16Governor Carey said today that the state's budget gap, which he originally estimated at $600million, might be reduced to $300million by the end of the fiscal year, next April 1, if the economy had a meteoric and mercurial recovery.

title: U.S. Keeps Persian Gulf Fleet Small As Nations in Region Build Strength
description: BAHRAINWhen the Lasalle, an elderly United States Navy command ship, is in port, she ties up alongside nondescript coasters at one of Bahrain's commercial piers. Occasionally the two destroyers that form the rest of the United States Middle East Force join her.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Thursday, July 17, 1975

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE UNSINKABLE In the local theater orbits you can't keep a the down, judging by the rather frequent dramatizations of HerMan Melville's novel with a new production due tonight downtown. This is Moby DickRehearsed, which inaugurates the summer season of a new company called Theater Q.E.D. in the outdoor courtyard of St. John'sintheVillage, 224 Waverly Place (at West 11th Street).

title: Moscow Will Buy Wheat From Two U.S. Concerns
description: WASHINGTON, July 16The Soviet Union has agreed to buy 3.2 million metric tons of wheat, or about 117 million bushels, from two major United States corporations.

title: Lloyd's Is Offering $7,500 for Return Of Purloined Robot
description: Lloyd's of London is offering a 4$7,500 reward for a stolen robot. It has a wooden head ana body, electriclight eyes, plastic arms and legs, electronic, innards and awsners to the name Leachim.

title: Moscow Is Buying Wheat From Two U.S. Concerns
description: WASHINGTON, July 16The Soviet Union has agreed to buy 3.2 million metric tons of wheat, or about 117 million bushels, from two major United States corporations.

title: Tenants in West Side Towers Lose a Court Fight to Remain
description: Tenants remaining in the West Side Towers, a singleroomoccupancy hotel at Broadway and 76th Street, that Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has described as an incredible chamber of horrors, lost their fight yesterday to continue living there.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The indictment against the third of 13 present and former Mount Vernon, N. Y., policemen accused of extorting money from known gamblers has been dismissed on the grounds that the defendant received immunity from prosecution when testifying before a grand jury. Judge Theodore Dachenhausen Jr. of Westchester County Court dismissed the charges against the man, Thomas Reynolds, 40 years old, who had been on the force for 20 years before retiring last year.

title: NAACP Legal Aide Accused of Stealing Defense Fund Gifts
description: The chief financial officer of the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund was indicted yesterday on charges of embezzling more than $31,000 in charitable contributions.

title: Jersey Repairing Damage
description: For the first time in a week the sun broke through over the metropolitan area for sustained periods yesterday, drying streets and sodden fields. nut in parts of New Jersey, while the sun shone, homes and businesses struggled to cope with the damage caused by flood waters and by torrential rains, which severely damaged crops.

title: Saratoga Wedding For Tad Legere
description: Marlon Dondas Legere of Elmont, L. L, known as Tad Legere, maker of racing silks, was married yesterday to John Ruegg, a widower of Franklin Square, L. T. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Roland Connors in St. Clement's Roman Catholic Church in Saratoga Springs. N. Y.

title: Crew Blamed for Crash Near Charlotte Fatal to 72
description: The National Transportation Safety Board yesterday attributed the crash of an Eastern Airlines jet near Charlotte, N. C., last year to poor cockpit discipline.

title: Kissinger Sees Perils in Solzhenitsyn's Views
description: WASHINGTON, July 16Secretary of State Kissinger acknowledged today that he had advised President Ford not to see Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn because it would have been disadvantageous, to this country's foreign policypresumably its pursuit of dtente with the Soviet Union.

title: Beame Aide Says Mayor Will Not Twist Arms to Get Nuisance Taxes Passed
description: Mayor Beame has no intention of twisting arms to persuade the City Council to impose $32million worth of nuisance taxes that he proposed earlier this week to save as many as 2,100 municipal jobs, a spokesman for the Mayor said yesterday.

title: GuiltyPlea Deal Reported For ExProsecutor Cahn
description: MINEOLA, L.I., July 16The Federal Government, which has been investigating charges of doublebilling against William Cahn, the former Nassau County District Attorney, has offered to permit Mr. Cahn to plead guilty to one charge of incometax evasion, a Federal law enforcement source said today.

title: Rightists in Big Turnout For Burial of Skorzeny
description: VIENNA, July 16  The ashes of Col. Otto Skorzeny, the Viennaborn Nazi who was in charge of daredevil missions for Hitler, were buried at his birthplace today.

title: Tortuga Only Boat To Finish
description: POINT PLEASANT, N.J., July 16Is it possible to run a race without determining winner and then to give the money back to the United States Mint? They came close to that today at the ocean power boat race off the Jersey shore, the Benihana Grand Prix.

title: Personal Finance: Nursing Home Aid
description: Nursing hbmes long ago developed an admissions policy that often required old peopleor their childrento pay a substantial donation to the home as a prerequisite to admission.

title: Rabin Says Egypt's Move Damages Chance for Pact
description: JERUSALEM. July 16Premier Yitzhak Rabin warned Egypt today that her threatened refusal to extend the mandate of the United Nations Emergency Force in Sinai could jeopardize the negotiations on a new Sinai accord and undermine the existing disengagement agreement.

title: Sohio and B.P. Plan A $1.5Billion Issue
description: A private borrowing of close to $1.5billion is being arranged for the Standard Oil Company (Ohio) and the British Petroleum Company, Ltd, to help build the transAlaska pipeline, oil industry sources said yesterday.

title: ... Americans in Sinai
description: Among the genuinely substantial issues is the disposition of an Israeli electronic surveillance installation in the Sinai, once it is evacuated by the Israeli Army under new disengagement agreements. President Sadat has suggested that United States personnel could operate the station and provide Israel with the earlywarning capability that it would otherwise lose by eastward withdrawal from the passes.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNTER DROP
description: Profit taking sent prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market down yesterday after several sessions of increases.

title: Market Place
description: While the stock market and the bond market have enjoyed big rallies in 1975, the municipal market is another story. The moral is that while municipal issues are exempt from taxes, investors in them are not exempt from worriesand from falling prices.

title: Stage: Perkins in Equus
description: Anthony Perkins, so often cast as a psychopath, off the coach himself and working as a psychiatrist may seem quite a switch, but that is precisely what is happening at the Plymouth Theater, where Mr. Perkins has taken over the role of the psychiatrist, Martin Dysart, in Peter Shaffer's play Equus. In another major cast change, the role of the young, diseturbed boy is now played by Thomas Hulce.

title: DAUGHTER'S ESTATE CONCERN OF HEARSTS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 16 (UPI)The parents of Patricia Hearst have petitioned to be named conservators of their daughter's estate.

title: People in Sports
description: Rod Gilbert, the star right wing of the New York Rangers, signed a multiyear contract with the National Hockey League club yesterday. Emile Francis, the general manager, made the announcement but, as usual, did not disclose the terms of Gilbert's 14th contract.

title: Diversionary Diplomacy
description: The only thing that undermines a negotiating process more than a sense of panic is a sense of complacency. The diplomatic exchanges now going on between Israel and Egypt are threatened by both.

title: Tougher State Standards On Auto Emissions Put Off
description: TRENTON, July 16  New Jersey's efforts to reduce air pollution by controlling automobile exhaust emissions were thwarted again today when the start of tougher emissions standards was delayed until Nov. 1.

title: Canada to Reduce Gas Sent to U.S.
description: OTTAWA, July 16Exports of Canadian natural gas to the United States will be reduced because of an impending shortage, the Minister for Energy, Mines and Resources, Donald S. Macdonald, announced today.

title: Article 2  No Title
Exxon's Italian Payments Tied to Specific Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, July 16The Exxon Corporation's Italian affiliate made payments, approved by higher Exxon officials, to Italian political parties in order to get specific legislative boneits from the Italian Government.

title: Abraham Unger Is Dead at 76; Lawyer in CivilLiberties Cases
description: Abraham Unger, a lawyer widely known in the nineteenthirties and forties as a defense counsel for Communist clients, died yesterday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 76 years old and lived at 809 West 177th Street.

title: AntiItalian Bias Is Charged To State College at Purchase
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 16The State University of New York College at Purchase and the Council for the Arts in Westchester County were accused today by a county ItalianAmerican organization of bias against Italians. Both organizations rejected the charges.

title: Pele Goal Not Enough In 21 Defeat
description: For the 13,421 fans who paid $4 and $6 to see Pel and the New York Cosmos at Downing Stadium last night but spent most of the game booing them, Pel had a message: Hopefully, it will not happen again.

title: Trenton Civic Center Fire Destroys City's Tax Bills
description: TRENTON, July 16 (AP) A raging fire sent flames more than 100 feet into the sky destroyed the Trenton Civic Center early today.

title: At the Met, He's the Face of His Country
description: It is a very rare face that can be exploited day after day for 200 years and yet still have new things to say to us. No one would say that George Washington had spectacular good looks, but like Socrates (as we Appraisal imagine him) and like Rembrandt, he had one of the great plain faces that history ranks highest. Where classical good looks decay and deceive, Washington's got better and better. George Orwell might in fact have been thinking of him when he said, At 50, every man has the face he deserves.

title: 16 PARTIES URGING BREAK WITH FRANCO
description: MADRID, July 16 (Reuters)A. Spanish centerleft alliance of illegal opposition parties, ranging from Christian Democrats to Socialists, today circulated a manifesto calling for a break with Generalissimo Francisco Franco's regime.

title: Councilman to Run for Court
description: Councilman Anthony J. Mercorella of the Bronx announced his candidacy yesterday for the Democratic nomination for judge of the Civil Court.

title: Beanie Aide Says Mayor Will Not Twist Arms to Get Nuisance Taxes Passed
description: Mayor Beanie has no intention of twisting arms to persuade the City Council to impose $32million worth of nuisance taxes that he proposed earlier this week to save as many as 2,100 municipal jobs, a spokesman for the Mayor said yesterday.

title: Lauda Choice in Race
description: LONDON, July 16 (UP1)Niki Lauda of Austria, runaway leader in the race for the world driving championship, is favored to win his fifth grand prix race of the year Saturday in the British Grand Prix at Silverstone.

title: APOLLO AND SOYUZ SHIFT THEIR ORBITS FOR LINKUP TODAY
description: HOUSTON, July 16Apollo and Soyuz, two spaceships on separate courses but with one common goal, maneuvered smoothly into new orbits today in preparation for tomorrow's first international rendezvous in space.

title: About the Yankees...
description: The Yankees augmented their eightman pitching staff yesterday by recalling Tippy Martinez, a lefthanded reliever, from the Syracuse farm club. Manager Bill Virdon, despite switching to a fiveman starting rotation in the middle of June, had been carrying only eight pitchers. However, beginning with their game against Texas in Arlington tonight, the Yankees have 19 games in the next 18 days (plus completion in Minnesota of the game suspended after 14 innings Saturday night).... Martinez, 25 years old, was with the Yankees briefly last year. At Syracuse he was 82 82 wonlost record with a 2.05 earnedrun average... The Bombers also brought up Rick Bladt, a 28yearold outfielder, ?? Syracuse. To make room, they sent Terry Whitfield ?? to the farm club. Bladt, whose major league experirence is 10 games with the Chicago Cubs in 1969, has been a regular in the Syracuse outfield since 1970. He was batting .263 with seven homers and 50 runs batted in this year.

title: Papa Weidman
description: Charles Weidman was a large, gentle man, with sad, wryly amused eyes. He made his last public appearance on April 15, when he came up on stage on the first night of the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater, for Mr. Ailey had dedicated his threeweek season as a salute to the veteran dancer and choreographer. Mr. Ailey in introducing Mr. Weidman to an audience to whom he was probably little more than a name, referred to him as one of the extraordinary papas of American dance. That he was.

title: REASON FOR REBUFF OF PAROLE REQUIRED
description: TRENTON, July 16 (AP)The State Parole Board can reject recommendations of state psychiatrists in deciding not to parole sex offenders if it gives explicit reasons in writing on its decision, a state appeals court has ruled.

title: PAY PLAN CHANGED FOR POLICE RAISES
description: In reversal of one of the city's traditional bookkeeping gimmicks, Mayor Beame announced yesterday that the longdelayed raises for 23,000 policemen would be paid with $31million from last year's expense budget rather than with borrowings from the current capital budget.

title: Massachusetts Court Clears Man of Prostitution Charge
description: BROCKTON, Mass., July 16 (AP)  District Court Judge George Hurd ruled today that a man cannot commit the crime of prostitution and found Fred Doane of Brockton not gulity. of such a charge.

title: House Panel Votes to Call Watergate Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (UPI) A House criminal justice subcommittee voted today to summon the special prosecutor, Henry S. Ruth Jr., for questioning in closed session about his Watergate investigation.

title: A: This Noise Hurts. B: What?
description: WASHINGTONAmerican workers are angry about many things. First and foremost, workers are angered over the bitter failure of our society to provide jobs. They are also angry about the failure to provide safe jobs. The most widespread industrial health problem is the ageold problem of noise.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Governor Byrne approved a grant of about 1.5 acres of riparian land to Hartz Mountain Industries for construction of a 300room hotel and office tower in Secaucus.

title: NATHAN BARNES, LIBERIAN ENVOY
description: Nathan Barnes, Liberia's chief delegate to the United Nations since 1960, died yesterday of a heart attack at the New Rochelle (N.Y.) Hospita. He was 61 years old and lived at 20 Lyncroft Road, New Rochelle.

title: Space Institute Set Up
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) Dr. Wernher Von Braun, the man who directed much of the U. S. space program. in its early years, announced the formation, of a space institute to serve as a forum on space goals.

title: KISSINGER ASSAILS WARNING BY CAIRO ON P.N.'S MANDATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 16Secretary of State Kissinger said today that Egypt's threat not to renew the mandate of the United Nations peacekeeping force in Sinai was extremely unfortunate and complicated American efforts to bring about a new EgyptianIsraeli agreement.

title: Age of Reason the Rage of Season As Enlightenment Enlivens Old Eli
description: NEW HAVENThere is a tide among men of learned affairs that, taken at the flood, leads on to scholarly congresses.

title: Dr. Abraham Zeichner, Psychologist, Dies at 54
description: Dr. Abraham Zeichher, director of the Whiting Forensic Institute, Middletown, Conn., died there Tuesday. He was 54 years old and lived at Hamden, Conn.

title: Sets Defeat Ailing Leis By 27 to 17
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., July 16 The New York Sets rushed to a commanding lead in the early events and coasted to a 2717 World Team Tennis victory over the Hawaii Leis tonight before 4,870 in the Nassau Coliseum.

title: GUATEMALA STUDIES DEL MONTE REPORT
description: GUATEMALA CITY, July 16 (Reuters)  Guatemala has set up an offical inquiry today into allegations that the Del Monte Corporation illegally paid $500,000 to facilitate a land deal there, the Central American Government said today.

title: Lisbon Dissolves Coalition After 2d Key Party Quits
description: LISBON, Thursday, July 17Portugal's military rulers dissolved the coalition Government today, hours after the withdrawal of the second of the nation's two moderate parties.

title: Defender Gains In Women's Golf
description: HARTSDALE, N.Y., July 16  Mrs. Albert Bower of Pelham Country Club, the defending champion, and Mrs. Alexander Munro of Innis Arden, the tournament medalist, led the way through the first round of the Women's TriCounty Golf Association championship at Searsdale Golf Club today.

title: Recovery's Start
description: The pickup in industrial production last month is the most convincing evidence yet that the recession which began in November 1973 may be nearing its close and that recovery is beginning.

title: Forbes Unsure On Blow
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 16David Forbes made public for the first time today his version of the blow that floored and injured Henry Boucha in a hockey game and led to a charge of aggravated assault against the Boston Bruin player.

title: Lester Dragstedt, First Surgeon To Part Siamese Twins, Is Dead
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., July 16 (AP)Dr. Lester R. Dragstedt, who in 1955 performed the first successful surgical separation of Siamese twins, died today, the University of Florida Health Center reported.

title: TV: MusicVariety Format Livens Summer Fare
description: Summer weather in New York City: It's not the heat, it's the humidity. Summer television across the country: It's not the quantity, it's the mediocrity. The schedule is topheavy with reruns. Network executives explain that 7 this arrangement gives the average viewer an opportunity to catch up with programs missed the first time around. Of course, the programs may have been missed intentionally. Perhaps the executives have discovered that resistance is generally lower in the summer heat. Or perhaps the practice has less to do with serving audiences than with protecting profits. Perhaps the entire game is meaningless.

title: BEAR WEIGHING A CITY PAY FREEZE TO AID BOND SALE
description: Mayor Beanie, under pressure from members of the Board of Estimate, told them yesterday that he would consider imposing a freeze on municipal wage increases as a step toward restoring the confidence of investors who had refused to lend the city any more money.

title: Earnings at 4Million
description: American Airlines, the No. 3 of the domestic trunklines, reported yesterday its net income in June had dropped to $4million, or 14 cents a share, from $10.5million, or 37 cents a share in June of last year.

title: BEAME WEIGHING A CITY PAY FREEZE TO AID BOND SALE
description: Mayor Beame, under pressure from members of the Board of Estimate, told them yesterday that he would consider imposing a freeze on municipal wage increases as a step toward restoring the confidence of investors who had refused to lend the city any more money.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Soviet and American spacecraft Soyuz and Apollo shifted smoothly into new orbits in preparation for their linkup shortly after midday today. The Soviet astronauts corrected the television camera malfunction that had prevented their being viewed during takeoff. The American team successfully retracted a docking probe that could have interfered with preparations for the meeting. [Page 1, Column. 8.]

title: HighRise Hazard
description: Only quick thinking by those directly involved, plus what a fire officer described as a lot of luck, saved fifty people trapped on the burning eighteenth floor of a midtown skyscraper last week.

title: British Dispute Is On Over $53 Rise for Legislators
description: LONDON, July 16  Prime Minister Harold Wilson's Government, which asked British workers to limit their wage increases to $13.20 a week, proposed today a rise of nearly $53 a week for members of the House of Commons.

title: Inquiry Into Harm Of Aerosol Sprays Is Begun by F.D.A
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration opened an investigation today into thousands of aerosol spray products under its jurisdiction in preparation for a possible crackdown should studies show that such sprays are harming the earth's atmosphere.

title: A Connecticut Man Get 15Year Term For Fire Killing 24
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 16Twenty  three  year  old Peter Leonard of Greenwich, Conn., was sentenced to 15 years to life imprisonment today for setting the fire that killed 24 young patrons of a discotheque in Port Chester, N. Y., last year.

title: HUNT DENIES LINKING BUTTERFIELD, C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (UPI) E. Howard Hunt, a former Central Intelligence Agency employe, says he never named Alexander Butterfield as a C.I.A. contact in the White House.

title: The Misses Cryer and Ford Sing as Well as Write
description: The fact that Gretchen Cryer and Nancy Ford, who first carne to attention as composers for the musical theater (they wrote the awardwinning The Last Sweet Days of Isaac, Now Is the Time for All Good Men and Shelter), are also an unusually good singing team was made evident in a couple of brief appearances during the last year at the Manhattan Theater Club. But even these glimpses of the skill with which they projected their own songs did not indicate the full extent of the abilities as a singing and songwriting team that they are showing now at the Cookery, University Place at Eighth Street. Their engagement there runs through July 30.

title: Coast Copter Crash Kills 4
description: POWAY, Calif., July 16 (AP) Four men were killed when a helicopter crashed and exploded in a remote canyon northeast of San Diego early today. The helicopter, chartered by the General Dynamics Corporation, was carrying three engineers and a pilot. The victims were identified as John R. Ehret, 48 years old, of Ontario; James Walls, 36, of La Verne; Donald R. Hansen, 38, of Etiwanda, and James W. Burns of Huntington Beach, the pilot.

title: Soyuz Uncensored: English Chat and a Fish Story
description: HOUSTON, July 16Informal orbital chatter of Russian astronauts, available for the first time in the Apollo  Soyuz project, showed today that there is a human side to the Soviet space program, too.

title: Neff and Coleman Win Junior Sailing Crowns
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., July 16  In beautiful sailing weather, Stu Neff finished first to claim series honors in Fireball Division I as the Larchmont junior regatta ended today. Craig Sinclair and David Lynn took second and third, respectively, in the division after three days of fierce competition.

title: Cutback Ordered on Cherry Harvesting
description: HUDSON, N.Y.A Federal agency order for a 15 per cent cutback in the harvesting and sale of the bumper 1975 sourcherry crop will mean that millions of pounds of cherries will either be frozen for storage or left on the trees unpicked.

title: Canada to Reduce Gas Sent to U.S.
description: OTTAWA, July 16Exports of Canadian natural gas to the United States will be reduced because of an impending shortage, the Minister for Energy, Mines and Resources, Donald S. Macdonald, announced today.

title: Victory by a Faction in Angola's Capital Creates a Lull
description: LUANDA, Angola, July 16The expulsion from this city of the forces of one of two black liberation movements that fought bitterly for more than five months has brought at least a temporary peace to the Angola capital.

title: Key Center Party Quits Government in Portugal
description: LISBON, Thursday, July 17The Popular Democratic party, the country's major centrist group, withdrew from the Government early today as the breach widened between the ruling armed forces and the exponents of parliamentary democracy.

title: Books of The Times
description: Among the betterknown dissident voices in the Soviet Union today is that of Roy A. Medvedev, author (with his twin brother, Zhores) of A Question of Madness and Let History Judge, a groundbreaking study of the Stalin years. Mr. Medvedev continues to live in Moscow, publishing his books abroad, in a precarious state of loyal opposition.

title: A New Boris Exemplifies Individuality at Bolshoi
description: It says something about the Bolshoi Opera's production of Boris Godunov that the company can have presented three decent but not unforgettable basses in the title role and still overwhelm one with the sweep and grandeur of the whole.

title: STADIUM PROJECT PUT AT $61MILLION
description: A new $1,109,969 contract amendment has brought the cost of the Yankee Stadium reconstruction and surrounding Projects to $57,088,000.

title: Notes on People
description: President Idi Amin of Uganda has been promoted from general to field marshal by the popular acclaim of his troops. According to reports from Uganda radio, the promotion was decided upon by the 2,000 officers and soldiers of the Ugandan Army, who told their chief it was long overdue. President Amin has said that he prefers the sobriquet Big Daddy.

title: Soviet Acts to Provide Live Landing Coverage
description: The CBS, NBC and ABC television networks said today that the Soviets had agreed to provide them with live television pictures of the scheduled Soyuz landing Monday morning deep inside the Soviet Union, the Associated Press reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SENATE APPROVES AN OFFSHORE BILL
description: WASHINGTON. July 16The Senate approved tonight amendments to the Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972 that would make additional funds available to the coastal states to handle the environmental and economic impact of energy development.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Accountant Freed in '72 South Orange Murder
description: NEWARK, July 16 (UPI)Otto N. Nilson, an accountant charged with strangling a wealthy South Orange woman, was found not guilty of murder in Superior Court here today.

title: People and Business
description: William B. Shockley, coinventor of the transistor, said yesterday that recent court decisions were weakening traditional patent protection and tending to discourage intelligent initiative of inventive citizens.

title: F. EDWIN CHURCH, 98, NATURE ARTIST, DIES
description: F. Edwin Church, an artist who was a founder of the North Shore Wildlife Sanctuary, died Tuesday at his home in Locust Valley, L. I. He was 98 years old.

title: Balky Equipment Fixed, Apollo Is Set to Test Its Only New System
description: HOUSTON, July 16American and Soviet rendezvous maneuvers are leading to the ultimate test tomorrow for the only new systems developed for the ApolloSoyez space flight.

title: FORD AIDES PLANNING FOR TRIP TO EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (UPI) White House aides made plans today for a Presidential trip to Europe, probably starting about July 26.

title: A GoldLaden Stagecoach Is Scratched at Monticello
description: Del Miller and Bill Haugh ton had agreed to do the driving, but even Lloyds of London balked at the idea of insuring a stagecoach loaded with $300,000 worth of gold bars. As a result, the goldbar purse for Monticello Raceway's first OTB Classic on July 27 will have to be transported to the Catskill Mountains harness track in an armored truck.

title: City Unit Plans Hearing On Union Bias Charges
description: The City Commission on Human Rights will hold a factfinding hearing next Monday morning to ascertain whether the head of Composition Roofers Local 8 violated antidiscrimination regulations by replacing black and Puerto Rican workers with whites on some union jobs.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BUDAPEST, July 16 (AP)The Soviet Union won the gold medal in the women's foils team event of the World fencing championships today by trouncing the Hungarians, 93.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: tivities or files concerning the personal life and beliefs of Mr. Rosset and the business activities and communications of Grove Press.

title: Saudi Kinn Flies to Cairo in Show of Support for Sadat Policies
description: CAIRO, July 16King Khalid of Saudi Arabia arrived in Cairo today for a fiveday visit to demonstrate his support for President Anwar elSadat at a critical moment in the search for a peace settlement between the Arabs and Israel.

title: Church, Levi Fail to Reach Pact on Data
description: WASHINGTON, July 16Senator Frank Church said today that he and Attorney General Edward H. Levi had been unable to reach a final agreement on providing classified Justice Department materials to investigators for the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities.

title: Article 5  No Title
The Man Behind Joe Namath's Deals
description: On the dance floor Faberg's new fragrance salesman was doing the bump from his knees up with a chic cosemetics manager in a slinky brown satin gown. From his knees down, Joe Namath appeared to he balancing himself on stilts. In the elegant gloom of the Royal Box in the Americana Hotel the Faberg people were completing a twoday sales meeting with a dinnerdance displaying their new salesman. Several hours earlier they had announced the potential $5million contract over 20 years with the 32yearold quarterback. Now, for the second time in a span of about six hours, Joe Namath was wearing a suit and a tie, a different suit and tie at that, which might be a career high for him. In his corporate role, he looked modishly corporate in a narrokvwaisted dark blue suit that he had casually described as a rack job, a white shirt and a dark blue figured tie. He also was wearing Brut; for $5million he might even wear it in the huddle. And at a nearby table Jimmy Walsh laughed as he dropped another ice cube into his tall glass of scotch.

title: Super Florida Mosquito Joins 3 Apollo Astronauts
description: HOUSTON, July 16 (Reuters) History's first manned international space mission has an added participanta mosquito.

title: Apollo and Soyuz Spacecraft Shift Their Orbits in Preparation for LinkUp Today
description: MOSCOW, Silly 16The Soyuz 19 spacecraft, on the second day of its historic space flight, successfully maneuvered today into the orbit in which it will await its Apollo partner.

title: Red Cross Talks to Resume
description: SEOUL, July 16 (Agence FrancePresse)  North and South Korea have agreed to resume on Monday a Red Cross meeting suspended since May, a Red Cross spokesman announced here today.

title: Heavy Rains Threatening to Spoil South Jersey's Crucial Tomato Crop
description: SWEDESBORO, July 16As the rain poured down here in Glouster County once again, Athony Di Simone pointed towards his tomatoes and muttered;

title: Japanese Vessel Is Seized In the Atlantic Off Maryland
description: A Japanese fishing vessel was seized by the Coast Guard 65 miles east of Ocean City, Md., Tues night after a boarding party found more than 200 lobsters allegedly taken illegally from the waters of the Continental Shelf, the Coast Guard said.

title: SOLDIER'S WIDOW GETS $2MILLION
description: A jury awarded $2.16million to the family of a United States soldier who was killed by the accidental explosion of a shell during the war in Vietnam.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Wednesday.

title: New A.M.C. Layoffs Set
description: DETROIT, July 16 (UPI)The American Motors Corporation said today that indefinite layoffs at its Wisconsin carbuilding facilities would jump by 120 workers when the automaker begins 1976model production next week. The new layoffs, coming at the end of a threeweek vacation shutdown at most of its factories, will raise A.M.C. indefinite layoffs to 677 out of 24,000 hourly employes. It is the lowest percentage of layoffs in the industry.

title: MOSLEMS STRESS JERUSALEM ISSUE
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, July 16The Islamic countries are working with more determination than ever to recover Moslem religious and political rights in Jerusalem as part of a Palestinian state.

title: Open Interest
F.T.C. Delays Xerox Decision
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (Reuters)The Federal Trade Commission said today it extended from today to Aug. 15 the time within which it must decide whether to accept the consent agreement with the Xerox Corporation.

title: Exxon's Italian Payments Tied to Specific Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, July 16The Exxon Corporation's Italian affiliate made payments, approved by higher Exxon officials, to Italian political parties in order to get specific legislative benefits from the Italian Government.

title: Nice Guy, Tough Guy
description: CAIRO, July 16Egypt has a Mr. Nice Guy and a Mr. Tough Guy. President Anwar elSadat, with his moderate tone on American television interviews and frequent reference to my good friend Henry, is Mr. Nice Guy.

title: Revenues Show a Gain
description: Net income of Honeywell, Inc., fell sharply in the second quarter and first half of 1975, the company reported yesterday.

title: Gulf & Western Sets A 2for1 Stock Split
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., said yesterday directors voted a twoforone stock split, to be paid Aug. 22 to holders of record July 30 in the form of a 100 per cent stock dividend.

title: Price for Purchase Of Railroad Routes By Chessie Lowered
description: The purchase price to Chessie System of some 2.000 miles of line of the ErieLackawanna and Reading Railroads and a 60mile segment of Penn Central line will be $104.1million, not $115million as was announced last month by the United States Railway Association. The U.S.R.A. is restructuring the bankrupt Northeastern railroads into Conrail, a new Federally sponsored system. and other solvent systems.

title: Democrats List TV Funds
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (AP)  The DemocratiC National Chairman, Robert S. Strauss, said today that the party had raised $1.2million of the $2.6million it needed to buy the time and pay other advance costs of next week's fundraising telethon. The telethon is scheduled for 22 hours, starting at 9 P.M., Saturday, July 26, on the ABC television network.

title: CORRECTION
description: The caption identifying a group of women attending a conference on International Women's Year was incorrect in this edition of The New York Times yesterday. The womenRonnie Feit, Wilma Scott Heide, Carole De Saram, Betty Friedan and Mary Burge Nicholasappeared clockwise from the top left.

title: Peril to Entertainment Seen in 3% Ticket Tax
description: A chorus of complaints is rising from theater, concert, movie house and entertainment union representatives over a 3 per cent tax on admissions that Mayor Beame has proposed to levy on profitmaking entertainment events.

title: Lawyer Named Chairman Of City Correction Board
description: Mayor Beanie yesterday named Peter F. Tufo, a lawyer and former aide to Mayor Lindsay, as chairman of the city's Board of Correction.

title: Jets Get Kicker From Chile
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 16In the confusion of opening day of a football training camp, somehow the disparate pieces form together, as if they were pieces of Metal plucked off a table by a magnet.

title: Events Scheduled During Flight
description: The climax of the SovietAmerican space mission is scheduled to take place today when, shortly after midday, Apollo approaches Soyuz and docks. The first meeting of the two crews is set for 3:17 P.M.

title: Old High Nobility Still Cutting a Wide Swath in West Germany
description: SIGMARINGEN, West GermanySeated in a spacious office in a wing of the redroofed family castle, which towers above the Danube River, Wilhelm Friedrich Frst von Hohenzollern says he is just like any other German businessman.

title: ExAddicts in a Lonely World Establish Their Own Family
description: NEWARKThey do not call themselves former drug addicts. They do not call themselves patients. Or residents. Or members. They call themselves The Family.

title: Chess:
description: Old grandmasters don't fade awaythey open chess clubs. After Frank Marshall's retirement from the United States championship in 1936, he devoted himself to the Marshall Chess Club (still going strong at 23 West 10th Street) and continued to play for the club's team in the Metropolitan Chess League.

title: KISSINGER ASSAILS WARNING BY CAIRO ON U.N.'S MANDATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 16Secretary of State Kissinger said today that Egypt's threat not to renew the mandate of the United Nations peacekeeping force in Sinai was extremely unfortunate and complicated American efforts to bring about a new EgyptianIsraeli agreement.

title: Pick Four Pays $9,635.70
description: Four winning tickets were sold last night on the OTB pick four for the fourth through seventh races at Monticello Raceway. The winners were Adams Chuck ($10.60), Ivey Collins ($5), Clever Rival ($11.80) and lzzy's Aggie ($5). The combination of EHGE returned 89.635.70 fr a $3 ticket.

title: Diver Hurt on Board
description: CALI, Colombia, July 16 (AP)Ken Armstrong, diver for the Canadian team, suffered a concussion yesterday when his head struck the board during practice for the world aquatics championships, which begin Saturday. Two stitches were needed to close a cut on the back of his head.

title: Yonkers Gets Budget Calling for 13% Rise In Property Taxes
description: The Yonkers City Council, after a sixhour meeting that ended early yesterday, adopted a $133.5million budget for 197576 that will increase property taxes by 13.9 per cent

title: Vote on Sex Bias
description: The House, by one vote, forbade the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to spend money to enforce the sex integration of physical education classes. The action could weaken sexdiscrimination regulations going Into effect Monday. Page 30.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 16 (AP)A Federal Trade Commission judge ordered today Liggett & Myers. Inc., to divest itself of the Perk Foods Company and reverse what he called a dangerous trend toward anticompetitive markets in the dog food industry.

title: BYRNE LISTS TAXES HE WOULD ACCEPT
description: TRENTON, July 16Governor Byrne presented to the Democratic Assembly majority today lists of budget restorations and nuisance taxes that he would sign if voted by the State Legislature.

title: Manhattan Hula Hoop Contest Recalls All the Hoopla of 1958
